Reviews.Title: “The pits, really”
Reviews.Author: FlyinBee
Reviews.Content: Travelled with a group of adult students, and everybody was disgusted with this place: Screaming and shouting younger students in the hallways - no sound-insulation what so ever so anyone passing your door will sound like they are actually in your room. Security randomly knocking on doors at 1 a.m. trying to find the rascals. Half an hour breakfast-slots operated by the principle that the ones who check in first get to choose time-slot first, resulting in us having breakfast at a time totally not suited for us. Breakfast variety was fine, though. The beds are worn and have bad springs, are uncomfortable and some are really noisy. The paint is peeling off the walls, and the plumbing is bad - it takes forever to get the shampoo out, and when someone's showering in another room the pipes are moaning. Our room was OK after cleaning, however there were body hairs on the bathroom floor behind the door when we first arrived, and they never moved... One day there weren't towels after cleaning, the other day there weren't toilet paper. No phones in the room, so one must go down to reception to organize these things. Altogether: Too much hassle compared to the price we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Complain”
Reviews.Author: Josephine R
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Hotel, years ago, can see the difference since it's been taken over by Travelodge, decor tired and in need of a spruce. Can't really complain, the room was clean, towels changed and beds comfortable, though hairdriers, toiletries non existant. The Hotel to be fair, doesn't advertise luxury so didn't expect it, good location with bus service and tube not too far away, some nice pubs in the area, would recommend Mcglyns, nice atmosphere. Does seem to cater for school groups, so if you forget that you were once young and if young people annoy you avoid. A group of Italian students were in residence while we were there, but other than the usual teenage vocal..... look at me I'm here....scenarios, no problem. All in all for the price, and including breakfast, which was good value, not a bad experience if you are on a budget it's fine, judging from some of the reviews maybe we were lucky with our room, it was on the third floor and it was quiet even though we where at the front of the Hotel. As the saying goes you get what you pay for. We had a three night stay for a reasonable price and can't complain'

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: Fizz-e
Reviews.Content: Unfit and un clean room, for three people. Radiator was hanging off the wall, hair around the toilet seat. Unclean bath and smelled damp. Reception staff where rude, unwilling gave me incorrect info and left me to transfer to another Travelodge with the help from their staff members.

Reviews.Title: “A disgusting insult of a "hotel". A doss-house, more like!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: RapidAssistant
Reviews.Content: Not trying to let the fact that I stayed in the Waldorf Towers in New York just three weeks earlier cloud my judgement - it quickly became apparent that I had indeed gone from the greatest hotel experience in my life to one of the very worst. I ended up here as part of a Superbreak package deal (like many others, no doubt), so the actual cost of the room is unclear. Nonetheless, what follows makes very disappointing reading. Where do I start? The list is almost endless. To begin with, I got stung with Travelodge’s charge for storing baggage in a locker for £10, or check-in early before £10. Clearly Ryanair-style holding to ransom of people who have no other choice. The hotel building itself is clearly one that was a bit more upmarket originally (I guess it was maybe a Holiday Inn or something) and Travelodge have “inherited” it judging by the corridors and the rooms themselves. And the room, well lets see - scuffed, tatty and very dated furniture, skirting boards with holes in them from where a radiator had been removed, strange electrical fitments on the walls which were now obsolete and no longer used, an early 1980s-vintage radio built into the bedside cabinet that had most of its knobs missing (and didn’t work anyway), the bathroom you couldn’t take a shower in because the plunger on the tap was broken off, there were missing light bulbs above the towel rail (thus exposing LIVE electrical connections), dirty, corroded taps and plugholes on the sink and bath, cracked tiles, peeling paint, mildew on the ceiling - and the light above the mirror in the bathroom had an old candle style bulb (which was burnt out anyway). As for the bed, the mattress was shot, and sagged in the middle. At least they had recently fitted double glazing….about the only plus point I could find. The final straw was the kettle hadn’t been cleaned for months, in fact someone had flicked cigarette ash into it and it had been left - it was so disgusting my partner actually vomited after seeing the inside. Livid, we demanded to see the manager (and presented the aforementioned kettle….on the deskin front of all the other customers). The poor junior on the desk who had to take our wrath went into his/her office for a bit and came back and offered us a refund on the spot. Fair enough - we couldn’t present our credit card to accept a refund because we had made our booking through Superbreak and we had to go via them. But it speaks volumes that the management wouldn’t come out of their office and face us. Disgusting treatment - and to put a junior member of staff out there to do their dirty work….even worse. So all in all a pretty miserable experience, and yes indeed - there is the argument “what do you expect for £35” - but I can tell you that St Pancras Youth Hostel a mere half a kilometre away, is £18 a night and is spotlessly clean and well kept, and I have used it for years. And to think if you had paid the standard £80-£90 Central London rate for a hotel of this classification (as some earlier reviewers have indeed done), you’d feel pretty ripped off. I’ve stayed in some of the little independents in the King’s Cross area - they can be a bit hit and miss as well, admittedly, but none have been quite as bad as this. So how do they get away with it?? Firstly, given Travelodge have four hotels in the immediate vicinity (I have stayed in the one next to Euston Station, and it was perfectly OK, if you read my earlier review), the alarm bells should have been ringing when you look at the Travelodge website and this one is consistently the easiest to get the el-cheapo rates in. Most of the clientele appear to be school trip parties, foreigners on package holiday deals and stag/hen dos. Clearly the management are working to the law of averages that the vast majority of customers (mostly those who can’t speak English) are likely to put up and shut up, whilst just take the hit and refund those that will actually complain. So there are better hotels in this area - there are better Travelodges in this area even - but I can’t understand how a big national chain can get away with this. I really don’t.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as we expected”
Reviews.Author: Susan2309
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights from 8.3.12. Had booked a while ago and paid nearly Â£150 for the 2 nights plus breakfast. After reading a lot of negative reviews I was a bit dubious about staying but couldn't find anything in the same area for a similar price. Had a bit trouble checking in as I tried the self service check in but it decided not to give me my key card for room 4. The young lad at reception sorted out another one straight away for a room on the 6th floor. Unfortunately it didn't work so we had to go back down to reception and were given another room (again on the 6th floor). Our double room was a bit tired looking but adequate for our needs. The bed was comfortable and the room was clean. The bathroom had seen better days but it too was clean and there were plenty of towels. Breakfast was plentiful (sausages were very good) and there were plenty staff clearing up. The area has improved a lot in recent years (I have stayed about 18 years ago and it wasn't safe to walk around) and it only takes 5-10 mins to walk from Kings Cross station. I have stayed in many hotels in London and this was definitely not the worst.

Reviews.Title: “poor, and probably best avoided”
Reviews.Author: kiltedladdie
Reviews.Content: Second nd thrd nights, locked out of room and had to return to reception to get card reset. fourth night, got into room to find glasses had been taken away and not replaced so had to return to reception to get fresh glasses. No extractor in toilet, a/c broken, exposing wiring. TV rwemote didn't work properly, subtitles on and couldn't switch off, no digital chanels, poor reception. Cooked breakfast, poorest I've ever had, sausages, some white scrambled crap that might have been eggs, tomatoes and beans. Last day, no spoons for cereal, I asked for spoons, waitress went and returned with teaspoons. Asked for full size spoons, after anbout 5 minutes, she returned with 1 spoon. Asked for another (with partner), after a couple of minutes, I noticed partner was eating her fruit stuff, so abandoned hope of getting another spoon - she was using a fork. Reception area dirty kettle in room made a nise like it had an electrical fault, but hitting the plug hard seemed to fix it. Room was clean and bed made every day Just noticed someone reviewing this hotel having got rooms in a Â£19 sale. that would be a fair price

Reviews.Title: “A hostel charging hotel prices”
Reviews.Author: LondonKairos
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night for a conference nearby and I'm glad it wasn't my money that was wasted. A work colleague tried to book our rooms on the Travelodge website and the best rate on offer was Â£125, three weeks in advance of our stay. We ended up getting an Â£85 rate on Travel Republic. The only good thing about this place is the friendliness of the staff. Without exception, they were among the most cheerful I've ever met - including the two massive 'bouncers' who patrolled the reception area morning, noon, and night. Why they have to be there on constant guard is another matter. I suspect it's something to do with the hotel's frightful location. Breakfast was good too, but that's where the positives come to an end. The most important factor - the bedroom - was horrible. Peeling wallpaper, graffiti, lights not working, no shampoo etc. There's no way this place was worth the Â£85 my company paid for it. It's barely worth the Â£19 some people manage to get rooms for by booking months in advance. But perhaps the most telling thing about this property was the fact that it was swarming with secondary school students who clearly couldn't care less what their surroundings were like. I suspect they're the mainstay of this hotel on a regular basis. I also suspect they're the hotel's principal source of unsung graffiti artists. Which in its own way summarises how this particular Travelodge is more hostel than hotel. It's just a pity it wouldn't do the honourable thing and stick to hostel prices.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Â£19 per night!”
Reviews.Author: bAbydoLL_1o
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in January for 3 night purchased during the Â£19 sale...so for Â£57, 3 of us spent 3 nights in London....just over Â£6 pp pn!!!! We have stayed here a few times before and as usual the staff are very attentive and pleasant. The rooms were fine, comfortable and warm, we had booked a family room but this wasn't ready when we arrived at 12 noon, so were offered a triple room which we could enter immediately, so we took this. We didnt stay for breakfast this time round, preferring to go to the Pompediu Cafe further along Kings cross Rd. Will definately return later this year.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, value accommodation in central London”
Reviews.Author: dhrNorthYorkshire
Reviews.Content: It is what it is - more of a hostel than a hotel but reasonably priced and reasonable value. The rooms are basic but clean, corridors and lifts very tired and need refurbished. It's not pretty but functional.

Reviews.Title: “Fawlty Towers eat your heart out...”
Reviews.Author: Barry047
Reviews.Content: A reasonably priced hotel in a good location; only a short walk from King's Cross Station. There ends the good news. No plug in the bathroom washhand basin, one day our towels vanished altogether, the bedroom only has a selection of lightbulbs working. View from the bedroom window was of a flat roof below replete with beer cans, millions of cigarette ends, even underwear. Do no members of staff ever look out of the window? Breakfast promised better... until you reach the rope across the entrance barring entry because they can't cope with clearing tables, supplying crockery and cutlery and even food. Each day was as bad. No spoons; then spoons arrive (6 only!) but no bowls. no advertised croissants. Only one toaster so huge queue. No milk. It goes on and on. I have never stayed in such an appallingly run establishment, ever. I certainly won't be staying in a Travelodge again!

Reviews.Title: “Business stay and good value”
Reviews.Author: luvtogo6
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a short walk from Kings Cross, so good for business; transport to the City or West End very easy by bus or underground. Good base for tourists as easy travel access. The reception is helpful in tips for travel around London, and there is a small bar, which does food, in the reception. Rooms are clean, well serviced and very good value. It is not a luxury hotel but if you want clean and functional value then this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Nowhere near as bad as some reviews!”
Reviews.Author: Claire L
Reviews.Content: A group of 6 of us stayed here fron the 2nd - 4th March 12. We were a group of 18 year old girls who were coming to london for the weekend as a quick break on a budget. After reading some of the reviews I was very worried about what we were going to find when we got there. However i was pleasently surprised. When we arrived at Kings cross, we quickly located the route to the hotel, the area itself is a bit rundown but there are plenty of people about. We arrived just after 3pm to check in and there was no queue and walked straight to the desk. The lady on the desk was helpful, however seemed slightly unsure about what we had booked, as she asked us how long we were staying for and what rooms we had booked, even though we had the internet booking conformation with us! We had booked a double room and a family room, the double room was on the 6th floor and was on the smaller size however very clean with a decent size window in bringing light in. The bathroom was again on the smaller size but very clean. The family room appeared to be a disabled room as it had a very wide doors. The room itself was spacious and the bathroom had a wetroom in one half of it. The whole room was very clean also. The only thing which didn't work was the tv remote, which was missing a battery, however we did not bother to ask for one, as we didnt need the tv. The family room was perfect for us, as we all spent time in it together apart from when we went to bed. The room was facing out to the back of the hotel and was generally very quiet, minus the odd siren, or shouting on the street but this was barely notciable. At night we had no problems with noise or other guests heard about 3 doors shut after midnight the whole weekend! The area itself from kings cross to the hotel is reasonable we felt perfectly safe, even coming back at after midnight one night, and 11pm the other. Overall i would definatley stay here again, although i would probably ask for them two rooms again as they suited us perfectly. We all had a great time in London and the location and clenliness of the hotel was great!

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable budget accomadation”
Reviews.Author: Karen T
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my children whilst on our way to Disneyland Paris, it was very handy for Kings Cross/St.Pancras Station, only a 10 minute walk even with luggage and children! The Kings Cross area is definetley not glamorous but i didnt feel unsafe at any point. The reception area of the Travel lodge was clean and welcoming and we were checked in very quickly. The room itself was small but clean and had everything we needed for an overnight stay. My Key card didnt work at first but after 2 trips back to reception a member of staff came up to the room with me and with the help of technology sorted the problem! He was pleasant and polite. Later in the evening we asked for extra pillows and these appeared quickly. The breakfast was fine, tasty and hot and a very good deal as you got 2 free childrens breakfast for every 1 adult breakfast, meaning we only paid around Â£7 for the 3 of us! Overall i was pleased with our stay so would recommend booking if you are just wanting a place to stay whilst waiting to go elsewhere however if it is a special occasion and you are wanting to make the most of your time in London maybe this is not the best choice.

Reviews.Title: “A Budget Hotel in Central London”
Reviews.Author: Valerie P
Reviews.Content: Well. my Mother and I were looking for a central hotel in London to allow us to visit family and friends in the big smoke on a budget. This hotel provided it. This is not the best hotel in London, it is not even the best Travelodge in London nor the best budget hotel in London. It is all a bit shabby. However it was clean and the majority of the staff were British. All the staff were friendly and helpful but not pro-active. The hotel is enormous and there is only one bank of lifts. Only 2 out of 3 of the lifts worked all weekend. We were there over a rugby weekend and the hotel was very busy, so breakfast on Saturday was a bit of a scrum! The breakfast buffet is adequate but not sensational. The evening menu is excellent so the evening meals were very varied and tasty. We were in a twin room. The beds were very narrow but the mattresses were comfortable. If my husband had been there his shoulders would have been broader than the beds and he would have been longer than the bed! There was no chair in the room, but when I asked for one I was told that the hotel did not offer a chair in the room but if I wanted one I could take one from the breakfast room on the first floor as that was not being used, so the problem was solved by me doing the furniture moving. Our room was not cleaned until after 3pm on Sunday. It felt as if there was either not enough staff or the staff were not well trained or perhaps both. Did this hotel serve its purpose for us? Yes, but not with any flourish! Would I use this hotel again? Yes, but not with my mother or husband! It is not great, but it is a budget hotel in a budget chain. It is central and is clean and functional. I won't avoid it but don't rate it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty and unfinished rebrand hotel, but launched anyway”
Reviews.Author: Trade2012
Reviews.Content: Hotel is an acquisition, without any clear brand or identity. My room contained dirt shadows where once furniture, light fittings, shelves, and the missing trouser press existed in the past, as well as mildew/fungus in the bathroom. So this would suggest that the room has little attention. This hotel is a shambles and speaks of a job 1/5 done. I would not stay here again. Much improvement required across the whole hotel. Paid 120 GBP for a double room, this was not good value for me. Try elsewhere would be my advice, unless pay a lot less..

Reviews.Title: “Tired, shabby and dirty”
Reviews.Author: Neilkent100
Reviews.Content: To be fair we were looking for a budget place when we booked this "hotel", however we weren't expecting such a shabby mess. The reception area is like a cross between the police precedent in Robocop and the cantina in Star Wars, its loud, constantly busy, and if you have a problem with your room you had better expect a long wait. The room was basic which is what we expected. We didn't expect the 'matter' flicked up the walls, the soft lumpy bed, the dirty soiled smelly bathroom and the unclean window. The only plus was that the room was quiet even though we were on a thoroughfare. However in the morning from about seven we had to put up with constant noise from the hall as the very long cheque for breakfast passed our room. All in all a god awful place that doesn't even fit the remit "cheap and cheerful" with a million budget hotels in London we made a bad choice with this one. One to avoid at all cost.

Reviews.Title: “Tired but clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: marks611
Reviews.Content: Great location for St Pancras and Kings X stations plus tube. Staff very friendly and room clean but decor in room VERY tired. No plug for sink which has 3 cracks going right across. Light fitting coming away from wall. Bed was comfortable and linens and towels clean as was the room. Our key card failed on our return the last night and it took 3 tries when the receptionist finally returned to the room with us to recharge battery in door lock. Opened the door to find the room hadn't been made up! He said probably because she couldn't get in but she should have reported it (obviously she didn't). Was offered another room but it was late and we were tired. Breakfast was great, hot plentiful and fantastic bacon. Would stay again if we couldn't get a more central hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not very good”
Reviews.Author: neraiselle
Reviews.Content: This is a very run down hotel with poorly equipped rooms in a bit dingy neighborhood. We were put in a very small and outdated double room (had a bathtub though) in the first two days, and subsequently put into a family room of which the journey required a long way down the stairs with our luggage because it was in a location inaccessible by an elevator! This is not very close to Kings X Tube Station either. It requires about 10 to 15 minutes' walk. However, once you get the hang of the area and enjoy walking, then you are soon in the best connected part of London with loads of Tube lines.

Reviews.Title: “17th feb 2012”
Reviews.Author: john N
Reviews.Content: cant complain about price as booked six months in advance and got a good deal , didnt expect much in regard to area as we know what the king`s cross area is like , we just needed a base in london ...........kings cross underground very good as you have many line to choose from. My one concern was security at the hotel we arranged to stay for 3 days each time we returned to our room our swipe card for door did not work and we had to return to reception for reactivation at no time the first two days was i asked for id or confirmation booking i did this five times..........sunday morning police were talking to family in lobby who had had room broken into clearly by staff giving out card to any who asked for particular door. After that security was tightened up though the two staff were belligerent and rude we left a day early as did not feel comfortable and would advice other traveller to avoid

Reviews.Title: “fine for an overnight stop”
Reviews.Author: LiverpoolDiane
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as an overnight stop before catching the Eurostar. The staff were welcoming and friendly.The room was tired decor- wise but clean and the bed was very comfortable. We paid Â£39 which is good value for central London. We even had a couple of drinks in a nice welcoming pub opposite the hotel, (The Carpenters Arms).

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: Becky19845
Reviews.Content: Dirty, dark and old. Needs a facelift and double glazed windows! Kept awake most of night due to traffic. Good location though- just 5 minutes walk to station.

Reviews.Title: “Drink a bottle of vodka and you wont feel a thing!!”
Reviews.Author: liamshelley
Reviews.Content: Travelodges are usually the same ~ Grubby and noisy. This is no different in cleanliness/decor aspect. On the positive side it is convenient for Eurostar and cheap.

Reviews.Title: “As basic as it gets!!”
Reviews.Author: Linda D
Reviews.Content: We only needed a room for one night and that was enough! The room was very basic. It was clean, but the grouting in the bathroom needed some attention. The bathroom was tiny and the shower head had a life of it's own spraying the whole of the bathroom!! We paid for breakfast which was warm. I wouldn't recommend this Travelodge.

Reviews.Title: “a hostel, there were naked people in the room I was given!”
Reviews.Author: hooleyholmezonhols
Reviews.Content: full of students, running around in the corridors all night so that no one could sleep & no phones in the room to call reception. took 15 mins to pull our cases there from the train station. i went to the room i was given and as i opened the door a naked man dived onto the bed and shouted, i screamed, someone disappeared behind the door. i went back to reception to ask for a different room as there were already naked people it that one. got a slightly better room on the first floor but we could ony get to it by stairs so more lugging of suitcases. bar area very much a cafeteria but pizza was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Well located for Eurostar station”
Reviews.Author: Philch1
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located (5 to 10 minute walk) from Kings Cross St. Pancras, however there is a second King Cross Travelodge, which is slightly closer. From the outside, this other Travelodge looks to be in much better condition. The self-service kiosks were all out of order, but there was no line to check in at the counter. I stayed in a Millennium room, which although very old and shabby, was located in a quiet part of the hotel, away from the noise of reception and outside traffic. The room had a portable TV and a kettle with free tea and coffee. A small bar of non-brand soap was provided in the bathroom, which looked as though it had been recently re-tiled. There was no in-room safe for valuables. The bed was comfortable, and I had a good nights sleep. Two of the lights did not work, which meant the room was rather dark. I would stay here again, but only if the other Travelodge in the area was fully booked or more expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Unsure.”
Reviews.Author: Carly1234
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights last week to end a week of travelling around the country - we paid Â£10 to check in early and were quickly directed to our room. We were told our room was on the second floor, so we walked all over the second floor to find out that our room was actually below the second floor - we had to walk to the end of the corridor and then down a twisty flight of stairs which wasn't the easiest of things when we all had big suitcases. The room itself was ok - the view from the windows were the concrete walls outside, the bathroom was tiny and the room was freezing. The best thing was on our first morning in the room while we were all relaxing in bed, discussing the plans for the day, a woman walked into our room having opened the door with her key card (it wasn't house keeping as she had only been and this was a different person). She thought that this was her room! When we went to reception to complain, they couldn't give us an answer as to why this had happened so we were very cautious of leaving much in the hotel room which kind of ruined the stay for us. The noise levels weren't as big as I was expecting - when we came back from our first night out, the hotel was buzzing with people and noise but once we got to our room, we couldn't hear anything (but then again, we were at the back of the hotel so that could explain it). The lifts were very temperamental and only worked every so often which again was a bit annoying but only being two levels up and then one down, it wasn't too bad. The girl who checked us in was nice enough, not very chatty but not rude or anything. The man we spoke to later in the day to get a hair dryer was slightly on the rude side, he seemed to grunt when asked anything. I'm in two minds whether I would stay here again, I would if the price was ridiculously cheap but if I had to pay the same amount again, I wouldn't bother.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Dump”
Reviews.Author: carl s
Reviews.Content: On arrival after a long journey from Paris we went to check in in we noticed unattended luggage in and around the reception area and security not bothering to do anything about it when we got to the room on the fourth floor we found it to be already occupied by someone else, we went back to reception and they rectified it by giving us another room on the fifth floor where there were lots of noisy foreign teenagers rampaging around. In the second room the toilet was blocked full to the top we had to move a third time before settling for the night. The room was grubby and dirty the bathroom was tiny the shower didn't function correctly - all in all the whole place is a dump and I definitely wouldn't reccomend going there. We made a fuss and were given a refund in the morning befor we left.

Reviews.Title: “worst travelodge ever”
Reviews.Author: 60danielb
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night with my wife and 3 year old daughter for our first trip to london, after a long day sight seeing we checked in . As soon as we stepped through the door i was dissapointed. and it imidiatley put the dampener on our weekend We paid 89 pound for what was supposed to be a triple room, what a rip off ! , i have stayed in bigger single rooms. The room was so small we couldnt fit our push chair in it, the three single beds were uncomfortable with just a plain white sheet and no bedside table, the floor looked dirty, the bathroom was in need of replacement and had black mould everywhere you looked, the bedroom had bits of wet toilet paper stuck to the walls and ceeling, and crayon marks all over the walls, the curtains were half a foot shorter than the window.to add to this there were a group of rowdy yobs on our floor shouting and swearing and being verry aggressive in the corridor at regular intervals between 12 am and 5 am. this woke my daughter up 3 times and made us feel unsafe. This should not happen in any hotel and they should provide security to deal with them. iI have stopped in travelodges in other cities before and you usually get a good standard so why does london have to be so poor, if i had paid 10 pound for the room i would still be dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Horrendous -- read this before you book!!”
Reviews.Author: KaiEvs
Reviews.Content: Book this hotel on a super saver for Â£19. Don't get me wrong I am realistic and don't expect much for this price but I expect much better than what it was. Checked into the room at 1 after paying a Â£10.00 charge (which i didn't mind) to find the filthiest room ever!! There was wallpaper hanging off the walls, ceilings were black, bathroom was revolting there was mould in the shape of soap on the unit. No iron.... The worst was it was so filthy I developed a rash on my body. I went to reception to complain and the girl said "oh well what do you expect" NOT HAPPY!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lack of Cleanliness and Noisy”
Reviews.Author: amy f
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a two night trip in January 2012, and was grateful to come back home! The cleanliness wasnt very high, with hair still in the bath tub and a pubic hair in the sink. The building obviously has very old plumbing, as the pipes made very strange noises throughout the night, with the walls being very thin this became very tiresome at 4am in the morning. It seems that this particular hotel is also very popular with school trips with many hyper studnts running the corridors late at night, with a rather relaxed and unprofessional security guard that at one time could be heard telling people to shut the [--] up. Breakfast was a poor show too, with sausage, reconstitued scrambled egg, tomato, bacon and beans looking as though they had been out for several hours. Not very appetising at all. despite this poor reveiw, i will still be using travel lodges in the future, just not this one! I would avoid this hotel at all costs if possible, despite the low costs i would recommend spending slightly more to get better quality.

Reviews.Title: “Budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jas K
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here several times over a few months, and have to say it is a suitable hotel for the price you pay. The staff are accomodating, especially when we requested a room change due to the heating being a problem. The room sizes are sufficient, though the bathroom is a little small. The cleanliness of the hotel was ok, again for the price you pay I did not expect it to be immaculate. I simply used the hotel to sleep in and therefore did not really use it for leisure purposes, which I think is the true worth of a budget hotel. I would recommend it to anyone that is looking for cheap and sturdy! I would however say that due to so many foreign school trips using this accomodation, it can on occassions be very noisy. Location of the hotel is great!

Reviews.Title: “Unacceptable”
Reviews.Author: Sean H
Reviews.Content: I booked a weekend away in London for my wifes 30th birthday. I booked our break as a package so was limited to a couple of hotels. When a Travelodge came up as one of the options I was quite pleased, as you tend to think of Travelodges, Premier Inns etc to be basic but modern and clean. How wrong could I have been!Everything that we saw from the moment we arrived just looked old and tired and uncared for. I hear this used to be owned by another company but that is inexcusable. How a huge company can rent out accomodation in this state is unacceptable. It should be shut down for a total refurb.As we walked through the hotel we could see tired decor and paintwork chip off of door casings and dirty windows. First impressions of our room (room 677) werent bad but when we took a closer look were disgusted. There was plaster and wallpaper peeling from the walls and the walls and ceiling had been sloppily painted, with paint on door casings and plug sockets. Upon complaining I was offered a look at another room by the receptionist, who said I would 'like the other room better'. Is that an admission of how bad the rooms are? Needless to say we got a full refund and checked out immediately. We will never use Travelodge again.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for an overnight”
Reviews.Author: Christyczynski
Reviews.Content: Stayed here overnight on my own recently. I tried to book the Euston Travelodge, where I have stayed before, but it was full and this one was the only nearby Travelodge that had a room available. It's not one of the purpose built Travelodge's but it's an older hotel that has been taken over and rebranded. It's just a bit dated and could use a lick of paint. The room was a decent size and compared to other Travelodge's I've stayed in, there was loads of storage areas. 3 built in wardrobes and lots of drawers, but the bathroom was tiny and a bit scuzzy. Mould round the bath and a few loose tiles. Located where it is, there was lots of noise through the night due to nearby bars/nightclubs with their associated noise as well as police sirens blaring occasionally. I literally only used the place to sleep and didn't have much contact with the staff other than on check in, but there were no problems. For somewhere to stay for 1 night as a last option, it's fine, but I wouldn't stay here any longer or with family. The Travelodge at Euston is much better, so check there first!!

Reviews.Title: “Bloody awful!”
Reviews.Author: FayesieDaisy
Reviews.Content: I would recommend Travelodge in general, having stayed in and been perfectly happy with many of their hotels in the past. However, this particular Travelodge is pretty disgusting. The corridors absolutely stink of a mix between wet dog and cabbage. The whole place is completely battered, unclean and stinking to the high heavens. The breakfast was dire and one of the cleaning staff let themselves into my room at 10am when my partner and I were still in bed. Poor show Travelodge - absolutely pitiful hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel, much better than reviews suggest”
Reviews.Author: Caryne
Reviews.Content: I really do not know what others are complaining about, yes this hotel isn't the plushest in the world and the decor is a little tired around the edges but I actually found it better than many other hotels I have stayed in for a lot more money around the world. As it's not a standard Travelodge design ii is actually more attractive than the majority of them, I was pleased to have proper wardrobes, drawers and bedside cabinets in the room as well as two large mirrors and a decent bathroom. The communal areas on the landings by the lift also have a pleasing art deco design. The bed was comfortable and everything was clean and tidy. I was staying on a busy weekend but the staff were friendly and quickly found me a replacement TV remote control when mine was found to be missing from the room. My only real complaint is that there were only two, quite small, pillows and there were no extra pillows to be had from reception but the staff were very apologetic about it. This isn't a luxury hotel, it's a Travelodge, if you are looking for luxury go somewhere else and pay a lot more, as a budget hotel it's fine but don't complain when you don't get luxury accommodation when you've paid budget prices!! By the way, it's worth pointing out that it's at least ten minutes walk from Kings Cross so if you aren't that good at walking might be an idea to get a taxi if you have a lot of luggage.

Reviews.Title: “DISGUISTING!!!”
Reviews.Author: angeleyesjo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my friend in January and the room was absolutley terrible! There were peoples nail clippings on the floor and hairs all over the walls! The duvet was so thin we didnt even think there was one there until i pulled it back!! And the tv wire was all cut open,...dangerous!! The mugs were filthy! covered in coffee stains! wouldnt want my worst enemy to stay here!!!!

Reviews.Title: “WORST HOTEL EVER!!”
Reviews.Author: 28happycamper
Reviews.Content: My god where do i start...worst hotel i have ever encoutered but seeing as previous reviews have not been replied to i doubt they care about their customers but i will write this review to save others the heartache of staying here. Got tickets as a present to go to london for 3 days so booked here as if seemed central. Paid â‚¬300 for the 3 nights. Hotel is in a very rough and ran down part of London. Room was tiny and tired lookin..no shower gel or shampoo which you would expect even in a b&b. Decided to eat here the 1st night...i had goujons for starters which were burnt black and served on a tiny side plate..then had fish which was frozen and watery..told the manager it was horrible but didnt even get a complimentary tea/coffee..on departure was not even asked was our stay ok..could write more but just havnt the time..discgrace of a hotel in this modern age.

Reviews.Title: “Fair room eventualy!”
Reviews.Author: Wosnick
Reviews.Content: Stayed over the weekend 20th - 22nd January. On arrival at five past three got stuck in a queue of ten people with only one receptionist. Two other eventually came out of the back room to assist. We were allocated our room on the 6th floor. On opening the door it was obvious the room had not been cleaned. The bed sheets were creased and the cover pulled back as if someone had just got out. The bin was full and wet towels on the floor, what a welcome! As we were returning to reception met another disgruntled customer who had opened his door and found his allocated room to be occupied and luggage there. The receptionist was apologetic and issued us another room on the 6th floor. This one was in the newer wing and on opening the door we thought we had been issued a bread oven. Why donâ€™t the cleaners regulate the wall heater? I have experienced this excess heat in many Travelodge rooms. This would be a huge saving for their electricity bill. This room was a basic Travelodge room that seemed to be clean but with an old style TV. The bathroom lets the brand down yet again with a toilet that is positioned so close to the wall you are unable to use it with the toilet roll in place! and a shower curtain that does not keep the water in so the floor soon floods. Overall a poor experience.

Reviews.Title: “Budget and it really shows”
Reviews.Author: estgeorge
Reviews.Content: Never again. Dirty and needs someone with a good brush, roller and large can of dulux. Kept waiting at reception, room was tiny and beyond dirty. In future i'll pay more or take a tent.

Reviews.Title: “A little shabby”
Reviews.Author: Graham52
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in a Travel Lodge previously, my expectations were not high - just as well! Bed clean and comfortable, which was all I really needed - room shabby and bathroom especially so. Location good - not a lot else to say

Reviews.Title: “3 night stay 21st Jan - 24th Jan 2012”
Reviews.Author: Paul W
Reviews.Content: This hotel had me worried after reading numerous reports as I had booked a room for 3 people 1 double and 1 single for Â£108 for 3 nights total and opted to pay the extra Â£5.65 pp x 3 per night for the all you can eat brecky Ok room location for sight seeing there was 15mins walk to kings cross station which was ok, the staff where friendly, the room was clean but a little tired but no complaints there, although there were only towels for only 2 persons but a trip to reception sorted immediately, there were only a few coat hangers hanging in the wardrobe the other 6 would not hang in hanging slots wrong type, but no problem really, no spare extra pillows in hotel so folded a towel no problem. The breakfast, bacon scrambled eggs beans tomatoes and sausage was very very tasty but they do need to get a better warming system as it wasn't very hot unless you caught the fresh stuff being put out, also a very good choice of cereals toast, quassonce orange and apple juice tea and coffee. I was ok with the hotel for the price I paid and would definitely return but not sure if it was Â£100 a night price give it a go on a good deal it more than met our needs as I realise I didnt pay for 5 star accommodation and was more than happy what I got for my money............. Paul from North Wales

Reviews.Title: “Budget, and you know it!”
Reviews.Author: njord
Reviews.Content: One of the cheaper options in central London, it shows all the signs of a high volume, quick turnaround, low maintenance establishment. The staff were pleasant enough but service is minimal. Checking in at 12:00 required an extra payment of Â£10 although the rooms were clearly available and ready.(The option of dropping off our bags in the luggage room also cost Â£10!) The rooms were well-worn and the whole place could do with a make-over. We only booked a week ahead, so a double room was Â£70 for one night. Although it is on the Kings Cross Road its a good 10 mins walk from the station.

Reviews.Title: “Pick your Travelodge!”
Reviews.Author: DurhamUKStuart
Reviews.Content: Now that you can find four or more Travelodges near to Kings Cross...which one to choose? I usually stay at the Grays Inn Road one, the purple-lit one near Kings Cross station, but got a Â£58 room with breakfast deal through Travel Republic...not bad at all for London. Reception was friendly, despite being a busy time of day and I felt welcome. The room was fine, warm enough, a old-style TV but it had plenty of channels and a reasonable bathroom. Half an hour's maintenance by the management with a paint-brush and a silicone bath sealant gun would have improved things a lot. Travelodge's cafe bars are ubiquitous, fair quality and I wouldn't usually eat there...but a walk to find a restaurant or pub in the area, which is a bit gloomy and drab, and some might find a bit scary, got me back there within a few minutes.I felt a bit defeated coming back, but to be fair the service was good and the meal OK. So location is not the greatest, there are at least two more Travelodges a few hundred yards away, plus the Covent Garden one to choose from...search for the best deal and your choice of hotel...this one's OK if you are happy to stay put in the evening. Adventure awaits those who venture out!!

Reviews.Title: “Superb value for money!!”
Reviews.Author: wanderer2012
Reviews.Content: By booking in advance we got a hotel in central london, with 3 single beds for Â£15 that's Â£5 each. Superb value for money. The hotel was a short walk from Kings Cross starton so ideal for rail travel and access to the rest of london by the underground. It was perfectly clean, comfortable and soundproof. Brilliant.

Reviews.Title: “Good location good price”
Reviews.Author: sruoterad
Reviews.Content: Paid around Â£90 for two nights in London, central location. Modern room. Fried breakfast not great but available on site. Twin rooms are great for a lads weekend. Nice local pub opposite for watching Football.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Older hotel.”
Reviews.Author: cazza999
Reviews.Content: I often have to stay for just 1 night in London, on a regular basis, so have gotten into the habit of searching in advance for the cheapest saver rates, at Travelodges anywhere in the London area. I stayed 1 night here before Xmas (Fri 23 Dec 2011). This is one of the older Travelodges (like the one at Marylebone), so the bathroom could do with refurbishing - it's pretty old & worn by now (which makes it appear not so clean, although I'm sure it is) - however I did have a nice hot shower, so it did the job. Had a twin room (single occupancy) and the bed was very comfortable, had a peaceful sleep. Used the self check in machine. Reception staff were very friendly & helpful. They had some useful vending machines in the lobby area. I'd recommend this hotel if you're just passing through London for 1 night, don't mind a very basic hotel. But if you're a tourist (e.g. coming to London for the first time, for a longer stay), try to get a room at one of the more modern Travelodges (e.g. the other Kings Cross one up the road, or Covent Garden, or the brand new Bank one) - just to get a nicer bathroom, to make your stay more comfortable. However, I got a really cheap price here, so can't really complain.

Reviews.Title: “cheap!”
Reviews.Author: laurenjadearmstrong
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from my weekend in this hotel. The cost of the hotel was very cheap and was convenient for us. We weren't in the hotel long therefore it didn't need to be luxury. It is basic but this is what we expected. It is located a few minutes walk from the station which is really handy, especially with luggage, however you can hear the trains fairly loudly from the rooms. We experienced a lot of noise from other guests at early hours in the morning and then noise from people outside however this is expected in the big city and we knew the hotel couldn't do anything about it. We experienced a couple of problems, eg. the room was cold and the tv didn't work however the staff were very quick in sorting these problems for us. I would recommend staying here if you get the cheap deals, however I wouldn't pay a high amount to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel - clean & comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Lau8409
Reviews.Content: A basic hotel, good location approx 10 minute walk to Kings Cross Station & Underground. Therefore not a bad base to explore the city. You are not paying 5* prices so as long as you visit with an open mind you will be pleased. Our room was a family room with enough space for 3 beds & plenty of storage space. The room and bathroom were very clean and cleaned daily throughout our stay. The beds were comfortable, bed linen and towels were of a good quality. We did not eat at this hotel and simply used it as a base to explore so not able to comment on the quality of the food, however there seemed to be plenty of people eating at the hotel. The prices in the hotel bar were fairly reasonable. We would recommend this hotel if we you are seeking a decent nights sleep, a fairly central location and reasonable prices.

Reviews.Title: “Clean cheap accommodation-just go somewhere else for breakfast!!”
Reviews.Author: DiscoDivaYork
Reviews.Content: Stayed on a budget trip to London in middle of August. Main event was to go to the West end theatre. We booked this travelodge as it was handy for us to drop off and check in after arriving at Kings Cross. Found it clean and basic-which is what i expect of Travelodge. We had a spacious triple room. Was a little traffic noise due to the location, and a few dodgy characters hanging around the area, so exercise hightened caution with bags etc, but it was fine. We were travelling with a young child, and we felt safe enough. The only negative thing was the breakfast, which we had paid extra for. It was served in what could have been a very nice dining area. However, it was like feeding time at the zoo. Food all over the floor, not enough food, not enough plates, cutlery and cups. Really not a good experience. Next time would just book the room-there are lots of places nearby to get a better, more civilised and cheaper breakfast! A tip-use their left luggage facility if you need to leave bags-much much cheaper than the left luggage at Kings Cross station if you don't mind the 10 minute walk to drop off/collect. All in all, a basic but extremely cheap stay for the time of year. Just find somewhere else for breakfast....

Reviews.Title: “A faded flower of an hotel”
Reviews.Author: PugwashEdinburgh
Reviews.Content: A bit grubby and tired looking on the outside, do they ever get the windows cleaned, interior has seen better days, chipped furniture, light fittings missing parts, no bathroom fan,(this is a mandatory requiremenr for bathrooms without a window) just the hole where it once may have been. Missing sink plug and a dodgy mixer tap that was either very hot or very cold. The TV worked but who knows what the programmes were. Evidence that once upon a time air conditioning existed, now just an electric storage heater. Surprisingly, good towels, clean and fairly comfortable bed. However,food at breakfasr was adequate, but the evening meal I had was poor quality frozen fish peas and chips, did not eat there again. This could be a showcase hotel if it was brought up to modern expectations, but it did what it said on the tin, cheap but not so cheerful , wont recommend or return to any Travelodge again, they do not live up to their publicity.

Reviews.Title: “Great surprise!”
Reviews.Author: Londoninheart
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed in a double room for 2 whole weeks and were more than satisfied. After reading all te comments here, we were quite afraid of what we will find there. People expect too much for the price they are paying. Room was clean, with a lot of storage space which was important to us because we had a lot of luggage. Bathroom was cleaned every day, and clean towels were provided almorst every day. Bed was comfortable. Our room was looking at the back side of the hotel which was great because we heard none of the noise people were complaining about. We used tea/coffie making facilities daily and coffie was replaced every day. Overall we were quite plesantly surprised and would definitely go back there, it's a great location with a lot of night buses and 5 tube lines really close.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: AngelaCMiddlesbrough
Reviews.Content: Good value large family room, hot shower, corridor bit smelly, breakfast buffet good, late checkout available if required

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Stacey F
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at a newly built Travelodge in London two weeks previously, comparing the two there were some obvious differences - however this is not the hotels fault. I read a lot of the reviews of this hotel after I booked and was a bit apprehensive considering the negativity I'd read but I was quite pleasantly surprised. I'd booked this hotel in the Travelodge sale getting a spectacular deal for central London (under Â£100 for 4 nights). Travelodge do have another Kings Cross hotel which is nicer looking and much closer to the tube but for me, I just wanted somewhere to sleep and wasn't too fussed on the interior so I settled on the Royal Scot instead. Check in was quick and easy, I was given a room on the top floor (6th) and was happy to find I'd been given a renovated room. My sister stayed in this hotel over five years ago and got a renovated room so it seems it's taking them quite a while to complete the project! Positives: - Clean room - No traffic noise - Breakfast room (I didn't use) - Computers/wi-fi (again, didn't use) Negatives: - The bed was a little uncomfortable and frequently the mattress came away from the wall which was a little annoying but I wasn't paying for a 5* so I let it slip. - The room is showing some signs of wear and tear (marks on the wall etc.) which could quickly be touched up. - The lifts were grimy as other guests have wrote about - The TV in my room frequently switched itself off - Shower wasn't very powerful - And finally, this was my main 'complaint' (as such) during my stay. I tested my shower the night before using it to check the temperature (which was fine) but I noticed that the water was building up in the base. Basically it was clear that the drain was blocked so I went downstairs to tell reception which understandably they couldn't get anyone to sort it as maintenance had gone home. But what did annoy me was that the maid/cleaner obviously wasn't doing his/her job properly as this sort of thing should be checked prior to a new guest's arrival. The receptionist gave me a card to another room to shower in which was a 'Millennium' room on the 2nd floor. I was going to move all of my stuff over and sleep and shower there before moving back to my room the next day, however the receptionist advised against doing so and upon looking at it, I realised why. It was a non-refurbished room on the roadside and was quite a trek to get to. It took me 20 minutes to find from the lift as you had to go through separate corridors and sets of stairs which made the matter worse for me as I had to dash across the hotel at 6am across four floors to get ready for work in the morning. To be fair to the hotel, it was fixed by the time I arrived back the following night, it just inconvenienced me with having to go to work. Overall, it was a mixed stay. It wasn't as bad as what I was expecting and the staff were accommodating. For what I paid, I felt I got my money's worth but as for paying the full price, I don't think I'd stay there. A few small improvements could be made to this hotel to make it slightly better. I'd rate a 2*.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as reviews!”
Reviews.Author: Afoodfan
Reviews.Content: Went on a budget and expecting to find the place an absolute tip but were pleasantly surprised! Checked in quickly at 12pm as we paid for an early check in, the room was on the 3rd floor and was fine! Overlooking the back, far from a nice view but meant it was quiet and for the amount of time we were spending in the room we really didn't care! Nice comfy clean bed, more than enough storage space, clean bathroom, warm water, working television and tea and coffee making facilities. Could not fault the room. Housekeeping both mornings was a bit annoying, could hear her knocking on every room more than once 'housekeeping', we put our do not disturb sign up luckily. But overall the hotel was fine, decent location from Kings Cross station and cheap!!!

Reviews.Title: “A run down hotel with a Travelodge logo on the door.”
Reviews.Author: Nimo1981
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for a weekend, and for central London I got a reasonable price. I would definitely reconsider staying at this hotel if you are being charged a premium for it. The hotel is near Kings cross station, having said that, it is further to walk than it looks on google maps ! It is situated on a busy junction, but the noise was not a problem. The staff were very slow at reception, possibly understaffed, and the queue was almost out the door. There were some people stuck in the lift, (which is like something out of "The Shining") so we took the stairs to the 3rd floor. The room was clean and not too small, and had all the facilities you would expect from a budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “You only get what you pay for.....”
Reviews.Author: suemo_12
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Royal Scot over the new year, looks horrid from the outside. Inside was ok, not a 5 star hotel but not that bad. We pre booked breakfast and dinner and found it very good value. Paid Â£10 to leave cases secure and could leave all our luggage, at kings cross it is Â£8.50 for one item.Tea and coffee stocks were replenished every day and there was plenty of hot water. I would definitely stay there again and it was very busy, which I would take to mean people want value for money. Everyone of the staff was pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Very tired looking and run down”
Reviews.Author: Kerry2911
Reviews.Content: Usually stay in convent garden but thought I would have a change as booked this hotel when they were having their sale. Firstly the location is good for being near kings cross,bit of a dodgy area on a night though. Check-in was quick and efficient, went to our room and it was quite small and dated, the remote didn't work for the tv, ran a bath and it was lukewarm water, had to get shower instead! We thought we would 'make do' as we only paid Â£23.50 a night.Breakfast was 'ok' the first morning but the second morning,there were far too many guests for the size of the breakfast area, they kept running out of everything, including plates so it wasnt very enjoyable. The icing on the cake was when my partner got some bread to have with his breakfast and then realised it was mouldy! We complained straight away to a girl on reception who apologised and gave us a full refund for the breakfast as we couldn't stomach anything after that. All in all the staff are very friendly and helpful, the building itself is very old fashioned and run down. Its ok if you manage to get a room cheap like we did otherwise stay well clear, next time I will be paying a little bit extra and staying in covent garden.

Reviews.Title: “Travelodge fails again this time in style”
Reviews.Author: srotideuk
Reviews.Content: Great location, very windy on the 6th floor, could hear it through the windows which made the place sound haunted. It was constantly too warm or cold. The bathroom roof leaked when it rains, which put our mugs to good use. The shower acted like a blocked sewer. They gave you a free bar of soap, with the glasspaper they provided as bog roll. Great place to stay if you're getting drunk in town, terrible for a family and people who prefer a modern look. Stay at a Premier Inn because if this was it would be shut down.

Reviews.Title: “not the best travelodge”
Reviews.Author: Dan S
Reviews.Content: stayed here as it was one of the only places that had availibility on NYE. However wouldnt stay again rooms are tired looking and smells a bit musty.the staff were sweet but ive had a lot better from other travelodges...

Reviews.Title: “clean & cheap, but wouldnt recommend!”
Reviews.Author: sausanni
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights, I am just greatful it wasnt any longer. We checked in with Maria who was about the only positive mention in my reveiw, very helpful and accomadating, it was down hill from there. The reception was a tiled floor which looked like crazy paving. We then went up to our room. This was clean but had a bright orange painted feature wall, not a good look! The whole room needed redecorating, there were rips in the "lining paper" and the paint work needed re doing. There was a plain white duvet cover on the bed and one pillow each, only one spare in the wardrobe. The bed was 3 foot smaller than the headboard! The room was not inviting at all. Tea and coffee was provided and replace daily. The whole of the hotel, that we saw including the corridors wasnt just tired, it was exhausted! Brekkfast on the first day was farce, which included running out of milk, bowls, cups, bacon, in fact never at one time could you get a complete cooked breakfast and there were ques of up to ten people waiting. There was only one toaster working too.We were surpised that at ten oclock people were still being allowed into breakfast and paying for the breakfast at that time only to find all breakfast items being removed by the dining room manager. People had there receipts for payment and yet had to argue with the resteraunt manager, a lady called Anna (wouldnt give her surname) to receive the breakfast that they had paid for. We were frustrated on our own behalf and on behalf of others being treat with contempt by Anna. We decided to take the complaint further and were dealt with by Malick, believed to be the manager. He was superb at listening to our concerns and agreeing that the situation was unacceptable. The following day we are pleased to report a one hundred percent improvement to all issues mentioned. It was good to see Anna clearing tables and ensuring the buffet, cups, plates, bowls etc were being replenished. This saw ques reduced and the flow of quests in and out of the restaurant area without unecessary delay. Plus points, Maria, Malick, cleanliness and daily supply of refreshments. Neg points, A very tired hotel and Anna! We would like to add that we booked the room under a "travelodge room sale" , so we received value for money. Had we booked this room at the standard rate we wouls of been extremely disappointed at the standard of the room we stayed in (314)

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and not cheerful...”
Reviews.Author: pwelch
Reviews.Content: Firstly, I've stayed here on about 5 or 6 prior occasions without any problems, but it is my recent stay which prompted me to review this hotel. I think it's fair to say that if you pay Â£29 a night, you shouldn't expect much - in fairness it's not a bad place to stay (within walking distance of Kings Cross) if you get a low rate. Check in was quick, since we arrived late... We were given one of the Millennium Rooms, which sadly looked like they had been refurbished during the last millennium. Wallpaper ripped from the walls, dirty marks, ugly looking carpet, light fittings not working etc. anyway, this was kind of expected and at the price paid I wasn't too bothered. However, the housekeeping have a special secret that I'd like to share with you, it happened each night we stayed, so be warned! I put the "Do Not Disturb" sign outside the door on a night time (previous experience at Travelodge has shown me its the best thing to do if you don't want to be woken at 8am) however when leaving the room on the morning we noticed the DND sign had been removed - nowhere to be seen... When arriving back in the evening, the DND sign had magically reappeared and surprisingly the room had not been touched, cleaned, no beds made, no towels changed etc... I thought maybe it was a coincidence until it happened again the next day - proving beyond a doubt that housekeeping aren't really interested in housekeeping. On the departure morning, I checked and the DND sign had been left on the door! Housekeeping even had the cheek to knock on the door, hours before check out time.... In all the hotels I've stayed in, I've never known housekeeping play this trick, it says a lot about how clean the rooms are given the fact that the staff just aren't bothered. Give the place a miss unless you find a really cheap rate!!

Reviews.Title: “Our group visit”
Reviews.Author: Helen S
Reviews.Content: 16 of us stayed overnight on 20 November as we were going to a concert at the Royal Albert Hall. We found the staff very helpful and we all had very good rooms and it was good that the triples all had 3 beds. The following morning we went into London for shopping and sightseeing. The staff were very good and put all our luggage into a store room which saved us having to pay Â£8 each at the station. Thank you very much, especially Geraldine. Hope you all had a good christmas and enjoy yourselves in the new year. We WILL be back.

Reviews.Title: “average stay but good value”
Reviews.Author: Davebof
Reviews.Content: The room was small and a bit tired. However it was clean and everything worked. Downstairs was clean. Staff were attentive. We had to pay a Â£10 early check in (Â£10 for a locker so we decided to pay the same for the room). We booked breakfast and this was actually very good. I have had worse breakfasts and worst rooms in london for 3 times the price.

Reviews.Title: “Looks like it's closed down!!!”
Reviews.Author: Joey95
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a night out with friends so wasn't in the hotel period for any length of time, but that was by choice!! + Price - For London its great we paid ~Â£60 for a room for the night Location - 5-10mins walk from Kings Cross, although on the way you do pass another Travelodge which looks a lot nicer! Reception area - Is large and bar/"restaurant" well lit and looks ok. - Condition - On walking up to the hotel many areas of it are boarded up which is hardly welcoming! Surrounding area - A little rough to say the least with plenty of kebab shops and unsavoury types, get a cab right to the entry would be my advice. Rooms - I stayed in the covent garden travelodge and the rooms were 2to3 times the size, I felt a little cramped! Service - Have to ask someone at reception for someone at the bar to get you a drink, seems to be a lot of staff not doing anything. Size - Seemed like a massive walk from the lifts to my room, plus the lifts are hardly modern and swift!! Overall give this one a miss unless you get a real bargain and have your eyes open to what you are booking, 1* which is barely better than a hostel.

Reviews.Title: “Poor for a hotel, average for a Travelodge”
Reviews.Author: kathrynjc
Reviews.Content: We booked three rooms at this hotel for one night prior to a trip to France from St Pancras. The hotel is in easy walking distance of the stations although it is a decent 10 minute walk (so print a map). The downstairs of the hotel is a bit shabby and urgently needs some TLC. I was aware of the upgrade plans when I booked the rooms but was surprised as to how much renovation the place will need. None of the rooms are typical Travelodge style yet and the cleanliness in the bathrooms leaves a little to be desired. We also found that there was a distinct lack of towels and no extra bedding had been left in the family room although three occupants were stated on the booking. The cafe bar is fine, not good or bad although the food was quite good after a long journey. It's reasonably priced for central London, including the drinks, so we were happy to eat there. The staff were very helpful though. There are takeaways and restaurants opposite the hotel so it would be easy to find somewhere else to eat. On the whole our stay was fine but I wouldn't want to stay here for any longer than a night. There are better Travelodges in London if you can afford them but for travelling from St Pancras the location for this one is excellent. We only booked three weeks in advance as well and got all three rooms for Â£150 so the price was reasonable too. Go with low expectations and you might enjoy it.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service and”
Reviews.Author: Anonymous879
Reviews.Content: We stay from 13-14 dec. the false alarm was alert during 3 AM. Everybody have to evacuate during the night. Also, staff are terrible, ESP, the curly hair guy and black guy. they never explain for breakfast voucher which is written WiFI. They never have a service mind. I will never stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Poorly organised, in need of some love!!”
Reviews.Author: polythenegirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in December 2011 with a friend and would not go back. Very unhelpful staff and unwelcoming reception area - desk is dirty and most floor tiles are cracked. When we first got to our room I was surprised how big it was compared to other London hotels, it was also the most basic however. The bed was the most uncomfortable one I've ever slept in and there was a mini egg on the floor so it hadn;t even been hoovered before we arrived. The lid fell off the kettle and the radiator squealed when you turned it up. Of the 4 power sockets we had, only 2 worked. On the first night of our stay the fire alarm went off at 4:30am and we all had to be evacuated. I understand this was not the hotel's fault but the way they dealt with it was terrible. We were standing outside in the cold for 15 minutes until a receptionist came out to tell us it was ok, there was no fire and we could go back in. At this point the alarm was still ringing and the fire brigade had not arrived so how he knew there was no fire I do not know. Another 15 minutes passed with no communication until eventually the alarm stopped ringing and we went back to our rooms, still nervous about the possibility of a fire as we were all trusting one receptionist who didn't seem sure about what to do. The location of the hotel was good with tube and major rail stations nearby but that's the only good point I can make I'm afraid.

Reviews.Title: “It may be cheap but it should be clean”
Reviews.Author: ELWUk
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights as a family. The location is great near to the tubes etc. The bathrooms in both rooms were disgusting, mouldy shower curtains and mould around the bath that was thick and hadn't been cleaned in months by the look of it. Staff friendly on check in, but soon changed when we had to repeatedly go back to get key card to work,then found no electric to sockets in one room. Breakfast was ok for rest of family but unlike other hotels including their own chain, you were not allowed to buy just toast, it had to be a full english or they directed me to a cafe down the road if I only wanted toast. 4am fire alarm couldn't be helped but the lack of staff and information would I believe be a problem if it had been a real fire, nobody really knew what was going on especially if you came out of the hotel at the back as there was no info at all there, but hey it was a false alarm so that may be different if they knew if was real. Yes I agree that it was a cheap hotel and not 5 star,but that is no excuse for the lack of cleanliness in the bathrooms and the ladies toilets in reception made me feel sick. Would not stay here again and would think twice about the whole chain if this is the standard they are.

Reviews.Title: “Good combination of price and proximity to the Kings Cross and St Pancras rail terminals”
Reviews.Author: GrahamSchofieldUK
Reviews.Content: 2 nights, mid week, mid December booked through one of the Â£19 sales. Not the first time Iâ€™ve stayed here so I knew what to expect. In its day the Royal Scot must have been quite stylish with wood veneer panels along corridors and labelled drawers in the rooms so you know where everything should be put. In 2011 this all looks very dated. I was politely checked in a few minutes early. I asked for a quiet room & got room 250, a dedicated single which didnâ€™t feel at all cramped. It was clean and warm with everything in working order. The room was indeed quiet but you canâ€™t escape the sirens in central London.. As I didnâ€™t have my laptop & I needed internet access quickly I used one of the 20 mins for Â£1 terminals in reception. Easy to use though expensive considering that West End internet cafes give you an hour for Â£1. I cannot imagine why anyone would pay Â£7.65 for an English Breakfast even if kids eat for free and even if the quality is good. The reviews on this page suggest itâ€™s far from good. In the morning & afternoon rush hours the hotel is on a noisy main road but the main attraction is the combination of price and proximity to the Kings Cross and St Pancras rail terminals which are 10 minutes walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Not close to the standards of a normal travelodge”
Reviews.Author: CalaCanyellesChico
Reviews.Content: LOCATION - The hotel is a 10-15 minute walk from Kings Cross Station (rail/metro) ROOM - You book a travelodge generally because you know what you are getting, think again! This hotel is an acquisition and is not close to the standard of a travelodge, my room was tiny, noisy (single glazed windows and paper thin walls) the mattress was horrendous, I would roll over and drop 2 feet! The wardrobe contained one coat hanger, this is not adequate for a three night stay! BATHROOM you could not swing a cat in and there are no toiletries. On the plus side there are plenty of sockets in the room for recharging phones etc!

Reviews.Title: “We know Travelodge is 'Budget' but why does it have to be so 'Cheap'?”
Reviews.Author: BigAl46
Reviews.Content: I booked four nights at this hotel and to get the best price I booked each night separately. This caused all kinds of problems with the keycard, which I had to keep on getting revalidated. This rigmarole is a nonsense. The booking system should automatically cope with my need to get the best price for my stay at the time when I make the booking. I shouldn't even need to make separate bookings for each night. After all, it is supposed to be a budget hotel chain, isn't it? The best thing about this hotel is that it serves a hot breakfast. It's a shame though, that it can't compete on either price or quality with the cafes I found about 100 yards from the door. In the room, soap and tea ran out and I had to ask at the desk for replenishment. There was no drain plug for the bath, and the bathroom fan was inoperative. There was no ventilation in the room that I could find. Signposting to room 234 was mostly absent, I only found the room by a process of elimination. Most of the indicator lights on the lifts did not work. There are too few housekeeping staff at this hotel. They were still working on rooms at four and five in the afternoon. Surely they should be finished and clear before the check-in time of three. Staff were pleasant and friendly, although rather unconcerned at the 4a.m. false fire alarm. More sympathy for this disruption would have been appreciated. The staff member on duty when the fire alarm occurred seemed very unsure of himself. He issued inaudible instructions, and his loudhailer merely served to distort his voice to unintelligibility. If there had been a fire, I fear there would have been casualties. I noticed subsequently that the so-called 'alarmed' doors to the emergency exit stairs were being used freely by guests, with no alarm sounding. This surely breaks fire regulations. I spoke to a number of other guests during my stay all of whom expressed resigned disappointment with the quality of the offering. I appreciate that it's 'budget', but does it have to be so 'cheap' as well?

Reviews.Title: “Shocking”
Reviews.Author: matthew s
Reviews.Content: This travelodge is awful, found a sweet wrapper on my bedroom floor when I checked in so obviously not cleaned properly. The headboard had someone's initials carved into the headboard (classy). There were no bath towels provided. Worst of all is hearing the london traffic at 6am having road wars, horns beeping, sirens etc. one guest even had someone else check into his room whilst he was asleep!!! I wouldn't stay in this hotel if you offered me a night with Julia Roberts and I do like that girl...

Reviews.Title: “Worst Travel Lodge Ever”
Reviews.Author: NSBruce
Reviews.Content: Well, on arrival we had to pay Â£10 early booking in fee. The room was very shabby but the bed linen was clean. The shower was in need of a good refurbishment. mould all around the bath a nd the shower curtain was disgusting. Trying to have a shower without treading on the shower curtain. The breakfast.......well... went to cups of tea no cups, no bowls for the cereals had to stand and wait nearly 10 minutes before the milk arrived for the cereal. My husband got a full english and went and sat down to eat it and it was stone cold. He prompty left his breakfast and asked to see the manager. The manager was quite polite and gave us a full refund. Cleaners wondering around the eating area with mops and buckets in hand. Do not stay here ........this is the worst travel lodge we have ever stayed in......

Reviews.Title: “should be ashamed”
Reviews.Author: itsmax
Reviews.Content: dreadful, from the minute we entered reception, staff seemed inexperienced allowing interruptions from noisy guests; in need of serious refurb - mould/dampness round window, poor repair jobs in toilet; only one of three lifts working; on dear!

Reviews.Title: “Its actually ok, just”
Reviews.Author: theposh
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this T.L last night, it was frankly one of a very few options when I booked a few weeks back that were much under Â£100 which I needed to be for work. The review on TA looked miserable but had little choice if I wanted to be close to Kings Cross West end. The reception when I came in initially confirmed my fears that this was a miserable place, packed lines waiting to check in at a dire dark area. But the line moved fast and the room itself (on the 6th floor, are there the refurbed ones?) was new, pleasant bathroom, new carpet etc. Only the bed was not too goo, bit small and somewhat soft but fine for a night. This would not be my first choice, I would not come here for anything special but on my own for business and at the rate its fine.

Reviews.Title: “If you want 5 starâ€¦pay more”
Reviews.Author: Michael S
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights (Dec. 1 and 2) and it was exactly what I expected for the money paid. The room and bathroom were clean, the bed was comfortable, breakfast was reasonable, staff were pleasant, towels were changed for 2nd day and location was good for King's Cross. If you're wanting 5 star pay more money and stop moaning.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Jamie M
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a few nights and based our decision on location and price. Our room was a family suite, which consisted of a double bed and a fold down couch with a pull out trundle bed. All were relatively comfortable. Our room was at the back of the hotel, which meant we were sleeping over a rail line, which to some might be an issue for sleeping in, but wasn't an issue for us. We weren't in London to sleep the day away. The location couldn't have been better with respect to transit. Both buses and trains and the Underground are within steps of the hotel. There were a lot of small diners, pizza shops, convenience stores, etc. in the area which was convenient. All in all, you get what you pay for. It's an inexpensive hotel room in a good location, it's not a 5-star luxury resort. If you want excellent service and plush luxurious surroundings, you might want to look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Worst ever”
Reviews.Author: joys-of-spring
Reviews.Content: This has to be the worst travelodge we've ever stayed in and thankfully had only booked for 1 night. For the first time ever we could not eat the breakfast which was absolutely awful. Staff were disinterested, customer service appalling - eg staff showing back to us whilst booking in with not an ounce of a welcome and then having ordered and paid for an evening drink was asked by another member of staff if we had paid who wasn't even serving us. Rooms old, bathroom showing many signs of rust and not particularly clean, rough toilet paper, corridors shabby even had carpet rising up which could have caused tripping if not seen soon enough.
