We've done travelodge over the years so it is fair to make the statement that we felt it was the worst ever and believe that as a company they need to up their game as now our children are older and we do not HAVE to stay with them they have certainly put us off staying with them again. We wouldnt want to take anybody there.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: The_Uninvited_Guest
Reviews.Content: I have mixed feelings about this hotel. Travelodge standards vary across hotels and this one, structurally speaking, was very average; however, it is a stone's throw from King's Cross, which is very handy. There's not much to do about the room... it felt like it could do with some refurbishing. Matresses in the room were not particularly good and I woke up with slight back stiffness. Decor wise, the room had an average feel with some dodgy finish on the walls, random spots and a couple of lightbulbs missing. Room and bathroom were clean though. Price wise, I found good that I was able to book any room (single, double or family --which has a double bed plus an additional one) for Â£69. That was cheap and was an incentive for thinking that I would go back if I need to go to London overnight. The room I stayed in was a family room located at the back so not much noise beyond reasonable --ie, groups of lads coming back presumably from a night out. In terms of the room layout, size was good for a couple but for a family room I felt it was small if you have more than one child. The window was of medium size and located rather high up (a child would not be able to look outside), and it has a security device that does not allow it to open more than a few inches. There were two wall radiators that seemed rather old and a bit rusty (I didn't risk trying to work those ones out but felt that I didn't need to either as it was neither cold nor hot). There was a TV (old but worked OK) and a kettle with three cups plus coffee sachets. There was no phone so if anything, you have to do to reception. I paid an extra for WiFi and it worked perfectly. Overall, nothing impressive but got me through the night. The only redeeming feature comes by the hand of front desk staff, who are all very diligent and went out of their way to help out --I not only experienced this myself but whilst I was waiting, I saw them in action with other guests. They really work it!

Reviews.Title: “It's a Travel Lodge .”
Reviews.Author: sand072
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night. Location is good, 3-4 mins walk from the station. Check in was friendly and efficient. The room was so much better than we expected ! we were expecting the worst but was pleasantly surprised, the bedding was clean and the bathroom was clean, Yes there is noise from the railway but this is Kings Cross . It was just a base and that is exactly what it is ,!

Reviews.Title: “Expected something terrible but not the case”
Reviews.Author: aford11
Reviews.Content: Having read previous reviews about the cleanliness and miserable staff at this Hotel, I was really worried about what I would find. However, I needn't have worried - our room was clean and looked as if it had recently been refurbished. I did have one small complaint, however - there wasn't a plug in the sink in the bathroom so we had to wash under a running tap. Yes, the bathroom was small but was adequate for the overnight stay we had. The traffic noise didn't disturb us but we could hear something like an extractor fan running all night (not the one in our bathroom) and every so often there was a sound like someone blowing a bugle (it could possibly have been the lift as we were just behind it). Breakfast was more than adequate with the hot food plates being filled up as soon as they were empty. Maybe a choice of eggs would be good for those who don't like scrambled but other than that we could find nothing to complain about. The staff on reception and at breakfast were friendly and dealt with us quickly. The man on the bar on the night didn't have much idea about wine - I asked for a medium white and was told I could have small or large. When I explained I meant medium rather than dry he said he hadn't tried any of the wines so didn't know what they were so I could have red or white! At this point I gave up and had a Malibu instead. He also disappeared for 20 minutes at one point. The prices were reasonable which was a bonus. Overall, this Hotel was satisfactory and more than adequate for our one night stay, especially for the price we paid. It has to be bourne in mind, this Hotel is not expensive but is still in London and you get what you pay for - if you want super luxury you need to pay super luxury prices but for somewhere just to sleep this certainly meets the need.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel ever!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: els6876
Reviews.Content: Awful hotel, check in staff put us in wrong room, when we finally got to correct room it was dirty, shabby and tiny. Did not use shower as bathroom was unclean and mouldy. Mattress was sunken in the middle and needs to be replaced. Breakfast was a shambles with cold food and no plates or cups! Its a budget hotel so you defiantly get what you pay for however the room was Â£100 per night. Luckily we were here for 1 night only but if it had been a longer break we would have definatly moved hotels. I will never stay with another travelodge it was disgusting!

Reviews.Title: “Just awful.”
Reviews.Author: Tommo44
Reviews.Content: Ranks with the Manchester Central as worst of the Travelodge chain ive stayed in. Initial checking in delayed as they couldnt find my booking on the system, despite my having a printed copy of booking with me. Receptionist Katie was very helpful but it still took 20 minutes to rectify. Hotel public areas very busy, including 2 police officers who were in the process of questioning a guest near the lifts. Lifts filthy, scruffy and antiquated. Corridor to room musty smelling, carpets grubby, poor lighting. My room 425 classed as a Single, but incorporated 3 child size single beds at a width of just 2 feet each. Strange smell in room. Lighting,again,poor. Bathroom small, poor water pressure for shower. Grubby and dirty marks all over walls. Carpet slightly sticky. Decided to eat with work colleague at in-house restaurant. Reasonably priced food but poor quality.Overdone and almost burnt. Sleep pretty much impossible, constant slamming doors throughout night, music coming from somewhere at a deep bass, lots of arguing between people in corridor for long periods of time, more slamming doors etc etc etc. Work colleague experienced same problems 6 doors further down, though at least my room didnt have what looked like dried excrement on carpet or blood spattered bathroom wall like hers did. Breakfast really not good, tinned fruit, fat soaked bacon and sausage, diluted fruit juice, sour tasting coffee. A pool of rank smelling water appeared on the floor apparently from the juice dispenser right next to out table halfway through breakfast. A yellow plastic hazard sign was placed over it but no attempt made to mop or clear it up. Absolutely nothing to recommend about this hotel at all.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but shabby around the edges!”
Reviews.Author: Carl H
Reviews.Content: Stayed in room 102 on the first floor, which was a basic double bed en-suite room. Nothing remarkable about the room, it was clean, tidy and warm however quite shabby around the edges. The towels and sheets were clean, and the bed was comfy. Check in was quick and simple, getting access to our room at 1:30pm rather than the earlier checking 2pm. What more do you expect in central London for Â£45 per night?

Reviews.Title: “DISAPPOINTING ROOMS - IN NEED OF UPGRADING”
Reviews.Author: NICHOLAS042
Reviews.Content: This used to be a good Travelodge but is now average and if it doesn't improve will get as worse as Farringdon. Stayed at Room 289, the same room I stayed at a few months previously. No coat hangers in the wardrobe, I asked at reception but none were delivered during my 2 night stay. Toilet seat was broken, shower was faulty, grouting in bathroom needed cleaning, sink only ran hot water, no cold, wallpaper bubbling on wall. If I had company I'd have to complain to be moved but was on my own so put up with it. Travelodge are definitely going down market rapidly. On plus side, this Travelodge is very conveniently situated for most parts of Central London owing to its excellent transport links. Food and drink in the bar isn't bad either and reasonably priced. The Star chip shop across the road is excellent for pie and chips and donner kebabs!!

Reviews.Title: “Kings Cross sights”
Reviews.Author: Jacksons22
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night in a family room on 1st floor. Missing mirror in the bedroom and no plug in the bathroom for the hair drier borrowed from reception along with iron and board at no cost. Mattress was saggy and well used. Room good size and staff were helpful. Daughter stayed in family room on 3rd floor and was much bigger with better facilities. Good location for us and would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “terrible stay away!!!”
Reviews.Author: paul1101
Reviews.Content: we stayed here on our way back from disney and we were disgusted with the room we were given!! the taps in the sink were loose and i feel dangerous, there was a black mark above the shower and there was paint missing (this looked awfully like mold) there were water marks on the ceiling in the bedroom area which looked like there had been a water leak! please take my advice and stay away!!!

Reviews.Title: “warning”
Reviews.Author: Michelle F
Reviews.Content: this hotel should be shut down i have never seen so poo in my life 6 room changes and each room was dirty smelly and mouldy !!!!!!!! ended up having to bring my small children out of the hotel because of the safety issues !!!! walking them through london to get to kings cross station late at night and travelling 2 hours home !!!

Reviews.Title: “Well located budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: tgsh2007
Reviews.Content: This is an acquisition property by Travelodge and it shows. Once past reception the property is clearly run down and tired. However, despite reading reviews on here to the contrary I must stress that my room was clean, comfortable, and provided decent hot water! The corridors clearly need a refurb and the elevators are straight from the 1970's. I paid Â£59.95 on a midweek night near Kings Cross Station. If you are staying for one night, catching an early morning train, then this is an idea property. Kings Cross/St Pancras is about a 7 minute walk. The area is safe and quite busy. If you are being asked to pay say over Â£70 then I would not consider this property as it would clearly not be worth the price. Checkin was efficient and functional. I cannot comment on the food offerings; however, this is Kings Cross. Don't waste your money in the hotel when there are literally 100's of food offerings just outside the hotel and in the vicinity. To summarise, keep things in perspective, this is NOT the Ritz!

Reviews.Title: “A bit frayed around the edges”
Reviews.Author: Dave H
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights here in mid February 2011 at a cost of Â£30 a night for two people. The room was warm and clean and being on the side was quiet. Like most travelodges it was functional without frills. The hotel was busy with tour groups from abroad using it and this led to problems at meal times. First in best fed is fair comment when these groups are in. Generally though they only stay a couple of nights and we had no problems when it was less busy. The place needs a bit of money spending on it as far as refurbishment is concerned which would improve the presentation of the place immensely.The staff are friendly and try hard to provide a good service. For what we paid, and given the location, it was good value but had we been paying Â£90 or Â£100 a night I would certainly have felt I had been well overcharged

Reviews.Title: “How many Travelodge staff does it take to change a lightbulb?”
Reviews.Author: Spoon235
Reviews.Content: None - it just gets left! Stayed here for 3 nights to visit friends and a concert. Have used London Travelodges before and don't expect 5* for the price but when you report a missing extractor fan (gaping hole in bathroom wall), missing light bulb, broken towel heatrail, and hairspray covered mirror (clearly a few weeks' worth) and they just don't bother to do anything it ceases to be good value for money. The faults we reported were a lack of basic housekeeping and unacceptable whatever the rate. Still, as the place seemed to be full of East Europeans and other non-English speakers, they must assume all guests will just put up with shoddy service. Little wonder 61% give it a thumbs down. Add me to that!

Reviews.Title: “Find an alternative if staying in King's Cross”
Reviews.Author: ttmDyfed
Reviews.Content: This is the poorest Travelodge I have stayed in. Others have been pretty impressive against Travelodges' widely regarded "no frills" reputation, but this one does it no favours. Before I list the many negatives, the few positives; sleep quality - the bed was fairly comfortable, no bed mites etc. There also wasn't much outside noise keeping me awake, only the occasional vehicle siren outside, my room was on the 2nd floor, so maybe people on the 1st floor have it worse. Also, unlike other Travelodges' I have visited, when you book a twin room, you actually get 2 single beds, rather than 1 double and a sofa bed. Onto the negatives, not sure where to start. The room was pretty small, much less spacious than twin rooms in other Travelodges I have stayed in. The bathroom was ridiculously small, literally marginally bigger than one you'd find in a caravan. The room itself was outdated and rundown, and if all rooms in the place are like it, they all need major refurbishment work. The wall paint and carpet looked old, with the paint cracked and peeling in places. One of the wall lamp lampshades had a huge dent in it and the outdated TV (was actually surprised to find had freeview), kept randomly switched itself off, and the power socket was half hanging off the wall.........dodgy!. Finding your room can be fun if you enjoy un-necessarily walking around 60 something rooms before you get to yours. If all floors are planned like the 2nd floor, then their in a horse-shoe shape, with the rooms being the steel shoe, and the lifts being the gap. If your room is numbered highly, i.e 260, 370, rather than 201, 315, to avoid walking around like a idiot for 10 minutes, go through the door on the left when you come out of the lift, as you'll start at the highest numbered room on that floor. If you go, take your own clothes hangers...........seriously. The wardrobe in my room had no clothes hangers, I went to the reception to ask for some, there were none left. That is poor, surely they can afford and be bothered to buy enough clothes hangers for every room in the place??. I think the Â£7 buffet breakfast in all Travelodge's are overpriced and overrated, however in some you don't really have a choice as there aren't other dining options available. Not here. Outside and around this place are some cafes, try them for breakfast. Overall, for the price paid, not pleased. There are alternatives in the area; there is a Premier Inn about 10 - 15 minutes away from this place, try that, even if its a little bit more expensive, I would still recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Oh dear oh dear.”
Reviews.Author: bev s
Reviews.Content: Room was filthy, cold very cold, and noisy. I very much doubt this hotel has seen any decorating or general maintenance since the day it was built. Only one of the three lifts was working. As for breakfast, first up best fed. Apart from those items the hotel was generally average. Perhaps slightly better than sleeping in a shop doorway.......

Reviews.Title: “Try somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: AnnabelleCornwall
Reviews.Content: A colleague and I travelled for a conference and booked two double rooms. When we arrived and checked in we were given rooms that were opposite each other, so a good start. I don't know what had been going on, but the curtains in both rooms had fallen down! I was able to put mine back up, but my colleague had no such luck and in the end went to reception where she was given the key to the room next to mine. When she arrived back, we noticed her arm was black with dirt, presumably from a mix of the window and the curtains. Anyway, the curtains were up at the window in her new room, and her window opened, which was an improvement on mine, as the catch on my window just spun in my hand when I tried to open it. We then discovered there was no remote for her TV. As she had left the door to her original room open, we took the remote from that room but it didn't work. Taking the batteries out and putting them back in the right way did the trick though! I found the shower to be very temperamental and only ran hot now and again, but had plenty of towels as we had taken the ones from the unused room. We both slept ok, but I had a shock when I opened my curtains in the morning (I didn't have a net curtain) to see how close we were to the street, with people walking right past the window. Breakfast was just ok, would have been nice to have poached or fried egg and not just scrambled, and the sausage had a very strange taste, for the price it really wasn't good value. All the staff we spoke to were very nice, but didn't seem to know what was going on, how to work the tills, and were unable to give directions to where we were headed in the morning. I have stayed at other Travelodges, particularly City Road, and this one was not a patch on the others.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid”
Reviews.Author: Dewi2001
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many travelodge over the years and generally found them to be modern-ish,clean and quiet. This travelodge is none of those things. Considering the price they charge, you should shop around. - hot water out of the cold tap - pulsed hot/cold shower - intermittant lift - very noisey - strange guests - food was bad

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable stay”
Reviews.Author: Martin P
Reviews.Content: Dont be put off by some of the other reviews..We stayed here for the night and to be honest you get what you pay for .. we found the room big enough, clean although well used, with tea/coffee making facilities available in the room, didnt find it noisy (best nights sleep in ages) and is well located, all in all ok If you have loads of cash theres always the Renaissence up the road

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs”
Reviews.Author: allan09
Reviews.Content: To place this review into context I do not usually stay in such hotels, though last year had very pleasurable experiences at the Premiers Inns at both Heathrow and Gatwick. This stay was booked by a charity for whom I was doing some work. I will try and remain objective and recognise the cost/value element but there is absolutely nothing good that I can say about this dirty scruffy "hotel". Paint on corridors and doors and in the lifts was scratched and marked throughout, and the box room I was given had not seen any paint for a number of years. The only thing good about it was that it was quiet - though I suspect rooms at the front would be different. This was the first ever stay in a hotel where no soap was provided. The bathroom floor was dirty and covered with hais, the bedroom carpet had not been hoovered for a long time. I tried to use the free wifi in the bar but gave up afte an hour - no problem logging on, but slower than the slowest snail. I decided to have an early breakfast in the hope it would go smoothly- forget it. When I arrived at 07.20 most of the tables had been used and had debris of one sort or another on them - a waitress did later attempt to clear some - why the management do not realise that if they had given her a small trolley it would be so much more efficient and could have carried cleaning materials of which she had none - thus she cleared (some of ) the tales, but did ot clean them. The juice machine dispensed cold water, the supervisor shrugged her shoulders when told, the toaster was on a go slow - you had to put your toast through six times to get it cooked - obviously an energy saving attempt. The scrambled eggs were inedible, the bacon, beans and sausages were cold, though the sausages were tasty, and the coffee - I am not even sure it was coffee...... Enough said - don't go near the place and I certainly will never visit another Travelodge.

Reviews.Title: “A poor example of a travelodge”
Reviews.Author: plc76
Reviews.Content: I'm a big fan of travelodge, they always meet expectations. Always clean basic efficient if a bit soulless. This is a let down it is shabbier than travelodges usually are and it is very expensive. If you have the misfortune to get a room at the front expect it to be noisy.

Reviews.Title: “JED”
Reviews.Author: Jacqueline D
Reviews.Content: Well I've never been forced to complain about much, but for Â£192.00 for two nights my boyfriend and I didn't have a great time, he ordered a room with double bed and when we walked in we had two single beds. Then my single bed appeared to be broken and I kept slanting off to the right or toward the floor. Only laying on my side and a pillow at my back prevented me from landing on the floor in the night, we did ask to change rooms to what was booked and were told no, there wasn't any free.... On the first night 2/3 lifts were working, and on night two after walking about London from 11 am till 8pm we were so so tired, and came back to see only 1/3 lifts were now working.... Now we weren't far up floor wise but we were shattered and very dissapointed. I came all the way down from Scotland for the week and toward the end of my trip that is when we went into London and stayed here to end a good week, sadly my back is still in agony 4days later, and I will NEVER EVER STAY IN A TRAVELLODGE AGAIN. Over priced and most run down places I've ever stayed, it was deffo the worst one I have been in. Premier Inn's from now on, cleaner, better kept, beds are what you ask for!!, clean beds not broken either.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy but central location”
Reviews.Author: BlueOctober031111
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights while seeing a band at the O2 Academy in Islington. Thanks in no small part to the hotel's Housekeeping staff, this is quite possibly the noisiest hotel we've ever stayed in. The first morning of our stay, despite putting the Do Not Disturb sign on the door, Housekeeping knocked at 9.20am to gain access to the room. On the third (and thankfully last) morning of our stay, Housekeeping actually entered the room while we were still in bed, even though we both responded to their knocking by telling them not to come in. They either didn't hear or didn't understand English! That said, the room was clean enough, the shower worked (although by Day 3 the water was definitely not as hot as on Day 1), both the bedroom and bathroom had windows that could be opened, and hotel security was pretty good (you needed a room keycard to go beyond the main Reception area). While not particularly cheap or good value for money, the hotel was within walking distance of the O2 Academy and, depending on your age, general fitness and footware, most other London tourist attractions. If a good night's sleep is important to you, avoid this place like the plague!

Reviews.Title: “Nearly Nice”
Reviews.Author: Michaellaw123
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1 night in family room after booking on line. price was Â£ 86.00 for 3 including breakfast. The price was good compared to other accomadation. Hotel is 5 mins walk from underground station. Arrived at 7.00 pm and receptionist was helpful. Found room which had not been cleaned since last people with towels on floor e.t.c.. After going back to reception was given another room. Went to bar for drink which was nice and then to bed. Got up early for breakfast which was supposed to start at 8.00 am. Was told that breakfast was running 10 mins late. In the mean time lots more people arrived and things were bedlum to say the least. When we did mange to get breakfast it was lucky we were not in any rush. Travelodge should be able to run things better than this as it is just basic organisation and down to management.

Reviews.Title: “Only worth it if you get it cheap!”
Reviews.Author: jbpartymarquees
Reviews.Content: Wouldnt stay here again - only really worth it if you get it at a cheap rate. Room clean and shower warm although the room is small - no kettle but coffee and tea bags ?- the whole place stunk like a old peoples home, had a triple room, bed was that small if you rolled over you will fall out, Apart from that ok...ish

Reviews.Title: “cheap but very basic”
Reviews.Author: LFG_11
Reviews.Content: After reading previous reviews I was very worried about staying here. I was very relieved to find our room was clean and not smelly! We had a triple room with three tiny beds and a bathroom which was probably the smallest I have ever found in a hotel. We took advantage of the early check in, and also of the luggage lockers the following day. This was a great deal as it cost Â£10 for as long as we wanted, and were large enough for all three bags. Outside Kings Cross station the left luggage charge Â£8.50 per bag. All the staff we encountered were friendly and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite the worse Travelodge Ive stayed in ......”
Reviews.Author: Jo_Red_9
Reviews.Content: Parking is very tight in the car park - luckily Ive only got a small car but would not have been able to park in the only space available in a family sized car. Payment by mobile phone or change (machine needed alot of coaxing to accept my Â£1 coins ). Check In was fast and efficient, but not sure why staff were customer side of the desk and showed computer screen to everyone waiting in the queue with my personal details on. On considering how cheap this room was for central London, I wasnt expecting much. I booked a triple and got a triple. But one bed collapsed when I sat on it (broken leg). Luckily we ony needed 2 beds, so didnt report it. Walls had been badly patched up with paint, which made them look grubby. Bathroom needed a refurb (rotten wood in places). But the shower was powerful, so made up for the poor quality of fixtures. Positive side - the room was facing the main road and was fairly quiet. Secondary glazing kept out alot of the sound and the beds were comfortable. It was all very clean but just in need of a refurb.

Reviews.Title: “Very basic”
Reviews.Author: ahamley
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights and after reading the reviews was not very optimistic! I was pleased to find it wasn't as bad as I expected, that by no way means it was brilliant!! The room was tiny for 2 people and the shower had a mind of it's own, also my bedding felt damp in the evenings. The area was rather dodgy and I did feel very nervous on the walk back to the hotel late at night. The staff were lovely and could not have done more. All in all for the money we paid it was not bad value.

Reviews.Title: “70s horror movie...”
Reviews.Author: Emily B
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in a lot of Travelodges in the past, and been more than happy with the basic level of accommodation generally supplied. This one, however, was like a cross between a dodgy foreign youth hostel and something out of a 70s horror movie... Kings Cross Road itself is in a very poorly lit part of town, and travelling as a single woman after dark, I felt pretty uncomfortable. The hotel itself is just so dated and dark inside. On the 6 minute walk to my room I was fully expecting a small child on a tricycle to come round the corner towards me. I was really looking forward to getting to my room and locking the door. Until I got to my room.... _nothing_ was clean. The carpet had other people's hairs on it. The bed was covered in fluff. The towels smelled bad. There was a dirty teaspoon in one of the cups. The mirrored bathroom door was filthy. Even the TV was from the 70s. On the plus side, at least this one had a bar, so I had a very large and well-priced glass of wine in a very very very dirty glass. But by the time I got half way through it I cared a little less about the grime and it was enough to get me to sleep. Bed was super saggy but oddly quite comfortable. Or that could have been the influence of the wine. I shan't stay there again unless I have to.

Reviews.Title: “not going back”
Reviews.Author: B L
Reviews.Content: Very poor service, breakfast was very basic and not quite tasteful. Hotel needs some refreshing.

Reviews.Title: “Dont waste your money, find somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: Daveskelly28
Reviews.Content: "Our hotels are comfy, clean and well located. Only a mug would pay more to sleep tight." These are the immortal worlds of the travelodge's teddy Mr Comfy, well im sorry mate only a mug would pay for 2 nights in this place and im glad that i managed to get my stay there for free. Ill give them this, it is well located for getting around central London and only about 5 minutes walk to the tube but as for comfy and clean they epically failed on this. When me and my friend got into my room we were disappointed to see the size of it. As I saw on another review there wasn't enough room to swing a cat and that's not an exaggeration, if your scared of enclosed spaces dont stay here! When we finally got around the maze of trying to find our room, we were greated by rubbish in the bin left by the rooms previous occupants and pealing wallpaper, which I feel sums up the whole level of cleanliness. As for the bathroom you could hardly move around in it and as an epileptic could have been extremely dangerous if id had a fit. The bath was dirty, with lots of dirt matted onto the plughole and a strong smell of urine near the sink. Also there was no shower gel in the bathroom, which was a disapointment but at least you'd be keeping in sync with rooms feeling if you couldn't shower properly! Also, from leaving in the morning to coming back in the evening cans,bottles and laundry that id seen in the morning was still there in the evening time. As for the general look of the hotel itself, outside it does look a little bit grubby but the bar/restaurant area is quite nice and on a positive note the staff are friendly. The breakfasts are ok with a good selection of food, but the toaster is about a much use as a chocolate teapot as it just makes your bread warm. The lifts I feel I have to mention as i was getting into them and the rickity old things quickly closed on my hands trapping them, leaving me to wait in pain until I managed to get to my floor. I genuinely think this is one of the worst hotels that I have ever stayed in and when I travel to London again I will not be making the mistake of staying here again or just generally at a Travelodgeagain because if this is their definition of comfy and clean then I think they need to re-evaluate things.

Reviews.Title: “Would Not Bother”
Reviews.Author: Shaun J
Reviews.Content: Expected a high standard as i paid over Â£100 for one night in the hotel but was shocked at how unclean and dirty the place was. Had to wait half an hour to check in, then got attitude from the receptionist. Room - Compleate filth, nails hanging out of the carpet, toilet had not been flushed from the previous people. Sheets were stained and walls had molde on them! didnt sleep in the sheets as was worried what they would be like inside. Would never gi back!

Reviews.Title: “A not to be repeated experience”
Reviews.Author: angelicmystery
Reviews.Content: Arrived after 9pm and check in was quick and easy, advised I was staying in one of the Millennium rooms on the second floor. I had forgotten my hairdryer but was told I could get one from reception in the morning, there were none there at that time. Ah, the Millennium rooms ............ I stayed in room 2011. Lift to the second floor, along a corridor, through double doors and then DOWN two flights of stairs to a street level room. The room was absolutely tiny, I couldn't even pull my small trolley case through the gap between the desk and the bed, and I even had to walk sideways through this. Plus points: Bed not too bad, not the saggy mess I was expecting Bathroom small, but with clean tiles and fully functioning shower Tea and coffee making facilities Working power points Good aircon Minus points: Walls looked like someone had punched them then decided to start stripping the wallpaper Loose TV aerial socket Street level, so had to keep curtains closed Never did manage to get the hairdryer .......... As my company hadn't paid for breakfast, this cost me Â£7.35 and was very poor value, bacon and sausage cold, so had cereal, toast and tea. Check out easy, that is after I had pushed my way through hoards of rude foreign travellers. Don't think I will be staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Ok”
Reviews.Author: diddldonna
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on 22nd Oct, family of 4. Location was perfect and we found it easy to find. Room really needs painting and wasn't clean. Bed was horrible and hubby ended up sleeping on the sofa and daughter with me as it was too bad for his back and really uncomfortable with 2 adults in it. Staff need customer service skills, not 1 had a smile on there face and looked like they hated there job. Breakfast was cold and not organised at all. Will not be going back again.

Reviews.Title: “Basic!”
Reviews.Author: Spiritus26
Reviews.Content: Travelodge used to be a brand you could trust for decent but no frills accommodation. Now it is cheap and tired. The mattress was so soggy we rolled into the middle. The window was a slit high in the wall and we could not see out of it unless we stood on tiptoe on the desk. Only 3 pillows were provided for 2 people and one small bar of soap. I have since suffered with a terrible neck and back ache due to the quality of the bed. It is near Kings Cross and so is in a reasonable location although there are plenty of closer hotels. This cost Â£98 for the night and was not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Stay!”
Reviews.Author: iandenise_10
Reviews.Content: If your reading this and into going to Fabric nightclub then this hotel is PERFECT perfect spot about a 10/15mins walk less than 5 mins taxi journey. Me and a few mate stayed here on the 21st Oct till 22ed Oct for one night. We turned up and from the outside was a little worried on what we booked into, however never judge the book by it's cover. We went inside and was pleasantly surprised the reception clean and tidy and the staff all friendly. We checked in no time at all and was went to our room. The room was lovely and clean and bed nice and comfy. My only criticism is that the breakfast wasn't amazing, I had cereal and a coffee but friends had the cooked food and said it was a let down so if you want a full on cooked breakfast then you might want to think twice. However the breakfast was good for it's price and will go back again for sure as I think it's a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “ABYSMAL BED”
Reviews.Author: beenaroundthailand
Reviews.Content: Positives , location, inexpensive if booked on the internet in advance & coffee, tea making facilities. Negatives ; tiny rooms, even smaller bathrooms. No room for bags for 2 people and dreadful soft , saggy beds where it is impossible to get any rest. This seems to be indicative of most Travelodge hotels in UK but at this hotel - they "took the cake". Room also had a weird, mysterious noise in the early hours ( plumbing ??? ) but it really sounded more like a ghost. Better value elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “If you are thinking about staying here - JUST DON'T!!!”
Reviews.Author: jml08
Reviews.Content: Booked a triple family room for a night before catching the eurostar. I'd read the reviews on here and was reluctant to stay here, but as I only paid Â£35 for a triple en suite room I thought 'oh it can't be that bad!' - and was I wrong! I was travelling with my husband and son and we arrived around 830pm, on arrival the hotel looks dirty and the stairs to the reception was blocked by groups of teenagers and people smoking. Check in was speedy and effcient - that was about the only plus point to the stay. When we got to the room, the first thing we noticed was the smell of the room - it stank of stale urine. There was dubious wet patches on the carpet, the room was pretty cramped and shabby looking. The bathroom was small and there was mould in the gaps between the tiles. The bathroom made me feel like I wanted to bleach it before using it. probably the most annoying thing about the room was that although the lights worked, none of the power sockets worked - so I couldn't charge my mobile, use a hair dryer, watch tv etc.Reported this twice to reception but they seemed pretty disinterested. Throughout the night, the hotel was SO noisy. There were groups of teenagers running up and down the corridoor shouting and screaming until around 4am, at one point in the middle of the night someone actually opened our room door! - bit disturbing as the door is meant to be locked unless u have a key card!!! it really was a disgusting room, a horrible hotel and a terrible nights sleep - I wouldn't stay again or advise anyone to stay there no matter how cheap a deal you get on it! Fortunately I only paid Â£35 for this, but Travelodge seem to charge upwards of Â£100 for this hotel! On return from Eurostar I stayed at Premier Inn Kings Cross - 1000 times better.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but acceptable”
Reviews.Author: NorthernerSunderland
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights. The price was very good in comparison to other hotels in London. Our room was on the sixth floor. This room was very spacious, basic but clean. We did not hear any noise at all, from other rooms or peole walking in the corridors. The lady on reception said to us that the rooms on the sixth floor are good. The location was very good ,ten minutes walk from kings Cross Station. This is an excellant base for visiting all the attractions in London. On leaving the train station, turn left towards Pentoville road. Then turn slightly right on to Kings Cross Road. The hotel is located on the left side of the road. Overall this was a good choice for us.

Reviews.Title: “Possibly the worse value hotel - ever”
Reviews.Author: Andrew M
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel and paid almost Â£200 for a room as London seemed to be booked up (X factor was in town) The room was small, grimy and no frills, even though it once looked like there should have been a hairdryer and remote control as there was a place name for both items. I stay in hotels for business all the time and all over the world and I have some pretty horrific experiences but I would say this place makes it into my all time top 1 worse hotel. Congratulations Travelodge, no speeches required and please no repeat performance.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive, but clean”
Reviews.Author: MrsHutchy06
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 1 night on a business trip. I booked 5 days in advance and was unable to take advantage of any reduction in room rate so paid Â£130. On arrival the service was fine and check-in was quick and easy. The room was small but I expected that to be the case on booking. The room was in dire need of repair and redecoration, the walls were scuffed, lamp shades broken and dusty and the bathroom had seen better days. The bed was comfy and the linen was clean, the pillows were terrible, ended using all 3 to provide support when sleeping. The room was very quiet and I slept very well. There was no hair drier in the room, I only discovered this when I had just got out of the shower, and I couldn't be bothered to go to reception and 'request' one. I paid in advance for the breakfast as I didnt know if there would be anywhere local to eat, the breakfast was nice but not work the Â£6, there are macdonalds and other food outlets in close walking distance. The hotel location was ok, only a short walk from Kings Cross, it is worth noting that the Pentonville Road exit closes after a certain time in the evening so you have to walk an extra 5 mins from the main station. I was a little concerned walking to the hotel after 9pm by myself but it was ok. Overall I found the hotel over priced and in need of refurbishment.

Reviews.Title: “First and last time”
Reviews.Author: Carokokos68
Reviews.Content: Stayed over in London for work. London was pretty full due to London fashion week, so ended up here. Wouldn't choose it again. the stay cost about Â£120 and would still have been poor value at half that. Had a meal in the restaurant. Given a filthy glass (could actually scrape the scum from off the inside) and not a word of apology when I returned it for a new one. The bedroom had obviously had a double bed removed (could tell from the headboard space) and replaced with 2 singles - except they were narrower than standard singles - looking like boarding school cots. Didn't really feel confident that anything was properly clean. Next morning all the lifts were out of order and someone from reception was coming up the stairs as we walked down, telling us they'd be fixed within 2 hours!

Reviews.Title: “Poor even for London”
Reviews.Author: slemilliere
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my boyfriend for a weekend at the end of September, as I took him to London as a surprise for his birthday. We were hugely disappointed with the whole establishment. The welcome we got upon arrival was luke warm, with staff acting as if we were more of a nuisance than the reason they were there. Over the whole weekend we stayed in Kings Cross, all three lifts were out of action bar one occasion, no apology was given for the inconvenience, and from past reviews, this seems to be a regular occurance. On the first night, my partner and I popped into the bar for a quick drink before going to our room. There were only a handful of people drinking. The bartender was no where to be seen. We were waiting over ten minutes before someone arrived to serve us and even then we were given a frosty reception. The bar tariff on the wall was outdated, and we ended up paying double the prices that we were originally quoted. On the Saturday morning we left the do not disturb sign on the door as we didnt want the room made up. When we got back that evening, the sign was no where to be seen, our room had been made up and all our toiletries had been left just chucked in the sink. When, on the sunday morning, housekeeping knocked on the door, as we had no do not disturb sign to put out, we shouted no thankyou which completely ignored and three women came barging into the room with no further warning. All in all, a most unpleasant stay. We shall not be staying with travelodge again, and we will only be recommending to others to STAY AWAY!!!

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: Princessperkzy
Reviews.Content: Nice little hotel, off a backstreet.. .. corridors and room clean and as expected.. .. staff friendly... ... basic but all that we needed.. .. expensive I thought for Â£72 but needs must..

Reviews.Title: “In need of updating”
Reviews.Author: 71AndyR
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location so i suppose that's what you pay for? However its very tired looking. the room was ok and clean just very run down! we paid Â£85 for the one night, which isn't too bad considering the location. I wouldn't pay any more than this price though!!

Reviews.Title: “Only go if you get a Â£30 deal as its not worth more than this a night”
Reviews.Author: holidaybuddy2010
Reviews.Content: Stayed mid week for business and booked a week before at Â£160 per night (not including breakfast) being a charity we have to try and keep our costs down and this was the cheapest. However how they have the cheek to charge this figure is beyond me as it really isn't worth more than Â£30 a night. The room was clean, by dull, smelt and the air con didn't work properly so I could be either cold with no aircon on or boiling with it on. There really was a smell of sick in the room and the draft coming in at the window wasn't nice. I just felt really grubby being in the room. Breakfast is to be avoided at all costs and there is a real hygiene issue in that the cooked breakfast is sitting out on hot plates which obviously aren't working as the food was cold when you sat down. To pay Â£8 for a cold breakfast is just not good. The kettle in my room also didn't work and clicked itself off after 20 seconds so the only way to get a drink was to hold the lever down which was slightly worrying. The iron i borrowed the next morning had exposed wires several times along the lead and I think that sums the whole place up in that its obvious no one really cares. However on a plus point I found the staff quite friendly and nice and if I had paid Â£30/40 I'd probably sayit was ok, but for Â£168 it just felt like i'd been robbed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Melissa D
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in June and really enjoyed my stay. My friend and I were booked onto a Trafalgar tour that started at the Jurys Inn Islington, but the cost for that hotel was very expensive. I choose this hotel because it was only a 9 minute walk away from the Jurys Inn and it was way cheaper. After reading all of the reviews, I was very scared about staying at this hotel, but we thought it is only for 2 nights how bad could it be. From the moment we arrived until the moment that we left, we had nothing but great service. The staff at the front desk was polite to us at all times and very helpful. They helped us with all of the questions that we had about getting around. The restaurant serves really good food, and the breakfast that was included was great. The rooms are clean, and the beds were very comfy. Yes the bathroom has a little bit of mold on the shower curtain, and around the windows, but I have stayed in expensive hotels that have had mold also. We faced the front street and it was noisy at times, but we were so tired at night, that we did not even notice. The one elevator always seemed to be broken, but we just took the stairs and did not let it bother us. I have always said that you get what you pay for, and this is true with this hotel. When you travel you have to have an open mind and don't let the little things bother you. I am a travel agent and I recommend this hotel to my clients all the time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friedly staff”
Reviews.Author: Frank M
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights here and found it to be remarkable value. Room, corridors etc all kept clean and the staff were very helpful and friendly. 4 minutes walk from St Pancras. Worth the trip alone! Excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “It was great”
Reviews.Author: ukgirl23
Reviews.Content: The room was clean nice the staff was great . I went with my mum and dad and two other people who said it was really clean and the beds where really nice to sleep on and ther no bed bugs the hallways are shabby and the lifs are small but the breakfast was great and we will be back :) it better than goin up 3 flights off stairs like in one hotel we stayed in near ther we we couldnt get anywhere else .

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: pollk1981
Reviews.Content: We stayed over Bank Holiday weekend and got it super cheap for London. Initially I was disgusted by this hotel as it was disorganised, shabby and generally just horrid but my partner reminded me of the price that we paid and the central location. So on reflection we pretty much got what we paid for. If you want a nice hotel you need to pay more! We didnt want to pay more so technically it ticked our boxes!! Breakfast was pretty good, big queues but was a very tasty full english buffet. Although I didnt like the hotel I would stay again for the cheap prices and good location.

Reviews.Title: “Fine basic hotel at a good price”
Reviews.Author: dsmetcalfe
Reviews.Content: Stayed here several times and whilst it is very basic, it's always been clean, efficient service, ok breakfast (although hard to find a seat when the place is full), no problems. It's usually the cheapest travelodge in central London also.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel I have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: simono2000
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one night 7th Sept 2011 at the Travelodge, Kings Cross Royal Scot as part of a group business booking. I can honestly say this is the worst hotel I have ever stayed in.It is quite simply a filthy, disgusting run-down establishment. I have used Travelodge a few times in other areas of the Country and been really impressed with the overall value and service. However this hotel has really let them down. I wish I had a camera to photograph the appalling condition of the hotel and my room and bathroom. My bedroom smelt damp, the windowsill was filthy and mouldy, the bathroom smelt damp too, did not look clean, the toilet seat was broken, the grout was mouldy, the tv did not work, the kettle was broken, the walls were covered in marks and stains, the carpet had a number of stains, the lift was filthy and resembled a lift in a rundown block of flats, the walls were so thin you could hear everything from other residents, the staff seemed utterly dis-interested, the furniture looked old and tatty...... need I say any more!! All of my group (13 of us) were really disappointed and vowed never to stay again. My company paid Â£90 per room, I would not have paid Â£9!!! In fact you would need to pay me to stay there again. AVOID THIS HOTEL/DUMP

Reviews.Title: “Lenny Henry would not been seen dead in here”
Reviews.Author: russ1
Reviews.Content: Travelodge should be ashamed to put their name to this hotel. It is a dump. I have never stayed in a worse hotel. My company put me in here for 1 night. They will never do this again. It was full of Chavs & cannibis smoking builders. If you want to stay in London please pay that little bit extra and stay somewhere else. If your company puts you there refuse to go.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but comfortable”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkTravellers
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for 2 nights. Access to Kings Cross station is easy and a 30 minute walk will take you to the British Museum and the top of Oxford Street. The hotel is comfortable and basic. The hotel is in need of some TLC but was clean and the little contact with staff we had was good. The room was clean but a bit rough round the edges. A perfect place for sightseeing in London. Front rooms do experience road noise but not enought to spoil a good night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap & Adequate”
Reviews.Author: Sandra T
Reviews.Content: 1 room for 3 people, for 2 nights, cost a total of Â£70, which was a bargain. We usually stay in Hostels on our city breaks, but this was just as cheap as a hostel. Our motto is, stay somewhere on a budget so we can splash out on meals, shopping & site seeing instead. It's only a 5 to 10 minute walk from Kings Cross station. It's a busy hotel & at checking in time, 3pm, the reception area was very busy, so we went to a friendly pub, The Carpenters, across the road for half an hour whilst the back log cleared. The room was basic but certainly adequate as we were only here to sleep & shower. The bar stayed open until midnight & was absolutely fine. There are several vending machines in the reception area & ample computers for internet access. This hotel is not luxurious, it's basic but is certainly ok, decor is dated & a bit shabby in the rooms but it's clean. We would definitely stay here again if we could get such a cheap deal. We didn't bother with the breakfast, as Travelodge breakfasts are terrible. I have always kept room keys for security reasons but doing so at this hotel meant a Â£4 charge per key, so hand them back. The Big Chill House is a great bar / club, in between Kings Cross & this hotel & is a funky place to have a drink & hear good music.

Reviews.Title: “Can't complain, you get what you pay for....”
Reviews.Author: GlasgowHSV
Reviews.Content: Great location just a short walk from Kings Cross, I enjoyed my stay here and have no real complaints about this hotel, other than our room was tired looking and could be doing with a lick of paint, the bed was on the low side and the mattress very soft apart from that,our room was spotlessly clean and the staff very helpful & friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Disgrace”
Reviews.Author: Tammix
Reviews.Content: Reception and dining area look fine but once you enter your room you are transported back in time to the 1960s which i assume is when this place was last decorated.View from window was a courtyard car park with a skip which was used at 530 am every day.Room was dirty,walls covered in stains.bathroom was approx 1 metre x 1 metre.Poor effort from Travelodge!

Reviews.Title: “4 room changes, grotty rooms, no cold water then no hot water, awful staff.”
Reviews.Author: melissaw92
Reviews.Content: Was pleasantly surprised by room until the top only had boiling hot water. Went to request bottled water to brush our teeth but ended up with the shower being boiling and having to change room at 1am. The staff made us travel up and down to the 6th floor to get room keys as they didn't have the deceny to bring them to us. Next room was blatently a back up room. One wall was gray from damp or smoke damage and the shower wasn't clean. Dealt with it however next morning the shower only stayed freezing cold. Went to complain and had a very unapoligetic member of staff assumed we could just have cold shower and change that afternoon. She eventually saw sense and moved us to another room simply for the shower with the promise of a new room that night. However we then discovered the key for our 2nd room didn't work so another trip downstairs, followed by another because the woman had written 536 on the card and assumed we would 'guess it was 530'. Received a refund for our night so i guess they have some sensible staff.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel from hell”
Reviews.Author: Gary M
Reviews.Content: where do I start to describe this hotel! We had the misery of staying here for 3 nights, it's a run down tired dirty place full of foreign students, shady looking characters and general peasants. The rooms are dirty and worn out and I did not get one good nights sleep due to loud mouthed residents making horrendous noise in corridors between 1-3 am. The breakfast is rotten and you have to pay a premium for it. The staff are ignorant and generally don't really give a damn. Don't waste your money this place is a rotten hole, it's the last travelodge I will stay in.

Reviews.Title: “cant fault the price but certainly not good !”
Reviews.Author: kat225
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on a great price direct with Travelodge, Paid an extra Â£10 to check in early. We took a cab from Kings cross to the hotel which was Â£5, we could have walked in 10 mins but it was raining so a cab was good value. The hotel is very easy to find and check in was quick. We booked a double and were amazed to see the bed pushed up against the wall ( we moved it around so it could be axessed from both sides. The matress was awful and I suspect it was quite old, room 232 ? The bathroom was ok but generally the whole room needs up dating ! all 3 lifts were out of order ! 2 vendig machines were out of order ! not the best travelodge we have stayed in but we only paid "25 per night so still a GREAT bargain for London if you just need somewhere to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Gross!”
Reviews.Author: PatsyBirmingham
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night on our return from a trip to the south of France by Eurostar. We were actually quite relieved when we saw our room, which was a disabled bedroom. We are not disabled but the accommodation seemed to be more spacious than the standard bedrooms. However, after our arrival, things went downhill pretty quickly. Firstly, when we attempted to switch on the TV, we discovered that the remote appeared to have lost both its back and one of the two batteries. This necessitated a trip down to the reception before we were able to watch the television. This, however, was minor compared with what was to come. We discovered that someone had decided to hang a (used?) condom on one of the wall lights next to the bed.Despite the fact that the room had been cleaned (to some extent) and the bedclothes changed, no one seemed to have noticed the unusual item hanging from the light! When I complained about this to the 'supervisor', showing him a photo of the aforementioned object, he immediately refunded the cost of the room (which amounted to more than Â£90), but insisted repeatedly that I delete the photo. We decided to eat breakfast at the hotel the following morning but the food was extremely poor quality and poorly cooked. This 'hotel' is absolutely appalling and should be avoided like the plague!

Reviews.Title: “tired old travelodge”
Reviews.Author: berrygreave
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at Travelodge for about 8 years. Stayed at Covent garden and Farringdon and The Royal Scot previously. But, this must have been the worst room we have ever had. we had a triple room with was really only suitable as a single room, 3 single beds took nearly all the room. There were 5 lights in the room only 2 of them worked and one of them was so dim there was no point in it being on. I asked on the first day if they could put new bulbs in but no joy. on the last day the lifts were out of order ( only 2 out of the 3 worked anyway). The Shower didn't work properly and was only luke warm . The lifts themselves were dirty and the doors needed a good polish. The corridor doors badly need a new coat of varnish and everything needs brightening up. The Breakfast cafe bar was cramped and the tables too close together, one woman actually fell over the legs of a chair and crashed into out table she went off rubbing her ribs . All in all its long over due for a facelift. They might be cheap but there is certainly no need for the grottyness. Some of the staff are helpful but others seem to be quite indifferent to the work

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting”
Reviews.Author: stevie179
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at several Travelodges in the past i was ready to ignore some of the reviews i had read about Kings cross.wish i had listened,make no mistake this is not a Travelodge it is a hostel and a bad one at that.The bathroom was manky with bloood on the shower curtain,the wallpaper was falling off the walls and the room smelled of damp.By the time i left all 3 lifts were out of order.Never ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel we've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: psmith987
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 9pm on a Saturday night after a long journey. On arrival in the room, we discovered that there was an electric radiator, an air conditioning unit and televison all with wires sprawling out the walls and on to the floor waiting for people to trip over them. Further inspection of the furniture revelaed splashes of paint all over following some slap dash attempt at decorating. The bathroom was truly revolting, with poorly fitting cracked tiles, a broken loo roll holder and other items of questionable origin. The shower did not work having no pressure and being started by pulling a rather rusty nail. When we raised these concerns with a rather surly young man on our return from dinner we were told that we should have checked the shower when we first got into the room and there was not much he could do about it now. It took a full and frank exchange of views before he agreed to move us to another room without a word of apology for the state of the room or inconvenience caused. The room we moved into was slightly, but only slightly, cleaner although there was a large amount of mould in the bathroom and paint and paper falling off the walls. We were also advised by another guest not to take a particular lift as the doors didn't close all the way. We were not able to get the cheap rates that some of the other contirbutors to this site seem to have done and it represented no value for money or quality of service at all. It seems it is using it's proximity to major train stations and the knowledge that many people will only stay for a short time as an excuse to shaft the travelling public. Only has a one rating as we can't give it a zero!

Reviews.Title: “Travel Lodge Cancelation Insurance Scam”
Reviews.Author: NicsHols
Reviews.Content: Do not bother with this insurance that is offered with your booking at a cost of Â£1.50. This is a scam. You can only make a claim in the event of Death Serious Illness Injury Redundancy Call for jury service etc I made a booking for a room and then realised I had booked the wrong date. I cancelled the booking and re booked on the correct date. Travel Lodge debited by card and will not refund as it was a 'Saver' booking. The insurance will not pay.

Reviews.Title: “Dont stay here!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Tinaandant
Reviews.Content: The hotel room is terrible,i have stayed in more basic hotels which were better than this.the rooms felt like a hostel,the staff made it feel like you were a burden to them and the restaurant food was poor.its amazing the difference between different travelodges.i booked this hotel thinking that they were all the same standard.how wrong i was.i have paid Â£29per night for a hotel room which were far better.i wont be staying at here ever again.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for...”
Reviews.Author: Silapin
Reviews.Content: Scruffy, small, hot room for one night. Disinterested hotel staff. Okay for one night at 42 pounds for a triple room inc breakfast, however if I had not got this super price, I would not have been pleased. In walking distance of Kings Cross Station.

Reviews.Title: “POOR”
Reviews.Author: DenM_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights on a block family booking. On arrival the rooms were not ready, so the hotel kindly allowed us to leave our bags in the one room that was. However, after dragging all our luggage up to the third floor, when we entered the room, it had not been cleaned. There was food on the floor and on the unmade bed and wet towels on the bathroom floor. The second room they offered had been cleaned but the bathroom ceiling looked like it was about to fall in. The room we eventually got was ok, if a bit worn, with chipped woodwork and a shower base that filled up and threatened to flood the bathroom. On the first morning we went down and paid for breakfast. The area is too small for a hotel of this size and the quality of food was very poor. On our third day we arrived back at 11pm to find that our room had not been cleaned. I will say that some of the rooms allocated to our family were ok, but that the quality of rooms differs greatly. All in all I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Hot!”
Reviews.Author: bumbleuk
Reviews.Content: The room was like a sauna even with the windows open. You get what you pay for so don't expect the ritz. Did the trick as a base.

Reviews.Title: “The worst night I spent for a long time...”
Reviews.Author: jingeos
Reviews.Content: This hotel has nothing appealing from the start until the end it was just the worst experience I had in a hotel (and I stay a lot in them with my work) First, the check-in is good as going to a fast-food check-out. No customer service whatsoever, no interaction or sense of human touch. What's the point in having a clerk if a machine would deliver the same service with maybe a bit more options... When we went onto the 6th floor, our room was 672. In the lobby, the signs were showing one way from 650 to 669 (or something like that) and the other way was showing from 680 to 699... SO WHERE IS 672 ?!? We tried the first way to end up at the end of the line and had to go back towards the lift and try the second way... The room was at the en of it. When we entered the room we had to push the door very hard and when I tried to close it I had to play up with the handle and push hard as it wouldn't close properly... That's when I noticed that the door was chipped on the side like if someone tried to kick it open... very reassuring... We settled a bit and though about calling the reception to ask for a lighter duvet... the problem was that there was no pone at all... no customer service on that side too then... We gave up, as we had a long journey and tried to have a shower to discover that there's no soap but the little hand washing one on the side of the sink... Did do the job though... As the evening drew to an end, I tried to close the window and we had to push both of us very hard to get it closed and locked... When we drew the curtains, they just fall as there was nothing to stop them on the rail... Since it was our only way to get the sun out in the morning we just had to put them back on... (and we realised that there was mould all around it) During the night we realised that the window wasnâ€™t double-glazing even though we were in central London as loads of Police cars went by waking us up and when we tried to leave quietly in the morning we had to slam the door few times to get it to shut properly (same story as the previous night) Thankfully we only paid Â£29 this time and I wish we had paid the Â£19 advertised everywhere but never available (we commute by Kings Cross) I wouldnâ€™t advise any of my friends to stay there even with an attractive price...

Reviews.Title: “Possibly the worst Travelodge in UK?”
Reviews.Author: VES11
Reviews.Content: Avoid this Travelodge like the plague, it is old, scruffy, and full of foreign students. Trying to find your way out from upper floors is a nightmare and I found other people wandering the corridors looking for the lift. I suspect if there was a fire it would be chaos!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty awful, but ok for 1 night”
Reviews.Author: KENTGEMMA
Reviews.Content: This hotel is pretty awful, after reading the reviews I was worried... We checked in and then I asked if we had a refurbished room they changed us to one... But you would never of known!! The room is ok for one night, but there was a few problems Walls chipped, air con turned off (absolutely boiling hot) shower broken so you didn't know if u was turning the temp up or down.. Not good when ur with a 5 yr old... 2 towels for a triple room, never experienced a bad travel lodge before, never expected much but all the above is kinda expected to work/ be present!! All in all it's ok for a quick stop off in the city, it's not a 5* hotel but could really do with some work!! Security guard at night... Don't know if it was a good or bad thing... Also Parking is Â£15 a night but on street parking just outside the hotel is free from 130 Saturday and all day Sunday!!

Reviews.Title: “It was fine”
Reviews.Author: ashtonboy
Reviews.Content: The room was clean and fine for our needs , We were a family of 2 adults and an 11 year old. Breakfast was great and we all ate as much as we wanted. Staff were very helpful and polite. The hotel does not look very pretty from the outside , but once in it is fine. No complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Would never recommend this hotel to anyone”
Reviews.Author: UnhappyHullengland
Reviews.Content: As I walked into the reception area my first impression was that this hotel needs a total refurbishment, which was confirmed when I saw the room, it was very basic (which was expected) but didn't expect it to be so shabby. For the 3 nights we stayed., the rooms were never cleaned once, the only positive thing I can say is that the bed was made daily!! We had no hot water for 2 days as the boiler had broken. and the staff were rude and unhelpful. The breakfast was also disappointing, we had to wait for more food to be brought out and then some of it was cold rather than hot. Didn't enjoy my stay and would never return!

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Donna_Maria_11
Reviews.Content: Overall I was pleasantly surprised with this hotel, I had read the reviews and was very skeptical about staying here but the room was very clean and the staff helpful and professional. We did not experience any noise from the nearby station and when I complained about teenagers running up and down the hall at 1am security addressed the issue! The area itself was a little unnerving especially at night time but overall the hotel was clean and good value for money (You get what you pay for!)

Reviews.Title: “"Awful”
Reviews.Author: Sarah128_11
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here for 1 night with 2 of my friends as we were going out and this hotel was very close to the location. I payed Â£129 for a room of 3 and from the first view of this hotel it looked like an abandoned museum of some kind, as we got inside it looked a little more modern the lift was full of rubbish and looked like something from the 70's, the whole corridor smelt of must and was outdated. When we got inside are room on the second floor it was very disappointing the wardrobe door was hanging off the room was not suitable for 3 people we could hardly walk around the beds the so called 'air conditiong' vent didnt even work so why it was there i don't no it got so hot in our room sweat was dripping off us and we had to keep standing outside in the corridor to cool down the tv didn't even work so guess that was something else just there for decoration the bathroom was tiny anybody overweight would have had trouble moving around in there and the stains in the bath were very unsightly the price i payed i would have expected a little more they should charge no more than Â£29 a night for the rooms here it's more of a hostel disgusting place will never be returning needs shutting down and major adjustments.

Reviews.Title: “Very good Basis Room!”
Reviews.Author: NICTGILLY
Reviews.Content: A excellent basic hotel, very clean, staff excellent and very secure place to stop. Had excellent buffet breakfast (all you can eat) lots of choices to choose from whether you wanted a cooked breakfast or simple cereal and toast! Would recommend to stay in this hotel if all you were looking for was a clean, basic room for a break in London.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff and great location”
Reviews.Author: slocker1
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights here for a family wedding and there was not much to complain about except that I got into bed and found a wet patch in the bed but the hotel staff brought me up some spare bedding and it was sorted in no time. the staff were amazing and tried really hard to help such as bringing up.the iron , ironing board and hairdryer up minutes after I asked for them. one member of staff even borrowed me her eye liner ad the person that waxed my eyebrows messed one up and they escorted my hairdresser up to my room. there is an amazing restaurant across the road can sen viem , a brilliant Vietnamese restaurant and it was the best thing I have ever eatern. I would definitely stay again. the breakfast was really nice too. of course its a basic hotel but was extremely happy with my stay.

Reviews.Title: “What is all the fuss about!”
Reviews.Author: GAH1968
Reviews.Content: We visited the Travelodge for one night on 28th July as part of a Daily Mail promotion for night in a hotel and theatre tickets. We had also read all the reviews and to be honest I was close to cancelling but after my husband spoke to the hotel directly who were very honest about the reburbishment programme we decided to go ahead and well we are happy we did! The hotel is basic of course - and very busy so don't book here for a quiet romantic break! Close to Kings Cross underground which is a bonus, only be aware that the local tube station not the main Kings cross one closes around 8pm at night so you have a much longer walk from the main exit. Our triple room was fine, beds comfortable, bedding clean, we asked for extra pillows and got them straight away, bathroom small but good and shower was great. Although we were at the front of the hotel and it was a hot night the noise did not cause us too much problem from the road but if you are a light sleeper take ear plugs! Main bar area is good and so was the free breakfast all you could eat buffet. Again busy but hey it is London. Staff friendly and do the best they can. I am sure that some rooms will be tired but give it a break - if you want four star then book it!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised!”
Reviews.Author: dogmax_1
Reviews.Content: We booked our 5 night stay at this hotel before looking at any reviews because we had found a really good room rate on the Travelodge website, so just went ahead and booked it. But after reading all of the terrible reviews on here we began to regret it and considered cancelling and looking elsewhere. We didnâ€™t cancel in the end and turned up at the hotel for our stay â€“ dreading what might greet us! But we were really pleasantly surprised. No, this is no luxury hotel and yes it has its faults and it is a little tired in places. The reception is busy and could do with someone cleaning and brushing the floor more regularly through the day, but the staff at the reception desk were polite enough. I donâ€™t know if we just got lucky but our room on the third floor was fine, small, but had all we needed, it was clean and the beds were made up every day. The hotel itself is just a 10 minute walk away from Kings Cross Station and underground. At first glance the area the hotel is in does look a little down at heal, but during our stay we were out until late most evenings and never felt unsafe walking back to the hotel from the underground station. All in all, an acceptable budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not great”
Reviews.Author: klompen25
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights this week. Fine to stay in for a night or two but not if you're looking to relax in comfort! The room was clean but that's about the only positive thing I could say about it. The bed was so uncomfortable - it was too soft and sagged in the middle. We regretted paying extra for the continental breakfast, it definitely wasn't worth it. We stayed here on the last 2 nights of our honeymoon and they seemed to place us on the floor for families with young children so it was also very noisy!

Reviews.Title: “"It doesn't need a refurb, it needs demolishing and to be built again!"”
Reviews.Author: AgentAlice
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at this Travelodge for 2 nights, a Saturday and Sunday, after trying to find somewhere that wasn't full (and cheapish) to no avail. We were told our room number and went in to find a spacious disabled room (that we didn't ask for as neither my boyfriend or I are disabled but we weren't going to moan about having a big room!) and realised that the help alarm was ringing. I went to the reception to be told that "You must've pulled the cord", however the man came in and turned it off. What is worrying is that the alarm must have been going off for a while and no one bothered about it. Although bed was very comfortable but we could hear the boilers under the floor and the air-con was noisy. As it was a street level room the windows didn't open and there was no ventilation in the bathroom. The hot tap water wasn't even luke warm and the shower took ages to heat up and wasn't very powerful (probably because the hose was leaking). As I didn't take my own hairdryer I borrowed one of the hotels; this worked for about a minute then over heated and started smoking. Luckily my friend and sister were staying in the same hotel and they'd bought a hairdryer, I went up to their teeny tiny twin room to borrow theirs, they said their shower was really powerful but the decor was tired and it was a bit dirty. I know that Travelodges are budget hotels but I've stayed in much better ones that this and to be honest it wasn't really all that cheap. I definitely wouldn't stay here again despite the location being close to Kings Cross station and on a quiet road.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for 1 night”
Reviews.Author: marbielover
Reviews.Content: Got a room here for Take That concert. Considering that all other hotels below Â£150 were full and this was Â£86 for twin value was pretty good. Minute bathroom, poor room decor but comfortable night, quiet, and easy check-in/out. Good location and will be a great choice once hotel is refurbished. Only Recommended for 1 night if the price is good until then.

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel, but had all you needed...”
Reviews.Author: omh1
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel on a theatre break to London with my partner, the hotel is basic enough but you get what you pay for. Rooms were fine, bit of mildew around the window and paper peeling off, but not the end of the world. The hotel is in a good location, but the cooked breakfast is just not that great, sausages are a bit dodgy looking and hard, but there is cereal and that. All round not the worst hotel about.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: aimanzakwan
Reviews.Content: It wasn't as bad as stated in some other reviews. Clean and big room (Family Room), with clean towels and bed sheets. For the location, it isn't very far from King Cross St Pancras Station (10 minutes walking), plus there are a lot of restaurants and grocery shops around. My family and I never bothered about the noise from the train and the traffic. We slept really well at night. It really worth the price I paid for one-night stay in London.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: chatea
Reviews.Content: Very close to St Pancras. Quiet, safe rooms. With special offers, very good value for money. Had full English breakfast at a Greek cafÃ© over the road. And dined at an Italian restaurant close by.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: KAA905
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 5 nights, and it didn't get any better, we just got used to it. It was no more than a backpackers hostel. Rooms were tired, shabby and grubby. Stains on carpet, light fittings falling off, wall paper ripped (you get the gist). I have now read reviews and someone mentions about not expecting aircon for such a meagre price - I have to disagree, when you can't open the windows because of the noise outside, then I think aircon should be a must. Breakfast was like a cattle market most mornings, although there appears to be a separate room for 'groups', this did not stop the 'groups' coming down to the main dining area making it very busy. The cleanliness of the bowls/area left alot to be desired. One morning staff were wrapping cutlery in the 'paper towels' used to dry your hands in the toilet ! Unfortunately we had been booked in there for the whole week, but really it was one of those places where you really only want to stay one night, and only if you really have to. We had another booking in there for later in the year, which as we type is currently being changed as we will not return.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: CurlQueen
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as part of a theatre break package without a thought of looking at reviews before booking, and when I looked I was dreading walking through the doors. We got there early, as expected the room was not ready but there were lockers to store our bags and though very over priced, was very convenient. The building looks a bit run down, but it was clean and tidy inside and the staff were friendly and helpful. When we got to the room, we were also pleasantly surprised after reading some negative reviews.
