For some reason we were allocated a ground floor disabled room, and although there was some marks on the walls and a slightly musky smell from the bathroom, it was presentable and comfortable. The room backed on to the lifts which at first seemed quite noisy, but we got used to it quickly as it was a constant low hum. The air con was lovely and there was no noise from outside which also surprised us a little. We had dinner in the hotel both nights which was a good experience and breakfast was even better. Overall, we can't work out what all the fuss was about. It's not the Hilton, but what can you expect when you pay a quarter of the price. It's basic, clean, comfortable, friendly, efficient and close to the train station/underground. What more do you need?

Reviews.Title: “Great....Don't believe the reviews!!!”
Reviews.Author: robbie_Q44
Reviews.Content: Really clean bedroom, friendly and helpful staff...what else do you want? Yes it needs a re paint here and there but just because its old doesn't mean people should give it a bad review. I stay on and off in London around 10 times a year and stay here everytime. Its a Travelodge so you get the basics but at such low prices you can't expect the Ritz. Would recommend anyone to stay as I had a great stay last time and work is being done on the hotel so its not like they are ignoring the condition of the building. People on this website expect to much from budget in central London. I mean who expects air conditioning when you pay such cheap rates???? If you want air conditioning go spend Â£300 a room in the Holiday Inn up the road where you get exactly the same room and the only difference is the price....and the staff aren't as nice!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Thin walls so very noisy, OK as a base”
Reviews.Author: jen21082
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 1 night - and thats all I would have wanted as i didnt get much sleep - although it was a Saturday night so Im sure other nights are quieter. Not as close to the tube stop as it makes out (the nearest exit is closed on weekends) Friendly staff who were helpful. Lifts worked when we were there. Breakfast was a bit of a nightmare as they couldnt cope with demand, but again I bet on a week day this may be easier There was a damp stain on the wall in the room Overall not what i expect from a travelodge - been to far nicer ones everywhere else in the country I think in London they think they can get away with it as everyone just wants a cheap hotel. I doubt this place gets many return visits though. This does its brand a disservice

Reviews.Title: “The (few) good, the bad, and the ugly”
Reviews.Author: Si_Lalas
Reviews.Content: Stayed there with my husband for 3 nights. Have braced myself for a horrible stay, after reading all those reviews in Tripadvisor. The good: location, near the busy King's Cross station of the Harry Potter fame. Beds are clean. A lot of reasonable eateries around: Italian, kebab, Chinese, etc, even some halal outlets. The bad: No aircon - luckily London was still a bit cool when we stayed. Could not imagine it in the peak of summer. Elevators, albeit working, are dirty and not well-maintained. Bed not comfy enough, I woke up with a bit of back pain. The ugly: room has paints peeling off the wall. Hallways are in need of repair, some wallpapers peeling off, some 'black ornament' in bad condition. At GBP 79-89, I don't know if it's worth it. Some nice B&B would have costed less, I guess. But I was desperate for a place near main train station, and this one was still vacant at last minute, so I really had no choice. My last words would be: enter at your own risk.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: enchanted79
Reviews.Content: I was nervous about staying at this hotel given some of the reviews... but the staff were friendly, the lifts worked, we had no problems with rowdy guests (though it was a Sunday night!), the room was clean and comfortable, and we had no complaints at all. It's clear that this has been a big, old hotel purchased by Travelodge: the furniture in the room looked a little dated, but it was solid, intact, and looked good (and included proper wardrobes and drawers, unlike most Travelodges these days). It looked as if the double glazing was new, as were the bathroom tiles and fittings. Having experienced some poor service, dirty rooms and apparent under-staffing at the much newer Euston Travelodge, I'd much rather stay here in future. A bargain at Â£25 for a twin room.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: lolly2409
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2nights here at the beginning if July on a leisure break to London. You get what you pay for here, we stayed for 2nights and paid Â£180. We did not have breakfast included. The good bits : location is about 10min walk from kings cross underground station and close to lots of pubs cafes and restaurants. The room was clean and had all we needed for our stay. The bad bits : hotel is a little run down and shabby looking and is on a main road so be prepared for lots of road noise! Generally the rooms could do with a lick of paint. Overall not a bad experience but wouldn't stay again.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for (hopefully!)”
Reviews.Author: Drake_Sheldon
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel twice now and there isn't much to add to the other reviews. Yes it is a tired, old property and not like a 'modern' Travelodge. However on both occasions we only needed a room as a bed for the night and this place fits the bill. On this occasion we only paid Â£36 for one night, which, I think is a bargain. Why do I think this? Well one must have to think relatively; if you compare this Travelodge with the majority of dingy King's Cross hotels (you'll pass many of them on your way here) it really isn't so bad, especially if you get a good deal. The room was tired and a little shabby, but was clean and the bed was comfortable. There was also plenty of hot water (low pressure though!) So if all you need is somewhere to lay your head for a night then it isn't too bad. Although the 'real' King's Cross Travelodge is far superior to this place so aim to get that one before this if you need to stay in the King's Cross area. As a side note, on both occasions staying here the hotel tends to have a lot of school parties staying - this could be troublesome for some with noise issues, etc. Just a word of warning just in case!

Reviews.Title: “It was okay as a base”
Reviews.Author: bizzieliz
Reviews.Content: This hotel has terrible reviews and terrible photos. We were pleasantly surprised by the size and standard of our twin room: I think there is a great variation in the rooms. Ours was slightly dated but clean and beds were comfy. Bathroom unremarkable, water hot, sheets and towels clean and fresh. It is basic, and you need to to go back to reception to ask for anything extra: hairdryers, extra teabags a second pillow etc. We were on the second floor on the front and it was hot with the window closed and noisy with it open. We were not bothered by noisy guests but there seemed to be groups staying who were mainly on the upper floors. We often used the stairs as the lifts were busy but working. The breakfast was good enough they need a new toast making machine!!!. I have stayed in a lot worse hotels in London and paid more. The situation is very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: colin_bass
Reviews.Content: It started badly. We had booked in advance, and arrived to find that we were not expected. But there are two Travelodges in London King's Cross. We trundled our suitcases to the other one, only to be unexpected there also. After much flapping of paper and eventually consulting a receptionist who could speak English, finally we were expected and were given a room key. The room was very basic, but that we had expected. It continued worse. We went to the bar for a snack. I ordered a soup and a roll. My wife is diabetic and needed something a little more substantial. She placed her order for potato skins with cheese and asked if she could also have a bread roll. No, that was impossible, the till could accept no variations to the menu. After a lively discussion with the barman I gave my wife my roll. Our room was in a quiet part of the hotel. Nevertheless it was noisy all night both from within the hotel and from outside. The bed was uncomfortable and there was only one small pillow. I had hardly any sleep. I have slept better in a tent, on a bus, and in economy class. Breakfast was not yet available when we had to leave to catch our train at 7 AM. But I slept better on the train.

Reviews.Title: “No problems, people on here are totally over reacting.”
Reviews.Author: Wildcats68
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights on a weekend. The rooms although a little shabby round the edges were clean and with fresh bedding. All 4 people in our party commented on the high comfort and quality of the beds. The decor is is not like a standard new Travelodge but for around Â£70.00 for a twin room, it provides excellent value for money and I would have no problem with staying here again. Bit of advice, if there is still only 1 lift working it is quicker to use the stairs. This is the only really gripe I had during the stay as it was mentioned in previous reviews and has obviously not been addressed. If you want 4* quality go pay the standard Â£200 a night London hotels charge, but give the Royal Scot a break, you are being very unfair.

Reviews.Title: “value for money with great service”
Reviews.Author: stevelyonUk
Reviews.Content: This is a very basic hotel for those with a tight budget requiring cleanliness and with good access to the Tube. It has a clean and tidy restaurant and bar and close to some useful amenities ie off license, fast food, and the excellent asian restaurant 'Taste of Asia'. Its about a 10 minute walk to Kings Cross and a further 5 to Euston. The reception staff went out of their way to help us orientate. It can be noisy at night. All in all a very good choice.

Reviews.Title: “it was as bad as I thought it might be”
Reviews.Author: james_bethel
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights in June 2011 and having read the reviews beforehand I was fearing the worst. Day 1 - one lift working out of three (seems to be a recurring theme here) and had to wait 20 minutes to get to the room. Day 2 - no lifts working! - had to heft my case up and down 2 flights of stairs. Restaurant had sectioned off 2/3 of tables for a large party booking leaving 6 tables for the whole of the rest of the guests. Food did not appear - had to have a refund - elderly couple in front of me were desperate as being diabetic they had administered their insulin and were becoming hypoglycaemic waiting for their food. Constant noise of doors slamming and people shouting during my second night here

Reviews.Title: “This place is a disgrace, filthy, staff that are totally disinterested and have no interest other than taking your money”
Reviews.Author: David145
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Hotel last week. On arrival I was greeted with a " it'll cost you ten pounds as it's not 3 pm yet" that was before I gave my name. On challenging this with the duty manager she told me it clearly states on booking confirmations at the time of booking. The organisation is work for uses an agent so this would never come through to me. And for the record, other than an attempt to extort money from the customer what is the fee for. I then paid the 10 pounds and was checked into a sub ground level room with a window located about 8 feet from the ground covered with a half open filthy net curtain. It was room 102 and I'll bet it's still half open and still filthy. The bed linen smelled old and not professionally laundered, the duvet was wafer thin as were the pillows. The walls were stained and scuffed. The bathroom was dirty too, the shower cleaned to hand height, the toilet seat was covered in PVC water resistant plastic that was broken down and let water into the mdf frame. Once in the bathroom, close the door and there was an accumulation of dirt, dust and something else behind the door. I will never stay there again or indeed in a travelodge - I can only think there is not enough competition in London so dumps like this will thrive. Britain is about to host the 2012 Olympics and god knows what foreign guests will think of our country........when I complained to reception the girl I spoke to was arrogant, surly and disinterested.

Reviews.Title: “May stay again if the price is right”
Reviews.Author: ValT61
Reviews.Content: On the positive side the room was clean but shabby, the bed was comfortable and the shower was hot. On the negative side however, 2 of the lifts were out of service, my room key wasn't activated so I had to trail all the way back to reception with my luggage and queue again to get it sorted, the television was ancient and tiny and the 'zapper' didn't work. There was only a sliver of soap in the bathroom and when I told reception I didn't have any shower gel they told me they didn't supply it. There was no hairdryer or iron in the room - I was told I could get one from reception but this would have meant another long walk back to reception. I guess these are just minor annoyances but they would have made a difference in terms of customer satisfation.

Reviews.Title: “An Oldie but a Goodie!”
Reviews.Author: oggrocks
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here before with my mother and we know what to expect - a basic, clean safe Travelodge 10 minutes walk from King's Cross. We do not eat in the hotel, as there are plenty of nicer, cheaper places within walking distance. Breakfast for Â£4.50 including tea/coffee at "The Other Side" is recommended! It is better than newer Travelodges as the rooms have wardrobes and drawers so you don't have to live out of your suitcase. It is excellent value for money in central London - if you want HD tv and room service what are you doing in a Travelodge? Our only gripes - only one out of three lifts were working and they ran out of extra pillows. I'm hoping that will be resolved when we go back in October!

Reviews.Title: “Grubby”
Reviews.Author: Sossity2
Reviews.Content: The room was clean, but, the landing and the windows were filthy. On arrival, i was given the swipe to an already occupied room. That sort of error is just scary. Rapist, murderers, thieves...given the key to your room! Their online customer service is also dreadful, starting with the awful form, which forces you into stating two queries before it's accepted. When they replied back, the answer was nothing to do with either the real query or the extra one i was forced to give. Their booking line often have you listening to a circular, recorded meesage. Seems cheap rooms mean very bad service all around.

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful”
Reviews.Author: Hayroe
Reviews.Content: Awful awful place. Old, downtrodden, dirty, noisy, words cant describe. Do not bother even for one cheap night.

Reviews.Title: “Stop over for an early start in London”
Reviews.Author: bambatta
Reviews.Content: The room was clean and well maintained, The service from the staff was prompt and of a good level, The Breakfast all be it an optional extra was good and plentiful, The only down fall was the fact that 2 of the 3 lifts were broken, but they did have engineers on site trying to fix that problem

Reviews.Title: “Do not ever stay here”
Reviews.Author: andrewjetjockey
Reviews.Content: We booked - but they claimed not to have our booking. Thank goodness too. While we were trying to sort out our reservation we saw one guest shouted at by the manager, (yes actually shouted at), another refused an extra pillow (he had one only - not enough for the double bed he was sharing) and we saw another told that he had to stay in the dirty smelly room he had been given. He wouldn't be given another room and he would be charged if he left. Thank goodness they screwed up our reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive, very shabby and basic”
Reviews.Author: inasense
Reviews.Content: Avoid if you can. I paid over 170 pds for a room which I was reluctant to sleep in. Awful narrow bed, shabby and grotty. Noisy place.- maily due to no consideration from some other guests.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but awful hotel”
Reviews.Author: kimmisixx
Reviews.Content: Went here with my boyfriend and parents for two nights in London. The hotel is in a very good location but I would not recommend staying here. The hotel is like a very poor 70's motel. In my room, there was grime on the bathroom tiles, and the toilet flush was hanging off. The cistern also filtered water through into the toilet basin all night. Breakfast was terrible, barely any options, glasses and cutlery were sticky and unclean. Staff weren't particularly helpful when complained about this. On the second day there was no cups or glasses even available. Not worth Â£7 per day, more like 7p....The hotel is no smoking but reeked of smoke from cigarettes. The rooms were small but fusty, only 3 pillows on a double bed, no phones, TV was tiny and older than myself [I'm 21]. My parent's bedding had holes in it. Terrible, even for a travelodge. Do not stay here, it's pretty much a hostel masquerading as a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “well chuffed”
Reviews.Author: clarence000000000000
Reviews.Content: After reading all previous reviews ( i had already booked and paid for our stay ) i was seriouly not looking forward to staying here and tried to cancel my booking. I was thoroughly amazed when we got there to find a clean reception and dining area with staff who couldnt do enough for us. Our room was also clean and tidy .... all the towels and sheets were clean. We had a family room and parking and at a total cost of Â£11,00 a night each..... where else are you going to get that in London. I will definitely book this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and excellent breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Laurence_Brussels
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel as I was travelling alone with my 2 girls (7 and 12) and it's only a 10' easy walk from St Pancras (didn't want to carry the suitcase in the Tube). The neighbourhood is safe but not trendy (I prefer safe). The hotel is not elegant BUT the room had just been refurbished and the bedding was very good and with duvets (I love that!) and everything was clean. And last but not least, the hotel offers an all you can eat buffet breakfast (free for children) that is excellent ! So all in all, this is a very good address for London if you need family rooms that don't cost a fortune.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother”
Reviews.Author: ShrewsburyChefette
Reviews.Content: We stayed twice in a week there and back from Disneyland.The first time we were moved 3 times-room 1 plugs and electrics not working,room 2 not cleaned and room 3 (11pm)dirty bathroom. Second time(11.30pm) leaking toilet,filling all night,tiles coming off in bathroom,no power to the A/C,couldn't open windows,no spare pillows available,bulb missing in bedside light,door wouldn't lock and curtains hanging off the rails. Met a couple from Sweeden and assured them that not all British hotels are this bad and they've been really unlucky.

Reviews.Title: “not suitable for families,elderly or disabled”
Reviews.Author: mrsboop
Reviews.Content: we booked as it was a cheap price for a one night stay in london. upon approach from near to kings cross station we realised the area did not look well cared for and makes you feel a bit wary of where your hotel is situated. we eventually found the hotel and did not look to bad just like you expect from a travelodge, reception nice, staff polite and helpful. we had booked on the internet for a family room,THE PICTURES DEFINITELY DO NOT LOOK ANYTHING LIKE THE ROOMS YOU GET. they might has well have put a picture of a room in buckingham palace because they are nothing like the one on the website. these pictures must be of what the rooms are going to look like as they say they are undergoing refurbishment. the room felt quite small as there were 3 single beds in it. the furniture was old, the air con did not work, there was a hair in the bed, the maids i presume, the bathroom was clean but falling to bits and i wont even tell you what was on the back of the menu-needless to stay we went straight downstairs to complain saying about the beds but really we just wanted out. the manager was very helpful and offered us a full refund ( which apparently they do not have to do after 12.00pm- which is just ridiculous as you cannot go into the rooms until 3pm. i was allowed to use their phone to call the booking line to move (moved to travelodge at euston)we had to completely pay again but was to be credited with our original booking within 3 days - refunded to card. i personally would not stay here - i am a normal person with kids, i did not feel they area looked very nice and would not like to have gone back in the dark, you are really far out yes there is bus and tube thinks but not easily accessible. the rooms are nearly clean just old and out dated. the euston worked out about Â£20 dearer but would definitley rather pay this for the cleanliness, better rooms and a 5 min walk from the station i would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay in a great location”
Reviews.Author: GarryM236
Reviews.Content: I read all the reviews on trip advisor and was really not looking forward to my stay however when I got to the hotel I was meet with a really lovely receptionist who went out of her way to give me a map and direct me to where I needed to go the next day. The room was basic but what else do you want from a Travelodge? The room was clean and had all I needed and I had a great stay. I ate incthe bar cafe and food was your standard travelodge food but again service with a smile. Spoke o the manager on the way out the next morning and she was again really helpful and told me how to get to where I needed to go. Only suggestion I would make would to be that the breakfast could be open alot earlier as I was getting the Euro Star the next morning and because it was before 7am I had to miss out.

Reviews.Title: “If hell freezes over”
Reviews.Author: Mommapjk13
Reviews.Content: Dreadful ... Broken light fittings / electrical hazards.. The rooms all smelled of smoke ( it's a non smoking hotel)!!! Handles broken off drawers & wardrobes .. Paint peeling, dirty, the list is endless.. Asked for extra pillows ... Run out!!! Dormitory style family room my 6 year old learned the word hovel!!! Hotel full of youngsters partying till all hours ... rang reception via my mobile to the travellodge phoneline as I didn't want to get my kids dressed at midnight to go downstairs and a 2.45am the partying continued!! If hell freezes over I still wouldn't consider this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Won't be returning”
Reviews.Author: ash393939
Reviews.Content: We weren't keen on this travelodge, the location is far from ideal, the area around it isn't exactly pleasant, didn't feel totally safe walking back there late at night. From the outside it's quite an ugly building, although is ok on the inside. The room was fine, a little noisy but nothing as bad as some London hotels. We made a mistake when booking, we nearly went for the Kings Cross travelodge which is much nearer Kings Cross/St Pancras (literally across the road from it) we expected this one to be relatively close too, it was cheaper but it's quite a trek. Oh well, serves us right for not doing enough research beforehand I suppose! I think it cost us something like Â£23 for the room, staying midweek, but I do think it would be worth paying a bit more for the nearer one.

Reviews.Title: “Bad smell,stains on bed & all furniture,poor service,rooms never serviced”
Reviews.Author: karloandrachel
Reviews.Content: Do not stay here if you can avoid it. The first room we were given smelt of death and we could not open the windows, it was hard to breathe. We complained and were begrudgingly moved to another room which still stank but not as bad. The sofa bed our daughter had to sleep on was covered in I hate to imagine what kind of stains. The paint was literallly peeling off the walls and the bathroom was disgustingly filthy. The rooms were never serviced for our three nights stay and we had to take out the rubbish, ask for clean towels, and service the rooms ourselves. We made mention of this everyday politely (one sholdnt have to). We were made to feel like rude people and a nuisance when asking for fresh towels and where to put the rubbish that should have been part of the stay/service. We are very tolerable people who dont expect alot from stays in budget hotels and never complain but this was ridiculous. Prostitutes frequented the hotel regularly, not a good look for our teenage daughter.

Reviews.Title: “Below par”
Reviews.Author: pinkjo
Reviews.Content: Don't be lulled into a false sense of security by the Travelodge banner, this place is a dump. room tatty, walls damp, mould in bathroom, appalling breakfast. the whole place feels like a cheap hostel with vending machines everywhere. room was barely cleaned and my bed was made under the book I'd left on it and towels left in a heap on bathroom counter. dark rooms too, just very grim all in all

Reviews.Title: “you get what you pay for...and then less”
Reviews.Author: mel1000
Reviews.Content: Okay, London is expensive. We've done the cheap hotels (think orange) and earlier this trip, a mid-price. This booking was done on our behalf by a relative, so we hadn't researched it ahead of time. That said, I was expecting a bit more. After all, it is a Travelodge. But the name doesn't mean much at Kings Cross Royal Scot. The lobby was the most modern aspect of the hotel--once you pass the check-in desk, you're back in time to a shoddy past. The elevator ride is exciting because you don't know for sure that you are going to arrive on a floor. But the long, narrow hallway walk to our room along the red-patterned carpet did not prepare us for our room--a stale, moldy-smelling bathroom, a stale smelling bedroom and a window dating from the 1970s greeted us. Okay, the good news is no bed bugs. The toilet and shower worked--you just needed to look (and smell) beyond the black mold everywhere. There was a tv. The window could open 2 inches. The beds had fresh sheets. On the other hand, the AC/Heat unit didn't work and looked as though it hadn't worked for years (can you say 'dust build-up'?). There was no phone in the room. Pillows were more like slivers of fabric than fluffy head supports. Beds were bouncy, meaning the springs had sprung long ago. We didn't use the drawers. So, cheap yes, but Easy Hotel is similarly cheap--however, Travelodge rooms are bigger and have a window. It was a great location for our early morning Eurostar departure--a 10 minute walk to St. Pancras station. You get what you pay for--we paid a little (for London) and at this Travelodge, this was what we got.

Reviews.Title: “Just awful!”
Reviews.Author: JapaneseTraveller888
Reviews.Content: THREE of our room lights were not working and asked them to fix on the first night right after our checking in, however, we were told, impolitely by the female receptionist, to wait until the next morning because their maintenance people had already gone home and they could not do anything about it, which was a joke for us as they cannot even find and change a light bulb!!! I have learned straight away that they do not bother to listen to their customers sincerely and take action on their complains ASAP. I asked again next morning with a reminder note and our room number on it but the lights had never been fixed during our stay (three nights), very disappointed. Toilet was dirty with a filthy stain on the wall, which I cleaned by my self on the first night, and I bought anti-bacterial wipes for the next two nights, which was taken away from our bathroom on the second night. The location is good and the price was cheap, but the next time, I personally am happy to pay more for the better service than this.

Reviews.Title: “A bit of a joke”
Reviews.Author: TedSalad56
Reviews.Content: We couldn't get served at the bar at 11.50pm on a Saturday night. Also the bedroom walls were filthy and stained and the ground floor area stank. Do you yourselves a favour - avoid.

Reviews.Title: “Dont stay here”
Reviews.Author: debs398Norfolk
Reviews.Content: Firstly we booked a triple room with 3 single beds and ended up with a family room with a double and single bed... not very pleasant when you are three men travelling together. On check in, receptionist didnt want to even speak to us just pointed to a machine for us to check ourselves in... the machine didnt even work and it was hard work to get her to listen to us and check us in manually, because one of us had checked in slightly earlier they didnt want to give us any more keys to the room. On arrival in the room, we had a smashed window, there was a hole in the sink in the bathroom, the room looked at best like a dormitory, the beds were lumpy and extremely soft. No batteries in the remote control for the tv. We knew when we booked a travelodge it wasnt going to be the best hotel in the world but we werent expecting it to be quite so awful, have stayed in travelodges in the past and none have ever been this bad

Reviews.Title: “Not Good”
Reviews.Author: davidwillcocks
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night on Business in May 2011. Certainly this hotel is not up to the usual Travelodge standards - old, dirty, and slightly smelly. Room was of a reasonable size but in desperate need of new decor, walls covered in weird marks, dread to think what some of them may have been. I was on the quiet side of the hotel which was still very noisey. No aircon, just a dodgy window which you couldnt open if you wanted to sleep because of the noise. Bathroom was actually quite clean, but toilet seat was broken (i.e not attached) and the shower was more like a dribble, but was at least hot. Breakfast - one word - terrible! Go to Mcdonalds instread. Location - close to Kings Cross station, no problems.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, damp and noisy”
Reviews.Author: babychicken77
Reviews.Content: The bed sheets were clean, but that was about the only thing in the room! Cobwebs and dust everywhere, wall paper and paint very tired, lots of marks on it, even a hand print above the bed!!! Bathroom was damp, mould growing in places and toilet dirty. No sound proofing on the windows so heard traffic noise all night, even though my room wasn't that close to the road! Safe to say I won't be back. Glad I was only staying one night!!

Reviews.Title: “very unpleasant”
Reviews.Author: yorkie041
Reviews.Content: soiled towels, toilet seat fell off, toilet uncleaned was left pebble dashed. no plug in sink, no soap or tumblers in bathroom.as hot as a sauna with heating turned off. no opening window .could not get another room as hotel was full at 11pm finally provided a fan off reception desk.no remote control for t v .20 minutes wait for drinks at bar . food at dinner took 50 minutes for starters to appear then another 20 minutes for mains followed by an inedible sweet. breakfast was a farce no cups after 10mins wait paper cups came ,servittes were blue cleaning paper from a roll on bar ,gave up with cooked breakfast as by the time bacon arrived 10 minutes after asking they ran out of sausage and beans ,bread was frozen .take our advice and stay well clear

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay in this hole!!”
Reviews.Author: Bingchick88
Reviews.Content: Food is expensive and the bar and restaurant never opens on time and you'll probably have to wait 30mins for the staff to finish setting up before you actually get served. When you do finally get your food it will be small, burnt and not all ingredients will be there!! I would not recommend you stay in this dump hole rip off joint!! Oh and don't decide what you want to soon as they have probably run out before they have even served a single person as we found out!! Staff are also rude you must have to pay for a smile these days.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty/ Unsafe”
Reviews.Author: Luzzie
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel as my sister was coming over to London to visit, thought it would be nice and affordable as it wasnt 1st time when i've used Travelodge! Totally shocked when i entered the room! Horendous! Dirty walls, carpets, very dusty furniture! Just couldnt breath properly! Complained to the reception ppl, changed 3 rooms as worst!! Not very helpful and one man was quite rude saying if im not happy then i should go to another hotel pounting the pc to make another booking! Appauling!! We left next day and we didnt get a refund for the other nights we payed for!! Will not recommend!! Wast

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, clean and perfectly located”
Reviews.Author: Saboumboum
Reviews.Content: THe hostel is very close to the station. Lifts are tiny and look old but it's ok. (you still have stairs) The bed was very comfortable, sheets were clean and there were a lot of clean towels available. There were a lot of channels on the television and a tea set on the table on arrival. Well, that double bedroom was very cheap for london so I won't compain that much. THe major problem was the bathroom: water flow was to weak It's not a big problem when you stay one night but if I had to stay more and wash my hair, it would have been very annoying. Staff was polite and as it was a lovely day, I didn't need to use the warming neither the air conditioner. (+ there were child protections at the window+ you have to pay for the internet) There were a lot of teenagers but as they weren't at my floor, I can tell you if they made a lot of noise. Last thing, the menu says you can order and eat in your room, that means: order at the bar, and bring yourself your plate through the lift to your room Ahah, lovely experience!

Reviews.Title: “In Serious Need Of A Makeover.”
Reviews.Author: sm71
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights. Even by budget hotel chain standards, this was poor. Hotel was filthy. Customer service was minimal. Fixtures and fittings were tired and shabby. Walls are very thin. This is a large hotel, and part of a multi-national chain, should be able to do better.

Reviews.Title: “Stinks”
Reviews.Author: vandalmax
Reviews.Content: Youth hostels are 1000 better than this place. Manager is a funny character who takes forever to get to your room and its especially annoying if you reach late night and want to sleep. Did kind of feel the place was a place for people to ........ by the hour. Rooms smell disgusting and the only saving grace is clean beds (thought so but I was too tired to check). Showers are useless (in 2 rooms!) since the head is clogged so to take a proper bath you need to use the tap or unscrew the shower head and replace it when done.

Reviews.Title: “dirty, noisy, no one cares”
Reviews.Author: snowqeen
Reviews.Content: Travelodge in Kings Cross was dirty and at 2pm someone in the room above us started to jump, stump and move furniture about for at least 30 minutes. I went and asked the man at the receiption to sort it out. He only nocked on their door, but didin`t demand any answer. I thought he didn`t really care about us, who had were woken up by the noise. Those people should have been made to leave the hotel. the breakfast room was too small for all the people to fit in, so we had to take it up to our room. Our next night in Waterloo travelodge was much better & cleaner on 18.4.2011. Unfortunately there was a guest in room 208 who was smoking and we had to sniff the stink in our room - this is ilegal. I informed the girl on the desk, she said she spoked to the person and told him not to do it again, I think she was frightened to do anything about it. Smoking in hotels is ilegal , the person should have paid a fine of Â£75 and made to leave the hotel, thats what the other lady at the desk said, but non of it happened. So I will not be reacomending Travelodge to anybody infact the oposite. I am not intending to stay at any Travelodge in the future , I `d rather pay a bit more to saty in clean, decent hotel where staff adhere to their rules and legal requirements.

Reviews.Title: “Worst travel lodge I've stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Seadog243
Reviews.Content: Haved stayed at many different Travelodges and have usually been happy with them but this particular hotel fell way below the standard expected. The room was filthy, upon arrival l I found a towel which appear to covered in dry sick and tissues in the bath and the bedding had stains on it. The room facilities were poor, the air conditioning did not work and there was no kettle in the room. The reception was bombarded with groups and it felt more like a low quality backpackers hostel than a hotel. There were insufficient lifts for the number of guests meaning you were frequently waiting and then when a lift arrived you could not get in because it was full. The stairs were not clearly sign posted and so at one point I thought i would never make it down to breakfast which on reflection would have been a blessing. I made the mistake of pre-booking breakfast - there was only once machine for toast and a big queue had formed next to it and there were not sufficient cups of glasses to get tea or juice. Had a bowl of cereal and made a swift exit. It really lets the Travel Lodge brand down, would never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “OK but quite expensive”
Reviews.Author: tyw7
Reviews.Content: The room was OK but the radiator was dirty and room was very small. Location was OK... Room was clean and has a working TV.

Reviews.Title: “They need to fix their doors”
Reviews.Author: Ichinensei
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is excellent. If you need to go to Gatwick, St Pancras is a short walk away. If you need to go to Heathrow, King's Cross is closeby and you can catch the Picadilly Line. I really likes its location. There is a fish and chip shop just across the street as well as a convenience store. As well as a pub. There are many others kebab, fish and chip and restaurants nearby, including internet access places. There are paid internet computers in the lobby if you wish. Downside for this hotel is no fridge or telephone in room. So no wakeup calls. My room was on the 2nd floor (3rd floor for North Americans) and the windows cannot be opened as per a little note "For you own protection" The room is clean however and you have a telly with limited channels and a kettle with milkettes and coffee and tea which you can make yourself. There is also a place in the bathroom where you can hang your towels or washings and the thing is hot so you can have a nice and warm towel after a shower or dry your washings there. The main complain is the doors.. The doors slams shut very loudly, and during my stay there were many school trips from Spain and Germany and the kids just let their doors slam.. 7am wakeup calls from all the doors slamming and late at nights as well as kids running around the halls and what not. But aside from these annoyance from the teenagers, the hotel is not bad. Although I have to say, sleep was a premium for me in the 3 nights i was there

Reviews.Title: “Horrendous Hole... Unsafe for women”
Reviews.Author: Greggbb
Reviews.Content: Put simply the staff here are nice but it is the worst hotel I have ever had the misfortune of visiting in the UK. Dirty, smelly, awful rooms, no iron, no phone, terrible food. It is drastically unsafe in and around the hotel for solo travellers. Homeless people come into the hotel to use the toilets. There are sex workers walking the streets and gangs of men shouting at women in the street. Avoid this place. Bad nights sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Should be called a 'Hostel for the Travelling Homeless' not a Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Kira_77_11
Reviews.Content: What a MASSIVE dissapointment Travelodge! I wasn't going to write a review for fear of coming across of one of those 'Booked a 1 star but expected a 5 star'....but I had to pas on my experience. I booked a one night stay prior to on a week's holiday and one night on my return. The first stay was so awful my little boy didn't want to stay there on the way home : ( BAD POINTS Large parties are booked into this hotel. Lots of teenagers congregate at the entrance which can be intimidating. The hotel is situated in a right dodgy part of London. Was woken up at 1:00am by a large group of kids drinking and partying in the corridor right outside my room. They did quieten down after being told. Way understaffed. Evening meal was ok, but took about an hour to be served as only 1 waiting staff serving about 100 people. Breakfast is vile! Watery beans, saugages that taste of cardboard, there was no bacon left so can't comment on that (!), croisants are in a big bin and people use their hands to rumage around to get them, oh, and good luck getting a mug for tea or coffee if you get that far! No soap or washing products supplied in the rooms. Room styles vary enourmously. (On each stay the rooms were very different). There are currently building works at the rear of the hotel which started at 6am. The first floor corridor smelt of sick and public toilets. The smell was so bad it put us off eating (no exageration, it was absolutely disgusting!) The lifts smell of cigarette smoke & urine and are filthy. No telephone in the room, so you can't even call reception. So, if you do happen to have kids partying on your landing you can't call reception. BAD IDEA TRAVELODGE!!!! GOOD POINTS Bedlinen and towels were clean Bed was comfy Kettle, tea & coffee. You can order bar-food and take it to your room, but the menu is limited and there is defo no room service! If you get this hotel for Â£10-20 and can put up with the above, then book. If not avoid this place like the plague!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid if possible”
Reviews.Author: SarahnJ0hn
Reviews.Content: I stay a many Travelodges around the country so booked this believing it would be standard reasonably priced accomodation. The location was not that geat at 15 minutes from Kings Cross down a raher unpleasant London street. Reception was average. The room booked was a family room. To get to this room, we took a lift, then had to got down a badly lit, poorly carpeted staircase to the basement.. There was an unpleasant smell of damp. The corridor was dirty and the room in need of total refurbishment. It was below street level but at the top of the window it was possible to see people walking by. The bathroom was gross being very old with mould around the bath. Totally revolting.

Reviews.Title: “Just aweful”
Reviews.Author: alandnic
Reviews.Content: Mouldy walls, holes in sheets, mattresses with not many springs to the square feet and curtains hanging off. Asked for a quiet room and got it but did not recon on the tour parties running around the corridors till 4am. Paper thin doors and had to "ask" people outside to be quiet n- didn't work! They could not cope with breakfast and queues to get in were big. Bacon was rationed in an amazing way ( I asume to cut down cost) - plenty of plates but no food! Don't forget your toiletries - there arn't any in the room except a minisule bar of cheap soap.

Reviews.Title: “Worst place I've stayed in London.”
Reviews.Author: Dogbonnet
Reviews.Content: I visit London regularly and have stayed in lots of different hotels there, but this is the worst I have stayed at - and all under a corporate name! It cost us Â£60, which seemed reasonable, and despite being a bit light on money at the moment, knew how much our 3 year old son loved London and decided to go for it. We arrived for 3pm to be told by the staff that we hadn't booked there, and it must be the other King's Cross hotel, so went there, found out that was wrong and had to return to this one, which WAs the correct booking! The automatic doors at the entrance didn't work and only opened about 50cm - classy entrance! We dropped our stuff without checking the room, imagining it to be cheap and cheerful and that we should accept that - we left because we wanted our son to make the most of his visit. The main concern at this point was that the lights on floor 5 weren't working, and that there were gangs of Italian youths bellowing everywhere When we arrived back at 10pm it was lights out straight away, due to our boy being tired, and us anticipating a bad nights sleep. The sleep wasn't too bad for a place so full, but in the morning, we saw the full horror of where we were staying. The kettle had been filled with coffee by some previous residents and not cleaned, the place was streaked with uncleaned dirt, the shower did not work as the tap had been broken and not replaced, the plug was held together by some wire that you use to fasten food bags, and then worst of all, whilst I was in the bathroom and my wife reading on the bed, our son pulled up the unfastened window, which stated it had limited opening for our safety. This was on the 5th floor! My wife went to shut the window and keep him away from there. Then we looked at the window in general....it had a good deal of mould at the top, and the frame did not fit the window, leaving gaps at the top and right of the window, that had been stuffed with tissue paper! No wonder it had been so noisy! The furniture was broken and unusable also. When we went downstairs to complain, the chap at the desk seemed unapologetic, and we were told that the manager would ring us that morning (still waiting....) The foyer smelt heavily of urine and had cigarette butts everywhere. Honestly, take my recommendation and never ever stay there. To think that Travelodge must make very large sums of money seems a crime! I am going to contact health and safety today.....

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful attitude to people with disabilities ?”
Reviews.Author: PeterPan2
Reviews.Content: Room was next door to a ? plant room with loud noise of a compressor, generator or air conditioning unit continuing all night. Not acceptable. To make it worse, it was a room for people using wheelchairs - gave the impression of "sticking people with disabilities anywhere we can fit them in". Although I do not have a disability, the impression given was not good on any basis.

Reviews.Title: “Been to better Travelodges”
Reviews.Author: RoyE
Reviews.Content: Disappointed with this Travelodge Hotel. For a hotel in London with visitors arriving from airports & trains I was amazed that there was no facility to store luggage if you arrived before the official booking in time. Travellers cannot always arrange travelling times around booking in times. The space available in the foyer area could facilitate a secure storage area. When we arrived a few hours early a room was ready for us and we were charge Â£10 for early access, very disappointing. (Since writing this and looking at their website, it lists a luggage locker facility at Â£10 per locker). The hotel in general was basic although the decoration was much to be desired. I wondered if Travelodge had recently acquired this hotel and was in the process of refurbishing it. The room had all the facilities required for a comfortable stay, tea, coffee, TV etc. Although they only supplied a towel for one person. The breakfast was very good, varied selection and arranged out so you could visit each section without having to queue. Breakfast/bar area was next to the entrance and when visitors stood near the entrance, which was operated by a sensor, the door would stay open causing a cold wind and cigarette smoke to blow into the eating area. Staff were helpful and efficient. Not sure I would stay at this Travelodge again, would most likely return to Days Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid, avoid, avoid.....!!!!”
Reviews.Author: tazman1963
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay with my wife and 9 year old son. On arrival I was told that I had two rooms booked when I only needed/booked one and to make things worse it could only be sorted out by emailing customer services (still waiting for a reply !!!). The main problem for me was the hordes of ill-mannered, ignorant, inconsiderate Italian students staying in the hotel. They seemed to be everywhere, in the lifts, waiting for lifts, loitering in reception and making noise till very late at night. One morning my family and I were having breakfast when two of the students decided to stand at our table and proceed to eat their food without so much as a 'excuse me'.......... god that pissed me off !!! I had a room booked at a Premier Inn but cancelled it to save a few quid, do yourself a favour and spend a bit more on a decent hotel........don't make the same mistake I did.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel I have ever had the misfortune to stay in!”
Reviews.Author: Roommover
Reviews.Content: This was truly a hotel from hell! Mould all over the Walls, drafts through the windows, damp sheets which my 10 year old couldn't sleep in so had to sleep fully dressed, gangs of teenagers roaming the corridors trying to get into our rooms, police called in at 1:30 am to keep watch on floor 5 which had little effect, drawers hanging off units, pitch black corridors, vomit in the sink when you arrive in your room...........I could go on! Environmental health need contacting and this "hotel" needs shutting down!!! I have never experienced anything like it!! Do not under any circumstances stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: Dotsmell
Reviews.Content: The rooms are damp dirty and stink. Gangs of teenagers roam the corridors banging on doors and scaring my daughter and I to death. We are there now. The hotel say they cannot move us. There is vomit in the sink and water running down the Walls next to the bed. My friend is on second floor which is better. Fifth floor is hell.

Reviews.Title: “don't listen to the reviews”
Reviews.Author: harribo1989
Reviews.Content: i read the reviews before i booked, so it was with great trepidation that my daughter and i entered room 201 to find that it was............ok. nothing at all like the reviews. the bed linen was clean and the bed comfortable, no springs sticking out! the carpet and curtains were clean. the bathroom was clean with clean towels. the only problem for me was the queuing fiasco for breakfast. when you did eventually get it, after 30 minutes wait, searching for chairs, waiting for mugs, bowls and plates, waiting for the scrambled eggs and bacon to be replenished, the food was very good with a good choice. i would definately stay at this hotel again, it was so close to kings x railway station, i would book room only.

Reviews.Title: “Definately not as bad a people make out”
Reviews.Author: SAB528
Reviews.Content: Rooms could do with a refurb but for Â£65 sat night and Â£29 sun night for a hotel in London you really can't complain. Staff on reception very nice and helpful and rooms were clean and beds were comfortable. If you want luxury then you need to put your hand in your pocket and pay for it!!!!!! Hotel was 5 mins walk from kings cross station and underground and 15 mins from Euston station. We found travelling by black cab cheaper than normal taxis and DO NOT ASK HOTEL TO ORDER TAXI the company they use are a rip off.

Reviews.Title: “Travelodge Customer Service!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: SueF2305
Reviews.Content: On booking this hotel, we encountered serious problems, we booked one room for one night and were charged 6 times. So instead of being charged Â£52.80, we were charged Â£316.80. That was booked on Feb 16th 2011, as yet we still can't get a refund or speak to anyone. On arrival at the Royal Scot Travelodge we thought perhaps the hotel could help us. Check in was great, very friendly & polite receptionist, who passed us on to the hotel manager Ruth. She took copies of all our documentation including bank statements and promised this would be sorted before we checked out. Did this happen no, 3 days later and we have returned home and she won't even return my call. The room, was clean, comfortable and had everything that it should have although the bathroom was very small. We had booked for breakfast & the following morning we handed our voucher to the very unpleasant staff member, who muttered something and pushed cutlery into my hand. There was a good selection of cereal, there was plenty of bread you could toast, however, the hot food was minimal, bacon, sausage, baked beans & scrambled eggs. The plates where very cold, so by the time you got to your seat your breakfast was cold. There wasn't any cups ready for hot drinks and the same staff member wasn't very helpful. Overall the hotel was fine, but the staff & the company are absolutely atrocious, never again would I use Travelodge again.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as some of the other reviews made out”
Reviews.Author: Bwoodcock
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a twin room last night, the hotel is very much in need of an updated makeover, our room was shabby but clean, quiet, the beds were comfy, the lifts were a bit dodgy and for some reason there were lots of teenagers staying, however they quiet and we weren't disturbed. The staff were friendly and there was plenty of food at breakfast. I wouldn't rush to stay again, however it was cheap and easy to get too and only a few minutes from the tube station.

Reviews.Title: “Very bad first impressions, but acceptable in the end.”
Reviews.Author: RobR67
Reviews.Content: Reflecting what many others have said, the first impressions are not good. The building has the look of a student residence, and not up to usual Travelodge 'basic but clean' standards. I was issued a room on the 5th floor, and suddenly found myself in the middle of a very loud group of Italian school kids. Realising I wouldn't get much sleep, I asked if another room would be available for a change, and was surprised how quickly and efficiently I was offered an alternative room in the "quiet section" of the hotel. That was on the 3rd floor, looking on to a very quiet crescent well away from the main road. The 3rd floor corridors seem to be recently refurbished and the room was surprisingly pleasant, even if still a little rough round the edges. The 5th floor seems to be designated for the school groups and should be avoided at all costs! For London I found it reasonable value for money and within walking distance - yes the 15 min version - of St. pancreas station for my early Eurostar the following morning.

Reviews.Title: “DIRTY, RUN DOWN, NOISY, AVOID, FOOD TERRIBLE, STAFF POOR”
Reviews.Author: avfc4life16
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 1 night and have to say this was the worst hotel experience I have ever had. Travelodge hotels are generally cheap but good value normally. I arrived at the hotel thinking it was quite cheap for London but Travelodge's are a famous chain and must have a minimum standard??? How wrong. We arrived at the hotel and immediately it was incredibly dirty and the staff were really rude and poor. Initially they couldnt find us or any knowledge of a booking and then miracously they did find us. The rooms were very shabby, skirting boards and walls all stained and dirty, mould in the bathrooms, paint falling off the walls, No decour in the room and the window didnt shut properly. Therefore it was really noisy all night and hardly slept. Breakfast was SHOCKING! Very poor selection, none of the staff knew what they were doing. Ran out of breakfast items and when asked a member of staff to re-fill was told they couldnt as they were not allowed to move from the spot because their manager would shout!!! Chairs were fithly dity, rubbish and litter on the floors, tables weren't cleaned. After leaving this hotel you genuinely feel you need to be fumagated!! None of the chairs in the lobby rea matched, the lifts were shabby and did not feel safe in them at all. Horrendous experience... never again and would not recommend this to anyone. Not Travelodge standard at all and avoid at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “worse than an old student hall of residence”
Reviews.Author: felixandmaddie
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights either side of a trip to Paris. We picked this Travelodge thinking it would be close to Eurostar - our first mistake. The '3 mins' to St.Pancras is more like 15, especially when wheeling luggage. Inside the hotel the interior is cheap - carpet held down with duct tape, chipped and tatty paint, smell of 'old socks' in the corridors. Inside the room it was more of the same, dirty carpet, chipped walls, scuffed black marks on skirting board. Marshmallowy mattress, the bathroom toilet had brown limescale on it as did the sink plughole. We found the previous occupants shopping labels next to the TV which made you wonder just how thoroughly the room had been cleaned. It was noisy, full of school parties and generally highly unpleasant. And the worst thing was it wasn't even cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Location ok”
Reviews.Author: treacle/simon
Reviews.Content: Whilst this hotel is not the best, we only paid Â£107.00 for two people for two night so I'm not complaining. We had to move rooms and the second room was quite a way from the reception in a sort of basement but it was fine. There were a few issues but they were sorted out straight away. The food and drink in the bar was reasonable and I liked the fact that there was a bar that you could come back to at the end of the night which wasn't going to cost you the earth. Breakfast was a bit of a scrable as there wee lots of people but lots of choice and tasty as well. this was included in the above price so not too bad at all really. The lifts weren't working which was a bit inconvenient but we were only a coupl,e of floors up so not too much of a problem to use the stairs. When they did work on the firsy day they were in a bad state of repair so i preferred the stairs anyway. We managed to sleep well and found that there was no noise. All in all, a cheap london hotel, I don't know if I would stay again as I know that you can get hotels nearer to the tube stations but for that money it was fine

Reviews.Title: “Atorciously poor”
Reviews.Author: NickSFCB
Reviews.Content: The roof was mouldy, the televison cracked, and a plaster was keeping he indow together. To class this as a hotel is unfair to hotels, a persistent alarm was goign off early in the morning and went going for at least 30minutes.We were nott he only people to experience problems, as a group of women also were making a complaint as we vacated the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Cheap as chips but perfectly OK”
Reviews.Author: Andysa59
Reviews.Content: Booked 2 nights at the ridiculously low price of Â£80 total for a family room. Even though there were only two of us I though I would avail of the extra space as it was the same price. Read the reviews after I booked and thought OH OH!! Pleasantly surprised, room was spacious, clean and quiet (on 3rd floor so traffic noise not a problem). Hotel quite shabby but only 5 min walk from Kings Cross station. Don't think you would get better value in central London. Won't suit everyone but it did the job.

Reviews.Title: “only stay here if you're not bothered about sleeping”
Reviews.Author: carolineaw
Reviews.Content: I booked to stay at the Travelodge Royal Scot in Kings Cross on 9th September, as my colleague and I were to catch a very early train the following morning. My first impressions weren't good. The level of mess in the lobby was disgusting. There was rubbish absolutely everywhere. There was graffiti in the lifts, and there were hundreds of noisy teenagers running riot in the lobby and on most levels, including on our corridor where we were supposed to be getting a good nights sleep. It was very daunting to be surrounded by such noise and mess. I could hear the noise clearly from our twin room. The beds were smaller than an average single bed although the linen was clean. No wake up call, no hairdryer. The lights blew and we were left with one bedside lamp. The bathroom had mould along the tiles and the bottom of the bath was not dirty but grubby (just needed a spot of bleach) The walls were tatty and I've stayed in better hostels. I really did not feel comfortable at the Royal Scot and I soon realised that it may be quite difficult to get a good nights sleep (if any) I left the building and headed over to the other Travelodge in Kings Cross, on Grays Inn road. A very courteous girl at he desk in the lobby told me that unfortunately they were fully booked and so we couldn't move hotels. Around 11pm, we went straight to bed, despite the noise, which was still loud. I awoke at 05.30 as scheduled, only to discover my colleague had not slept until 03.30. She felt awful and consequently was not able to work the following day. She went back home and I went to Paris by myself. Fulfilling not only my work, but hers too. I was shattered at the end of the day, she had to miss a days work and so in conclusion, our stay at the Royal Scot was an enormous waste of money and time. I would not recommend staying at the Royal Scot, I would actively deter anyone from staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Not Travelodge standards - avoid”
Reviews.Author: FrankStilgoe
Reviews.Content: Room was in a terrible condition: Wallpaper was ripped and falling off the wall The window would not shut properly and the window lock was broken The door did not close properly and rattled as people passed in the corridor outside The furniture, drawers, were broken The curtains did not close properly and were very shabby I contacted Travelodge about this and they "Thanked me for the feedback". This has definitely put me off using Travelodge in the future

Reviews.Title: “Poor....but can make for it at a saver rate”
Reviews.Author: pravish08
Reviews.Content: We checked in this hotel over the Christmas period for a couple of days and got it at a saver rate averaging Â£40 per night. It's a 10 min walk from Kings Cross station. On arrival, after ringing the bell a few times, we were NOT greeted by Maria at reception who came towards us asking if we were checking it. We got our room cards and were hoping to have a good enough room after having read the dreadful reviews and pics here. Luckily the room looked better than the pictures we saw with no damage to the wallpapers/windows..etc. There was a little flat screen tv as well. The bathroom was quite smelly though.....as if it has not been used for a while. The bed was the worst I've seen in my life......we were sinking in that mattress and felt as if the springs in the mattress were getting into our body. We did not complain about our room/bathroom fearing we might get something worse (similar to the pics posted here). We were just hoping when we could get back home for some nice sleep. Room was not serviced as well for 2 days and had to ask for clean towels at reception (which was run by only one staff at times......). Also, we had to reactivate our room cards every day and had to wait at reception. We did not try the food in its bar. Only one lift was working and it felt strange as well. We mainly used the stairs since we were on the first floor but those were dirty as well and smelled as bad as the bathroom in our room. We checked out after 4 nights and again met with our dear Maria who frowned at us and said: 'Checking out??!!!.' Not even a smile. I know its not a five star but at least reception staff should show some politeness to guests. We were happy to get away from there. I would surely not recommend this hotel to anyone but if you are in london on a budget and manage to get this room at one of those cheap rates....then go for it. Otherwise, you should get some better value for your money elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely not worth the money even in London”
Reviews.Author: reddogwhite
Reviews.Content: Just back from a night in London to see a show and visit the Wiliam Morris Gallery. From the sublime William Morris and his contemporaries to the ridiculous - our overnight stay was at a Travelodge. Location nameless but near a station. The trouble with being an Interior Designer is that you see all the faults in a quick glance so how about this list. Bed squashy and only one thin feather pillow which made me itch within 2 minutes of lying down. Changed for a lumpy synthetic one found in the wardrobe. Filthy blackout-lined curtains with the usual section fallen off its hooks so it is pulling away from the track. Gathering too tight to allow the curtains to cover the window so gaps of light appeared around the window. Blackout linings cracking and coming apart. Secondary glazing over a filthy square-sided window bay with one window left open so noise and cold came in round the edges. A bathroom so small that swinging anything let alone a cat was impossible so we took it is shifts to use the room. Ventilation fan not working ( are they ever in hotels?) so the mirror steamed up and had to be dried with a towel. No shampoo or hairdryer. The smallest piece of soap possible in a sliver of paper. Towel radiator not working - apparently heated towel rails are no longer approved of in hotel bathrooms as guests may not understand the notice which warns them it is hot. What is the purpose of a heated towel radiator if NOT to be hot so as to make the towels warm and dry? Sealant around bath and basin black with mould. Sealeant around top of built-in WC unit falling out in black lumps. Plastic disposable mugs in the bathroom. Bedroom furniture must have been at least 20 years old and in desparate need of a face-lift as covered with scratches. Corridor walls and lifts bashed and marked. half the lights not working - we tried moving bulbs from one fitment to another but it seemed the light fittings were broken. I won't go into the chaos that was breakfast. Suffice it to say that this hotel lacked any charm at all and was barely suitable for one night's rest.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel, absolutely terrible.”
Reviews.Author: timmins257
Reviews.Content: Room awful,no toilet roll, tv didnt work,wall lights didnt work,mould around the window, lifts not working full of graffiti, it had an empty brandy bottle in all weekend on the floor .Cooked breakfast not eatable.We could loan an hairdryer just for 1 hour.If this is what travelodges are like we will never stay in one again.

Reviews.Title: “Room okay, public areas terrible”
Reviews.Author: EnglishRose79
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights. We were greeted by a rather run down looking reception with some very strange people hanging around which made me feel a bit uneasy. Had a terrible check in experience - staff very unfriendly and argumentative. A double room had been booked but on their system it said a twin. In the end we just accepted our lot. We paid for a locker to store bags so that we could go out and explore freely. We did not notice that once items were in the locker you couldn't return as many times as you wanted and would have to buy another locker token. Be warned!! The hotel has clearly had issues int eh past with non guests accessing the hotel - to get anywhere beyond reception you need your card. You might expect to then see nicer public areas beyond the locked doors, but it is still grotty and unwelcoming. Only one lift worked which is not very good in a large and busy hotel. When we were finally able to access the room, we found it to be a decent size and clean so nothing much to complain about there really. Overall, the location was great for the meeting I had in the area for work and good enough for the extra days I had booked to explore London. The hotel itself wasn't too bad once you got beyond the public areas and the staff let the place down. If this hotel was cheapest in my search then I would stay here again and I know exactly what to expect, but it wouldn't be my first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Squashed in a lift. Stalked by weirdos & stained bedding!”
Reviews.Author: k20below
Reviews.Content: Dear oh dear. Upon arriving, me & my friend were very glad to be in the building having wandered around lost & finding out how bad the area was. The lobby is very very nice looking, with a restaurant on the side. The girl on reception spoke as LITTLE as possible. Only then talking to us, to complain that we only had a twenty pound note and she'd have to get change, sorry for putting you out there. Didn't think getting ten pound change would be a problem for a paying customer. We were paying for early check in..... We were given our key and vaguely pointing down the room she told us our room was on the second floor. We headed to the three lifts, only one was working. Awesome. When the lift opened, my jaw dropped. It wasn't big enough for my case, let alone two adults and two cases on wheels. We squeezed in & stared at all the grafitti on the walls of the lift. Classy! Lift door opened (which was a relief cos its the kind of lift that you imagine DYING IN). We were glared at by cleaner staff, which only added to the negative feeling I was getting from this DUMP of a hotel. People sure have excellent customer service and relation skills in this travelodge, why I think I'll book some more nights....not. The room was another shock, peeling woodwork, tiny bathroom, the bath was not big enough to drown a mouse. Two beds, with paper thin duvets and one pillow? ONE PILLOW? And a tiny pathetic excuse for a heater in the corner. We FROZE, all night & every moment we were in the room. The cleaners came and cleaned the room while we were out the following day, and changed my friends bedding to STAINED bedding. Could NOT believe it. Couldn't even be bothered to complain because it was just a typical stinky dump, that should be shut down. How they get away with health and safety, I have no idea?! Didn't eat in the restaurant cos it was a complete joke of a price. If the food was anything like the service and state of the hotel, no thanks. We went to a takeaway two minutes down the road, food was amazing. I will NEVER stay in this hotel again, I feel RIPPED OFF at the money that was spent to stay here. They should have paid ME to stay. Three lifts, for a good amount of floors and only one working, and looking back at the other reviews, seems the lifts have been out of service for a long time, so no excuse really. Not like they are using my money to pay for cleaning products, as the place was a dump. Never ever again. Oh & because of the rubbish broken lifts, a load of Australian people forced their way into the lift when there was FOUR of us in there already, with room for only two, was a nice way to end my stay with someone's face an inch away from my FACE. What an absolute joke of a hotel. (& we got followed, twice. So I would NOT RECOMMEND to anyone that isn't in a group with less than twenty people in the group. Dodgy area). (and to think i came here to relax, what a joke, could of stayed at home in the shed and had more satisfaction).

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for...in this case, not a lot!”
Reviews.Author: SRRNorthamptonshire
Reviews.Content: The most basic of accomodation. Very tired. Graffitti in the internal lifts. Stained carpets, walls and bedding. Rooms equipped with TV and kettle only (no phone, no toiletries, no hairdryer and just the one thin towel).

Reviews.Title: “No problems, fine for one night”
Reviews.Author: xtelx
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night whilst away on business and found it to be perfectly fine, better than other travellodges I've stayed in to be honest. No it's not 5 star luxury but if that's what you want don't book a room in a travellodge. The room was a good size with a small but perfectly fine bathroom and everything was clean. Great location being a 10 minute walk from Kings Cross station allowing easy travel around London and for getting to and from airports. Only problem was that the lift had broken on my arrival and I found out that this was due to a power failure which I think effected some rooms as well but not mine. This was no great inconvenience to me and I believe it may have had something to do with the wintery weather they were experiencing at the time, shocking considering it was in winter I think you'll agree! All in all perfectly fine hotel where I would stay again either for business or pleasure and for multiple nights.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly adequate - You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: VJLowman
Reviews.Content: After booking this for myself and some friends and reading these reviews afterwards, I was worried that I'd made a big mistake! I was dreading arriving, in fear of what I'd let my friends in for! Our arrival at reception did little to suppress the fears I had when there was a man complaining about their bed being very uncomfortable and the mattress sagging in th middle. However, when we actually got to our rooms I let out a big sigh of relief! We were on the third floor in rooms 320 and 335, both twins. They were far enough down the corridor that you couldn't hear the lift so it was generally pretty quiet apart from a little traffic noise and the odd person/people walking past the room. The rooms were clean, which is the main thing. I found the bed pretty comfortable. A trip to reception was needed for an extra pillow as we both wanted 2 but there was only the one spare in the very spacious wardrobe. The reception staff were fine and happy to hand over the extra pillow. The rooms weren't the warmest and the duvets were on the thin side so we asked for a blanket at reception also (after searching the wardrobe to no avail) but they said they didn't have any extra blankets. Slightly annoying but the chap was rather apologetic and actually I wasn't as cold as I expected to be during the night. There was a kettle, mugs and tea/coffee, but no hairdryer. The carpet looked and felt perfectly clean to me. The bathroom was small but adequate and most importantly clean, no mildew in sight! We booked on a room only basis and didn't bother trying the hotel breakfast as there were a number of cafes and a McDonalds on the way to the tube station - a 10 minute walk. Overall, this hotel was just fine for what we wanted. It's cheap and cheerful. We'd come to London to see London, museums and a show, not to spend time in our hotel so as a base to sleep, shower and change it was great. Yes it's a little run down, parts are in need of a lick of paint, there is a little bit of graffiti in the lifts (but not loads and it's not particularly offensive or anything) and the woman's voice in the lifts sounds utterly bored and fed up (some reviewers seem to have been offended by her however she did nothing but provide us with amusement!!), but for Â£26 a night each in central London I wasn't expecting luxury. It did the job. I would happily go back again if I was on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant value, but don't expect five star service...”
Reviews.Author: DanDino385
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for four nights in January with a friend in a twin room, which we got for Â£29 per night, which works out at Â£58 each for four nights in Central London - a definite bargain but we were a little concerned by some of the negative reviews we had read. The hotel is a little tired but clean, and the hotel staff were friendly and professional. The cleanliness of the room we stayed in was very good and we had daily housekeeping. We may have benefitted from the fact we were at the end of a corridor so didn't have people walking past the room, but the hotel was relatively quiet considering it is on a main thoroughfare. We did not try the restaurant or the all-you-can-eat Â£7.50 breakfast in the hotel as there was a perfectly adequate 'greasy spoon' just around the corner that did a full English, tea & toast for Â£4.50 which we had breakfast in on the way to the tube. I'd recommend this hotel if you're on a budget and you're going to be out in London more than you plan to be sitting in your room - it's a perfectly adequate base from which to explore from.

Reviews.Title: “Not so bad after all”
Reviews.Author: django2000
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot and stay cheap and cheerful if I am not expensing it! So after reading some reviews I was very pleasantly surprised. Staff friendly, twin room good size, clean, slept well. I paid Â£20 a night and dont expect much but if you can get it cheap it's fine. Area is ok. Couple of good pubs. Try turning left and walk 5-10 mins to exmouth market, good bars and food. Half way you pass a good gastro pub.

Reviews.Title: “Don't pay a lot to stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Smog
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for 2 nights and only ended up staying one!! I stayed in a triple room that you could not swing a cat in! The single beds were so close together that if you rolled over too quickly could end up on the next bed. I ma sure the beds were intended for children and not adults. The room had not been cleaned properly from the previous occupants and had light bulbs out. I found the room quite depressing. If you get this room for a very small amount of money and just want somewhere to sleep, then maybe it is worth it as the location is good. If you are being charged a decent amount then definitely look elsewhere. We moved to the Holiday Inn Kings Cross for our second night, and it was like a palace in comparison to here - for the same price. Shop around!! The only thing in their favour was that the management dealt with my complaints well - maybe they are used to them!!

Reviews.Title: “Probably Time They Pulled it Down”
Reviews.Author: mike_in_orchard
Reviews.Content: Of course, probably like most people who stay here, it cost us very little. And I guess it's a case of getting what you pay for. The fact is that the building was probably put up in the sixties, it's a huge barracks of a place, it's in a not very congenial location, so the staff have an uphill struggle to make the place presentable. Our bedroom was small, no chair, we couldn't get the TV remote to work, the extraction fan in the bathroom was falling off the wall and there were screws sticking out of the side of the bath. And the beds are extra narrow. Nevertheless it seemed clean and we slept well. The cafe downstairs looked quite jolly. But we'll avoid it next time, however cheap it is.

Reviews.Title: “People need to get a grip”
Reviews.Author: sexyJetSetter
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on trip advisor concerning this travel lodge i was incrediably worried about visiting this travel lodge and in all honesty, it ruined the entire atmosphere and excitement of my little trip. I really think that people who write reviews in here need to stop exaggerating and need to get a grip- its a travel lodge- in london- its not the 'Hilton'- if you pay Â£29 a night you cannot expect 5 star quality. Personally, both my partner and I were impressed with this travel lodge. Receptionist was polite and helpful, the lifts were a bit dodgy but they did work and I have been in worse. The furniture in the rooms is dated and old, I would have to stay but the room was spotlessly clean and on top of that, the cleaners came everyday. I was also concerned that the lodge would be noisy at night but it was very quiet and I received a wonderful nights sleep. I did not use the restaurant and therefore could nether recommend or condemn it. However, this travel lodge is in a fabulous location and Kings Cross is now a safe and clean area with fantatstic transport links. While I understand that other rooms may have not been up to par with ours, I really do not think there is any need for some of the reviews concerning this travel lodge on this website and I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “good value if you can get it at Â£29 per room”
Reviews.Author: henrySunerland
