Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews for this hotel I was really not sure wether to go or not. However it was only 3 nights so we bit the bullet and went. We used to live in London and I could remember the area was not very good but it was okay. We drove down and parked in the carpark joined to the hotel, and as I am disabled I have a blue badge so it was free. Also I did not have to pay congestion charge so look into this if you are going to London.and have a motorbility car. The rooms themselves were not as good as the premier inns that we have stayed at but ours was clean and comfortable, (it was not a disabled room) My relations thought it was okay also. The thing that needs to be looked into was the communial area which is also the bar and cafe. The chairs are stained with food and drink and even though it was cleaned the carpet needs replacing. we travel loads in this country and abroad and people will only get what they pay for so book early and you will get good value.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected...”
Reviews.Author: LAPO76
Reviews.Content: Reading the reviews on here... I was actually scared... in reality the hotel is decent! It was my first time in a Travelodge... so I did not know that in the bathroom there is no shampoo, hairdryer and toiletries... but to be honest... with the amount I spent for a 2 nights in London... I can't really complaint! It's basic... but it did the job! We were given a top floor room. Nice view from the window, the bathroom was ok. the mattress a bit too soft and sprung type... which I do not expect anymore in a decent hotel since 1990... but I managed to sleep. The staff at reception were friendly, room was clean. To be honest... it worked out well for me... I think I'll probably go back if in London for a shopping break.

Reviews.Title: “AWFUL!!!!”
Reviews.Author: sassylady24
Reviews.Content: This has to be the WORST hotel i have stayed in we booked this as it was close to the Eurostar as we had an early departure. We booked a double room on arrival we checked in was give a room took ages to get to lifts terrible!! entering room looked on then we realised it wasnt even a double it was twin pushed together with wheels on!!!! there was rusty nails sticking out the skirting board the tv didnt work no batteries in the remote the towels and sheets looked grubby. Bathroom was Just as bad!!! It was throughly disappointing terrible start to our holiday and a complete let down by the Travelodge Chain. It was very noisy through the night and i think alot of the rooms where being used for some sort of business without being too rude!! Will NEVER Return.

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful”
Reviews.Author: Shirley274
Reviews.Content: One on the worst hotels we stayed at, but as it was only for one night when we needed to catch an early train we were able to put it with it. Went to have a beer, and it was warm (bottled beer only). Went across the road and had a lovely cold one at the local pub. After the warm beer experience we decided not to eat there so can not comment on the food.

Reviews.Title: “Horrific hotel - breached major H&S rules, total dump!!!”
Reviews.Author: Meggymog
Reviews.Content: As regular visitors to the Travelodge chain we had no qualms about our one night stay here as we have found the chain usually offers good value for money. However this hotel was complete and utter nightmare. We had some clue when, on arriving at St Pancreas and getting in the taxi the driver laughed when we told him where we were staying. After fighting our way through the drunk gang spitting and fighting at the door we were given our room key and told our room was on floor 5. The lifts were stinking (hate to think what of) and very rickety. The hall outside our room was filled with people milling around and smoking. Our room (a triple) had a broken bed, grimy linen, broken toilet and the wallpaper was handing off. I have never felt so unsafe in any place I have been too. We went downstairs to ask to be moved and were further alarmed to find ourselves met in reception my the hotels own "bouncers" who were breaking up a fight at the door. The receptionist could not give a monkeys about our complaint. We told him that it was illegal for smoking and that we felt unsafe and could he please phone alternative Travelodges for us to move. It was almost midnight and he said they were all full but if we "wandered about the local streets" we might find somewhere - to suggest this to a couple with a 10 year old child was just nonsense. He refused to phone, however eventually another staff member (the barman) said we could use the phone and try to get somewhere else to stay. By this time the Police had arrived to sort out the melee in reception. Eventually we got the night porter at the Kings Cross Travelodge hotel nearby who said he had rooms and told us to come round. Interestingly he said that he had himself called the Police on the Royal Scot several times as their guests had caused problems on numerous occasions. We have complained to Travelodge and, interesting, since we made our complaint they have changed their website and now state that this hotel is "an acquisition" and the rooms "are not of the standard shown on the photos". Basically unless you want to take your life in your hands and stay in a stinking dosshouse where people smoke, shout, swear and fight and the staff can't be bothered then please please please go elsewhere. This hotel is not representative of the Travelodge chain and is, quite simply, a total dump!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap but NOT cheerful!”
Reviews.Author: asl693
Reviews.Content: I can't criticise the price - Â£32 for one night in the centre of London isn't a bad price. However I most certainly wouldn't want to stay more than the one night. The hotel is a dump - unclean, shabby, and in need of a serious makeover. The staff are miserable and even the state of their clothes isn't good, unless dirty, creased, off-white shirts are part of the uniform! My advice is give it a miss, pay a bit more and go for something a bit more upmarket.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - however run down inside and rubbish service”
Reviews.Author: jessmh20
Reviews.Content: First time staying in a travelodge and had my doubts, however was assured by my partner that they're better than their reputation. Receptionist friendly. Went to our room, view of some train tracks. Immediately notice that the radiator is falling off of the wall and later when I attempt to close the curtains the curtain rail comes off the wall. Not impressed so far. We went down to the bar to have a drink however there was noone there even though it opened more than an hour earlier. We waited for more than 10 mins with nobody arriving to serve us before I went to reception to ask for someone to come up. Someone arrived promptly. Went to pop back to our room before going for dinner else where but my swipe card had stopped working, had to trek it to reception to get another one. Breakfast in the morning was lacklustre to say the best, toast, cereal, sweaty looking cheese and the odd croissant on offer. Noone there when we entered the cafe and never asked for our voucher (as we had paid for breakfast when booking), needn't have paid at all and not a smile to be had when he did arrive. My partner also suggests that this was comparably expensive for a travelodge at Â£75 for a (shoddy) double room. However London prices must be taken into account I suppose. Thoroughly disappointed and won't be staying here again, or at any other Travelodge if I can help it. Go to Novotel the other side of Kings Cross Station - Lovely hotel, great service, excellent breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Worth it if you book ahead in sales for bargain price”
Reviews.Author: realcountrybumpkin
Reviews.Content: There are very mixed reviews about this hotel. We stayed over the xmas period. Less people around so not so noisy, but on Boxing Day plenty of tourists arrived and it got noisier in the evenings. We had a triple room with 3 single beds. Booked ahead so it cost only Â£29 per room. At that price we cannot really complain about anything! But to give assistance to others, read on. Arrival was fine with friendly staff. Chambermaid did basic cleaning and did not make up the beds, give any soap or toilet paper, but you can always get some at reception. My bed mattress was lumpy and gave me backache for a few days but all the other beds were ok. TV has extra channels. Across road is a small supermarket open late and a fast food chop. Around the corner are all the shops you need in Kings X area. 2 McDs nearby. Car parking is handy there, although it is not secure. I parked 5 mins away in a secure park through internet booking. We did not have breakfast there, but the bar was nice and friendly place in evening. Halogen heaters were on due to the v cold weather. I doubt I would have been happy paying full price at this hotel, but book ahead in the Travelodge sales and you wont find anything so cheap.

Reviews.Title: “ITS NOT THAT BAD!! REALLY IT ISNT!”
Reviews.Author: katezisthesex
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights with my partner for a nice city break so literally just wanted a place to sleep and have breakfast!.. the room was fine big enough comfyish bed and was just a basic room to sleep in! very safe room had a double lock etc.. breakfast was nice however the only downside was if u got there lateish there is NO WHERE to sit.. they do not cater for the amount of people that are staying in the hotel so we found ourselves waiting for a table which isnt all that great to be honest.. It is about a 5-10 minute walk from kings cross station and the underground which was fantastic for getting out and about.. lots of shops and places to eat in kings cross too but didnt eat there so cannot comment.. Really this is not a bad hotel.. yes the wallpaper may not be up to scratch but WHO CARES?! are u people staying here all day and not venturing out to see this fab city?! We got up at 730 had breakfast till 8.. left the hotel at 810am and didnt return until about 11.30pm?! All in all this hotel was fine and I would stay here again and i love London! :)

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is not half as bad as people say”
Reviews.Author: Kimpel
Reviews.Content: I was in London with my Boyfriend from the 26th untill the 29th of November. I read alot of bad reviews about this hotel after making my reservation and I was really afraid to see where we would end up. We arrived at the hotel after a few minutes walk from St Pancreas, which was okay. The woman at the reception was friendly at check in! When we went up to see the room the lifts were clean and we didn't have to wait at all. To my suprise the room was clean and quite spacy! The stairs were stained by gum, but that is just the visitors of the hotel who have no respect what so ever! We had no problem at all finding a place to sit in the breakfast area and the breakfast was quite nice. Allthough the chairs and floor were also stained, but again, that's just due to a lack of respect. After visiting this hotel I have no idea what the fuss is all about, I would still recommend it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “AWFULL - Do Not visit this hotel”
Reviews.Author: GEMMACoventry
Reviews.Content: Here is a bullet point list of what was wrong with this hotel Poor customer service Â£15 per day to use the car park Smelly and un clean beding Grafiti filled lifts No maid turned up to clean our room Fast food packaging left in corridors Unhygienic plaster left in the lifts Broken Curtain rail Broken window Twin room when we booked a double Broken shower so could only have a bath Noisy Smelt horribley of smoke AVOID AVOID AVOID

Reviews.Title: “train on the brain ...”
Reviews.Author: 1-observer
Reviews.Content: Only okay if you get a really cheap deal and stay for one night. Had an awful sleep with trains going by every 3-4 mins - felt like i never slept. It was like a form of torture. Maybe there are quieter rooms on the other side ??? The room was very basic - it would give a back packer hostel a run for their money. Staff acting out there roles - just! No harm to them the hotel is rubbish really. Avoid if possible but great location if you want to catch a train - i suppose.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid Like the Plague - Misleading, zero ValueForMoney”
Reviews.Author: huwborg
Reviews.Content: it was a terrible experience from the start - greeted by "Malik" who was unfriendly, surly and rude not interested in me as a customer. i was put in a room next to the elevator on the same floor as a big group of students who were noisy rowdy all night the room was old, dirty and the heater was barely working so i had to sleep under both duvets from the twin beds. next morning i canceled my second night stay and stayed at the IBIS instead. the location of this hotel is misleading as there are two Travelodge Kings Cross - the Royal Scots is not royal at all, in fact more like a youth hostel - tired, falling apart and clearly, the staff reflect the hotel state and condition. Bad value, i will never stay here again and i will be put this review on trip advisor. (This is the feedback I sent to Travelodge, when they asked for feedback).

Reviews.Title: “Ok for 1 night only”
Reviews.Author: Filllua
Reviews.Content: Pro - quiet room and a bath Con-few staff.no chair in room .no ironing board . 1 person on evening check in. Look for somewhere cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as some reviews suggest”
Reviews.Author: Stanstill78
Reviews.Content: First of all I searched high and wide for a hotel - for weeks for something affordable and in a handy spot. As it happens Kings Cross was very handy. I was not expecting much after reading the reviews on this site (after I had booked) so was quite pleased when I arrived. The reception area was big with someone on hand to help all the time, the room was spacious (a twin) and a major bonus was the bathroom. Not only was it a decent size for a budget hotel but it had lo and behold .... a bath! I have stayed in London quite a lot and I am always looking for cheap hotels to basically bed down for the night as I'm out most of the time. Considering some of the places I have stayed this was value for money - lots of budget London hotels don't have baths so this was a real bonus. Just don't expect the Hilton. The room was cleaned daily and I found the staff friendly. My only gripe is the area - kings cross is not great but this is nothing to do with the Hotel itself.

Reviews.Title: “Sleep rough it's more pleasant”
Reviews.Author: Godfrog
Reviews.Content: Appalling - unsafe and unhygienic. There was a large crack in the sink, mould all around the bath, a broken bulb hanging from the bedside light. Got there too late to change hotels and the staff couldnâ€™t or wouldnâ€™t move me. The hot breakfast was cold and restaurant floor was sticky and the chairs filthy. Staff totally uninterested in helping or even recording my complaints. On top of all that they charged Â£200. Filled in the complaints form on the website and only got platitudes. You just know nothing was going to get done.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Stoffelino
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel for three days in january 2010. I wanted to pay London a visit, but my budget was (and still is) rather tight. So I tried to book one of the cheaper Travelodge hotels in London and I liked it very much. Ok, there's the location. The nearest good spot for public transport is King's Cross station and that's a fifteen minutes walk trough a rather sloppy neigbourhood. But sloppy really is something else than unsafe. In january, darkness comes rather early and I had to get, alone, from the station to the hotel after a tiring day in London and I never felt unsave. Not one second. And then again, you can't blame a hotel for the state it's neighbourhood is in, rigjht? No, I really liked it. The staff was helpful and friendly enough, the rooms were very clean and rather spacious for a hotel in London. I slept very well, but on the sixt floor, by wich I can imagine that sleeping on the first floor could mean traffic noise. The only thing that I found really negative, was the abcense of a normal stairway (there's only a lift), but that's because I'm really claustrophobic. The breakfast waa really, really good en could keep me going till dinnertime. It has everything a British breakfast should have. My conlusion? If you pay this few for a hotel in the center of London, this is a bit more than you can expect. It was really worth it's money and convinced me to pick a TRavelodge hotel again this january.

Reviews.Title: “Ok if you get the cheap rate”
Reviews.Author: jamesl_1985
Reviews.Content: Book in advance and you can get a room in this travelodge very cheap (<Â£35), which is fantastic for London. Obviously you get what you pay for, and with a travelodge you pretty much know what you're going to get, a basic but clean room and nothing much else (no complementary toiletries, no iron in room). Don't expect to be able to use an iron if you need one, they don't have an ironing room, why Iâ€™m not sure in a hotel this size, and seemly only have one which is never at reception, also expect a bit of a hike to your room, very strange layout in this place! As with all budget chain hotels in London i wouldn't bother with the 'continental' or 'english' breakfast, its always over priced, usually disappointing and very often there's a very nice and good value cafe close by or on route to your destination. However, that said, I had a comfortable stay in this hotel for two nights and for the price you can't grumble.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as other reviews”
Reviews.Author: SFOtravelguy
Reviews.Content: Access: 15 mins walk from Kings Cross tube Check In: Pretty quick Room: 4th Floor room. Checked my mattress and carpet for bed bugs, but was happy to report that it was clean. Linens were clean with no spot. Bathroom: Ample towels for our triple room and tub/toilet/sink were all clean Sleep: Mattress was really weak and not supportive. Final verdict: Cheap rate, central location. Our room was clean and better than other reviews. So go with an open mind. Otherwise, try looking at Premier Inn as well.

Reviews.Title: “REASONABLE, BUT LACKING SAFETY STANDARDS”
Reviews.Author: hohoho188632
Reviews.Content: The hotel is 'what you see is what you get' if you are interested in just a bed for the night, book it, if you go for hotel comfort, stay away (especially noisy with youngsters drinking spirits in the corridors) the breakfast room is reasonable, a bit untidy later in the morning and most chairs are marked with whatever dirt spots. The major cause of concern: During the night there was a fire alarm (0230 hrs) possibly caused by some youngsters smoking in their bedroom. After checking out everyones pyamas (mostly Primark brand) in the street it was decided to move back to the rooms again, but where was the hotel staff guiding the guests in the allocated assembly area ????? as the crowd was moving up, some guest were still trying to run down the stairs seeking safety. fortunately this was not for real. A real safety concern, I feel they should know better in the Kings Cross area.

Reviews.Title: “Oh Dear!”
Reviews.Author: GrahamHarvey
Reviews.Content: A truly dreadful experience from walking in the door and being assaulted by the smell of varnish as the tatty bar was getting refurbished. Not allowed to check in early, despite the room being ready, unless we paid an extra Â£10. Our room was opposite the lift which slammed open and shut all night, oh I nearly forgot to mention that the lift access areas were being painted - badly! Incipid blue paint everywhere. Breakfast was a joke, not enough seating to cope with the demand, 45 minutes in the queue to be faced with what was claimed to be a continental breakfast, the only thing continental was the cold croissants. A dreadful experience and one to avoid at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “Horrid hotel”
Reviews.Author: Taylormade20
Reviews.Content: First they could not find our reservation, no one booked in as Mrs Drive, not my name but I do live on a Drive...Eventually found it and we had to go to the 5th floor. Italian and French students running down the corridors. Room small, dark and 2 very small twin beds. Food not too bad in the restaurant but very short of staff. Had to be up at 5-30, shower made a terrible noise. Bathroom smelt musty, towels not too white and very well worn.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as I thought”
Reviews.Author: tranquilnight
Reviews.Content: After making the grave error of booking first and reading Tripadvisor second I was quite apprehensive about my weekend in this hotel. I have to say though, that really our experience was not as bad as some posters are reporting. We asked for a quiet room, and got one on the 4th floor overlooking the internal parking and delivery area. The room was small, and the three beds narrow but they were clean and we were able to get a good nights sleep. The school parties on our floor had been located nearer to the lifts, so the further away you walk from the lifts the quieter it became. On some days the cleaners were overwhelmed by the number of rooms to deal with and when we returned to our room late afternoon to change for the theatre and a night out they still were cleaning along our corridor. If you avoid the dining room and walk less than 100 yards towards the station you will find Costa's Coffee, where we got breakfast at a fraction of the Travelodge price. The announcements in the lift gave us cause for much joy and mirth. Is that really Holly from Red Dwarf telling me what floor I am on?

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: trusty411
Reviews.Content: Booked two nights in the Royal scott, on arrival noticed it was grubby, kids eating and seating on the floors, lacks security to the rooms, the lifts are dirty with grafity on the walls, on arrival to the room we had to walk out as it smelt of whatever it was foul, reported to reception and offered another room this was just as bad so we left the room and found another hotel and the distance to Kings Cross station was furher than indicated and you felt vulnerable, I have used Travel lodge before which have been ok for what we paid but the Royal Scott is an insult to the name

Reviews.Title: “Not 100% But not as bad as the reviews make out!”
Reviews.Author: bigray1712
Reviews.Content: We booked this several months ago and had recently been reading reviews on this site and were a little concerned. On arrival check in was quick and efficient and the reception area seemed clean and in a good state of decoration. The lifts were tatty and people had scratched various things in the paintwork and the other lift we use had a lot of brass that could have done with a polish but nothing too major. The room itself was clean with a working heater and a fairly comfy bed clean towels etc. All the basics really. It could have done with a lick of paint a new carpet and probably a shower curtain but I have paid a lot more to stay in places that were a lot worse. Our room worked out at Â£13 pppn which given it's location is good value. I would have been upset if I had paid 4* prices but then again you never expect that from a Travelodge! The only incident was on the Friday night with some slightly rowdy younger guests and one was smoking in the lift but to be fair any hotel (especially the Travelodge/Premier Inn type) could have this problem.

Reviews.Title: “Tired, run down and dirty”
Reviews.Author: eebomcmillan
Reviews.Content: Tired, run down and dirty and thats just how i felt after staying here. This is an extremely noisy hotel, doors bang all night, the walls are paper thin and the old windows don't keep out the noise from the street. I was woken at 6:30am on both days by hoovering on the floor above, quite ironic really given that our carpet clearly hadn't been hoovered in some time. The bathroom appeared to have seen less attention, limescale and mould dominating the bath area and only overshadowed by the filthy shower curtain. Unfortunate really, given that clenliness is the only prerequisite i would expect of a hotel. Should you be fortunate enough to book at the poster price of about Â£30 i think that's the value. i wasn't so lucky, paying Â£80 a night for a twin room, and feeling somewhat short changed. Perfect hotel for heavy drinkers who can sleep through the racket and are not put off by below par hygene levels.

Reviews.Title: “dreadful breakfast”
Reviews.Author: LoveIndia08
Reviews.Content: The breakfast was deeply underwhelming. It was billed as a 'Full English Breakfast'. There was a decent range of cereals. But the fruit was tinned oranges or tinned grapefruit. The cooked option was pasty sausages, tinned tomatoes, beans and scrambled egg which had the consistency of fresh mortar. The fried bacon was OK. And people were queuing and waiting for it because there were not enough chairs and tables for the number of guests in the hotel. At least there was a rapid turnaround once people were in the restaqurant.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is convenient but customer service leaves a lot to be desired!"”
Reviews.Author: RPnHR
Reviews.Content: Walk from Kings Cross Station - 1.3 miles. Cost of hotel room - Â£80. Number of smiles you will get from the staff - Priceless!! Because you wont get a single one. Location was spot on, value for money was cracking, but please use at least some of that money for staff training with instant effect. fortunately, i didnt have a major problem with the staff, although everyone who served me gave me the impression they didnt belong in customer service. Its what we witnessed to less fortunate customers infront of us which really rang alarm bells. The cleaning staff however are not monotone robots sent from the year 3000, unlike the rest of the reception and bar staff who's manners chip appeared to have been replaced by an upside down smile chip during time travel, the cleaners laughed and joked lightheartedly as they polished our door knob!

Reviews.Title: “Never again.”
Reviews.Author: whiteswift
Reviews.Content: We expected the room to be basic, but this was worse than anticipated. 3 narrow beds very close together,thin bedding and noisy springs. Any bedtime drink. clock, book had to be put on the none too clean floor. The shower curtain was grubby, the shower wailed loudly and the "white" towels were thin and grey. But the worst thing was the noise throughout the night. Loud banging on doors , doors slamming, shouting etc, until we got up and left having had no sleep. No sign of any staff and no phone to ask for assistance. We did not attempt breakfast. I certainly would not advise any women to stay here alone. Didn't feel safe.

Reviews.Title: “Definately the Worst place to stay in King's Cross”
Reviews.Author: Biscuit31
Reviews.Content: Have just spent to nights at the most appaling Travel Lodge ever.the triple room we were in ,had curtains hanging off the rail,no hairdryer.But I gather from the desk staff's coments to other guests there was a shortage in the place.the plug on the sink did not work so you could not keep the water in.Husband ,daughter and self had at the most 8 inches between the beds and the mattresses were constantly moving off the base,I did'nt know they still had 2"6 beds anymore!The room itself smelt ,probably needed a good clean.We had booked breakfast but on Sunday morning we arrived as the resturant opened ,I felt like I was back at school again as I was handed a knife and fork.The food was cold and I'm not sure the bacon was even cooked properly.I felt quite sorry for the foreign tour group who were there at the same time as they had probaly paid good money for a night in this place.We did'nt bother with breakfast on Monday morning but checked out early and went to Starbucks for breakfast! As we checked out there was no ' Have you enjoyed your stay',the receptionist just took the keys without a word. Considering the Travel Lodge owners have recently started an advertising campaign ,they have a long way to go.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Travelodge Ever Stayed In”
Reviews.Author: Icky_10
Reviews.Content: Well Travelodge Royal Scot is probably the worst hotel ive ever stayed in, Room 507 a triple room was our given room. If privacy is what you want forget it, because the skyline of London outside, views the inside of your room due to none fitting curtains which are at 6inchs short in length and 6 inchs short in width. Also with damp on the walls ,broken drawers, ripped lamp shades and the smallest bathroom known to man if you want to book here forget it and choose somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Relieved the room was nowhere near as bad as previous reviews suggested!”
Reviews.Author: lorrimayhamilton
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a triple room with two friends on a Saturday night. I knew that finding somewhere affordable in Central London would be a challenge - let's face it, they'll be able to rip off the tourists with locations like this. Travelodge Kings X Royal Scot was the only place we could afford that offered a triple room. I'd read the reviews on here after booking and was very worried about what kind of place we would end up in. It was my birthday night out and we wanted to at least be in a clean room to enjoy getting ready to go out. There are some bad points; the lobby had a strange 'smelly feet' fragrance when I arrived, and was in need of a little brighter decoration and the lifts looked awful, though were very reliable. We could have done with thicker duvets given that the ones on the bed were very thin, it was a very cold night, the window didn't shut tight and the heater wasn't all that effective. But everything else was absolutely fine. We had three single beds with enough space for us to get ready, the bathroom was clean and there wasn't any mildew in sight. Plenty of towels, fresh clean linen on the beds and we slept reasonably well. Breakfast was ok and as we didn't go down to eat til quite late in the morning there were no queues for anything. Based on the room we stayed in I would totally recommend this hotel. It provides a nice comfortable place to sleep with clean facilities - if you want to keep costs down but stay in close to everything in Central London then it's perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Bad service”
Reviews.Author: damiancham
Reviews.Content: I used to always stay in Travelodge when coming from Paris for a week-end or longer. The rooms are small and the bathroom was smelly. They gave us a room right next to the street so when there is traffic, too much noise. Worst is I have noticed that kettle for hot water was missing. I told it to the cleaners and also at the reception. I kept asking for it twice everyday patiently. The day before I check out, a guy at the reception rudely made me understand that my request was vain. I was there for notting hill with a friend. There are few details but they are things that you expect not to mention.

Reviews.Title: “The tramp in the carpark had the right idea”
Reviews.Author: croakey243
Reviews.Content: Well, where do we start? Check in, prompt, efficient, almost friendly... CarParking - Â£15 for 24 hours, fine, but why not tell people the telephone based system doesnt work, and the machine only accepts Â£1 coins, which the hotel reception & bar refused to change up some money to help us out From here it went down hill, the lobby is tired, and at the time of our arrival full of German teenages, and Eastern European working girls (of reasonable quality if this makes any difference to anyone) The Lifts are creaky, dirty, and some considerate person had left us a sample of their KFC in there (this was at 9pm) The rooms can only be described as substandard, borderline prison cell, and well below any previous experience, and this was based on us knowing this prior to booking! There was mould in our extractor fan, a tile fell off during a shower, and it looked our bathroom had played host to WWF RoyalRumble. On the plus side it was dirt cheap, semi decent location, and in general just about acceptable, however i think the tramp in the carpark had the right idea...all the location, none of the cost, same standard of service

Reviews.Title: “A lot better than many reviews here led me to expect.”
Reviews.Author: ACampbe11
Reviews.Content: I booked this at an advance booking rate for a one night stay. It cost about Â£50 for a twin room. We were looking for a cheap room for one night and figured a Travel Lodge should be reliable. Also I had an ok on it from a friend who'd stayed here twice. All we were after was somewhere clean, basic, reasonable and safe enough for two women. After I booked it I read the reviews here and nearly booked somewhere else! Hence why I'm writing this. However I was pleasantly surprised and frankly relieved! The hotel is a typical 60s concrete building. Nothing particularly attractive about it. As a hotel that has been bought over by rather than purpose built for Travel Lodge it's not their standard offering. But the foyer is clean and modern with a cafe/restaurant/bar, internet access and snack machines too. There's an off-licence across the road for late night snacks and a selection of take-aways (the chippy across the road was fine). The area is perfectly ok to walk about in during the day. It might be preferable to get a taxi at night though, but that's pretty average advice for any part of city other than the very busiest central areas. Interior standard:- There are signs that this has been quite a nice hotel in it's day. Now it's rather worn around the edges though. The lifts for instance are brass inside but have been painted over with white paint making them rather scruffy. And the second floor landing woodwork etc looked like it had all been quite stylish in it's prime. As it was there was nothing really wrong with it, just worn. Room:- The room itself was fine (and really, I'm picky about cleanliness). The twin beds were made up with plain white cotton bedlinen and were spotless (I like to see plain white sheets as they can be hot-washed unlike fancier bedcovers). The furniture was a little worn but serviceable and nothing broken and the walls had each been emulsioned in slightly different peachy shades. Seems they'd used a different can for each wall (but at least they had been done). A TV, heater, kettle and the usual things all in order. Curtains clean and in good condition and blackout lined. The en-suite was small but clean with towels. The floor tiles looked pretty new. Noise: - We were there on a Thursday night so not the weekend which maybe helped. There was a bit of noise from pipes and a fire door in the corridor but you get that in hotels. Some morning noise from the delivery yard at the rear which we overlooked but that's par for the course too. I slept like a log and I'm a light sleeper. Staff:- Reception was fine, but then we had no cause to put them to the test. We didn't eat breakfast as Â£7.50 is only worth it if you want the full cooked shebang. As it was we just grabbed something at a cafe on the way to Kings Cross. Summary:- The only way I can reconcile my experience (and a few others on here) with the really bad reviews is that parts of this large hotel may have fallen into more disrepair than others. Perhaps day of the week, when you book etc make too large a difference to the standard of room you get? That I can't comment on. I can only say that the room we were in and the general standard of the public areas was perfectly ok for the price. I might have been displeased if I'd paid full rate but there are generally deals to be had for Travel Lodges. No, it isn't the Ritz! But for a budget hotel it's perfectly fine.

Reviews.Title: “budget hotel stay”
Reviews.Author: Jan215
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the second time - last time in 2007. Got the rooms(2) for twenty-five pounds per room per night, for 3 nights. Our room this time was a wheelchair friendly one and quite spacious, facing the inner courtyard so noise was minimal, good for the price and it was nice and clean, it had 4 heaters and electric curtains! The bed was good and the bathroom very large. Only one lift works (out of 3 lifts there) so be prepared to wait (as only 3 people fit in to it with luggage) or use the stairs, we found the stairs were a better option and we only used the lift for booking in and out. Luckily we were on floor 3 though so not too many stairs. We waited for 3pm check in (half an hour) so as not to get charged an extra 10 pounds on check in. Quite an odd idea if the rooms are already ready but that is how they do it. However the hotel is not as negative as some people make out, it is a10 min walk to Kings Cross/St Pancras, and it was a good budget option for us, gave us more to spend on tours and food. There are 2 cafes at least on the walk to Kings Cross station and breakfast at the cafes were between 4 and 5 pounds each for a full breakfast and less for other options. Our children had a room towards the back and it was OK, quite roomy, though one window was a problem. However just to sleep and shower there it was quite OK. Just dont expect a glamour hotel, it is a no frills hotel, but if that is all you want and you dont need anything much else then it is fine, especially if you can get a discounted price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location for a horror film”
Reviews.Author: WorldFuneral
Reviews.Content: I'll start by pointing out that I have stayed in many Travelodges. I like Travelodge because you know what you're getting: a clean, basic room at a good price (and what you're not, ie any frills). I am afraid that my stay in Travelodge Kings Cross Royal Scot has shaken my faith in the chain, and I am definitely being more selective with where I stay now. First impressions of this hotel were not bad. All seemed fine on entering the large and modern-looking reception area, and the receptionist greeted us with a smile (not always forthcoming in London). Things went downhill when we headed up to our room in the angriest sounding lift I've ever heard. I almost expected it to say, "FOURTH FLOOR, GET OUT". The fourth floor was even less welcoming, with peeling paint and dirty carpets. So far, so bad. Of course, the worst thing about this hotel had to be our room. We had a family room with three tiny single beds crammed in. A light bulb out, a cigarette end in the drawer, graffiti on the desk and a broken panel under the sink, which had just been left there rather than fixed (although, it did seem a bit beyond fixing...). The inner window pane was jammed open, letting in the freezing cold and plenty of noise from outside. We did inform reception about this, and a workman dealt with it quickly. This, and the friendly staff, were the only redeeming features of this hotel. The location may be convenient but it's noisy, our room was pretty horrible and we couldn't wait to get away. I actually felt somewhat unsafe staying in a hotel that is in such a state of disrepair. I can't think of any kind of traveller I'd recommend this hotel to, especially considering that there doesn't seem to be any consistency in price (on some days, it can be more expensive than other hotels in the area). Consider Travelodge Euston over this one.

Reviews.Title: “good location, reasonably priced for London”
Reviews.Author: Whostwo
Reviews.Content: couple in London for a two day Music Convention, so wanted a crash pad. Which is what we got. We were checked in quickly, were on the second floor, facing the car park. Room was very quiet, surprisingly, as lot's of the guests seemed already drunk when we arrived, late on a Friday night. Out of three lifts, only one ever seemed to work, so if you can it's easier to walk. Room was ok, we had a twin bed , with en-suite, Bathroom had an unpleasant smell, all weekend. As the fan in the Bathroom wasn't working. Room was cleaned daily, clean sheets and towels provided every day. Curtains were full of holes,different lengths, and were mouldy on the back, but we weren't sleeping on the curtains. When we asked the Reception staff anything, they were always helpful. We only had Breakfast once, @ Â£7.50, which was full English (very good) plus cereals, toast, etc, if you wanted it. Coffee not great, but all hot drinks from vending machines. Lot's of large groups staying here, so i suppose it could be noisy for some people. Ideal for Kings Cross area, Cafe Da vinci is very good, if you want to eat elsewhere for breakfast. Nice bars in the area, but you have to wander off the main roads. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Standard travelodge! i.e. fantastic value!”
Reviews.Author: Busa1999
Reviews.Content: We are a family of four so had a family room, we had B&B in London for three nights in the school holidays for Â£8.5 pppn!!!! Yes eight pounds fifty for bed and breakfast! Within walking distance of some gorgeous child friendly old pubs in Islington and an awesome original pie n mash shop! (Clarks Pie & Mash, 46 Exmouth Market. Google it, take the kids theyâ€™ll love it. Come back to the hotel via the back streets and youâ€™ll find a nice little park for the kids to play in as well). Youâ€™re situated just down the road from the tube and Kings Cross. Also inside the congestion charge area so lovely quiet roads. The Travelodge was mostly full of what looks like groups of young foreign exchange trip students(?) being young and ignorant in an oblivious to anyone else kind of way not in a malicious way... So who cares! You get what you pay for! We donâ€™t expect Travelodge to be the Ritz! We take earplugs with us because some are noisy (not this one). The rooms are at worst old and a bit frayed at the edges but clean, some are new and clean! If you want to spend your holiday sat in your hotel room then Travelodge is probably not for you! Spend Â£200 pn and go to a spa! If you want somewhere basic and cheep to sleep you canâ€™t beat it! You couldnâ€™t go camping for these prices! The only thing that let the place down was the customers! Specifically the smokers, they stood (in their droves) directly in front of the automatic main doors into the lobby to get their fix! So the doors constantly stayed open and the whole lobby stank of fags! The bar and breakfast area are also next to the lobby door so at least half the food area stinks of cigarettes! But youâ€™d expect nothing less from smokers! ;o) Sit down by the food bar and you canâ€™t smell them. Outside of our room on the exterior wall there is a little blue historical plague stating that Stalin stayed in our part of the building (there is an older annex at the rear of the concrete block which is the main part of the hotel). Most definitely awesome, weâ€™ll be back. But we might invest in airbeds for the kids?

Reviews.Title: “NO - DONT DO IT!”
Reviews.Author: traveller53354
Reviews.Content: Well where do I start, the hotel absolutely GROTTY, there is no other word for it! A bit strong you might think, but given the fact that the plaster had fallen off the wall on the stair well and had been spread down two flights and left there for the duration of our stay, even though we advised staff of the hazzard, ther was a strong smell of urine that filled the staircase was unbearable that was only for starters. On entry to the family room we were allocated we found a large amount of paint peeling off the wall, holey curtain which literally hung from the windows by a few strands , windows which wouldnt close never mind lock, a bead of mould around the grottiest bathroom I've ever seen, dirty cups and spoons and the icing on the cakethere were a few hairs in the bathroom handbasin. Whilst attempting to get a change of room, which I might add was marginly better (no hair in the handbasin) a poor young American tourist had her handbag stolen from the side of her seat whilst in the bar, unfortunatly the hotel had no security so anyone could come and go as they pleased, and believe me they did, neither did they have a hotel manager, what more can I say other than DONT DO IT!

Reviews.Title: “Miserable”
Reviews.Author: Gus030
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night with my partner and thank goodness we only booked one night! The price was attractive but in hindsight I wish we'd paid that little extra and stayed at the Travelodge just up the road which is considerably better. Reasons for rating it 1 star as follows: 1. We arrived at 2.30pm and were advised that we could not check in until 3pm, unless we paid an extra Â£10. The unpleasant member of staff relaying this information actually laughed at us for wanting to check in for free. By 2.45pm, a crowd of 30+ guests had assembled in reception. Three members of staff waited patiently behind their desk, telling each guest in turn that they had to pay Â£10 or wait, which the staff continued to find amusing. 2. Only one lift (for 4 people) was working, the other two were out of order. However, no 'out of order' signs were displayed as there was apparently no intention to fix the other lifts. The crowd that had waited until 3pm to check in now had to wait again for the single lift. 3. The sheets on our bed were stained, in a very unpleasant way. The rest of the room was merely run down (scuffed furniture, mould in the window corners). On a positive note, the shower worked. 4. Only one towel was provided for a two-person booking. Staff would not deliver an extra towel to the room so I was obliged to return to reception. 5. The stair-case was dilapidated. Large amounts of plasterwork have fallen off the walls, and staff do not appear to clean the area (empty beer cans littering the window sills and floors, graffiti on the signs in the area, dust (presumably from the crumbling plasterwork) everywhere). Out-of-date signs provide incorrect directions (ignore the sign for 'breakfast room' directing you to explore the first floor, this is a red herring). 6. Noise levels were high throughout the night, both from drunken guests and from a group of kids yelling at one another in the car park to the rear of the premises. 7. Breakfast was a shambles. The restaurant could not cater for the amount of guests in the building, so we had to queue for a table. Once we had a table, we then had to wait another 10 minutes as they had run out of plates. The food which we eventually got hold of was awful. Other reviewers may take the view "you get what you pay for". I paid ~Â£80 (including 'breakfast' for two) and I feel completely ripped off.

Reviews.Title: “Booked in advance, very cheap, but first...”
Reviews.Author: Owainbrown
Reviews.Content: Booked in advance, very cheap, but first room offered was both ancient and grotty. Staff were rude when a change was requested, but a halfway decent room was the end result. Would not recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as everyone thinks”
Reviews.Author: rezchan
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as a cheap option for a one night stay and was anxious that it was going to be awful because of some of the previous reviews. I had a family room which consisted of a double bed for myself and my partner and a sofa bed for our friend. The room was very spacious. Much more so than we had expected. The bathroom was of ample size as well. Our room was away from the road so we didn't have any traffic noise. Granted, the whole hotel is in need of updating, but the room was clean and perfectly adequate for a one night stay. We had a good night's sleep and were satisfied with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: LynneFL10
Reviews.Content: Travel lodge are really cheap for a good reason. This hotels decor is very tired. I appreciate you get what you pay for and if there is nowhere else I guess you have to take this. Just remember budget hotel so there is no shampoo, no hairdryer, no iron I stay in hotels because of work about 50+ times a year.... I rarely write reviews but feel the need to tell people what this place is like. Everything worked in my room TV, toilet taps even though there were bits missing off the taps, bathroom door vent was damaged room 405. Room and bathroom looked reasonably clean but just very tired. The single bed was not comfortable very narrow - child size, the windows did open.... but even with the secondary glazing the noise of sirens passing every ten minutes you would want to keep windows closed... (not hotels fault sirens of course) but I closed my windows and could still hear sirens. Every door bangs - either the self closing mechanisms are broken or just not adjusted properly... I guess you could blame the other guests for allowing doors to bang. During my stay I must have been there with some of the most inconsiderate people araound... loud voices in corridors right through the night and children running up and down the corridor... again I suppose not hotels fault for guests behaviour. We had an evening meal in the hotel, popadoms were supposed to come with the meal but we had to ask for them as they did not arrive. When popadoms arrived they were supposed to come with mango chutney - but they came with barbecue sauce - we pointe dthis out to be told they had no mango chutney. Did not think to explain that when meal was ordered or when popadoms were delivered. Just like they had no salad either but they did manage to mention that at the point of ordering.... At breakfast it's a buffett style food wasnt bad. There is no organisation about where people sit - so one person will take a table for four - seats are removed - and even though people have finished people still sit there talking even though people are stood waiting for tables... again I guess you could say not hotels fault.... but could they do something like a polite notice perhaps? There are really not many seats especially with the size of the hotel - I would recommend if you do stay forget breakfast at the hotel and grab something locally there are many pavement cafes within a few minutes walk.

Reviews.Title: “Not a happy bunny”
Reviews.Author: Bruceandann
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights recently, Anyone who could find this hotel in any way acceptable must have a very low expectation of what a hotel should be like. From the moment we arrived it was obvious this was a very tired and poorly maintained hotel. The carpets were worn and with gum trodden in, the lifts were tiny and even if they had all been working there wouldn't have been half enough. Our room, although clean had a patch of wallpaper torn off, funiture looked like it had been installed in the seventies and in the bathroom there was no plug for the sink and the shower curtain was so long it was almost impossible not to stand on it, making showering decidedly hard. The single beds although quite comfortable, were only two foot six wide, you turn over very carefully. Breakfast would be best described as a bunfight. Too many people not enough seats although the food as actually quite good. If you're under thirty and need somewhere cheap and you're not fussy stay here!. I cetainly won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid if you can; a most depressing "3rd World" experience”
Reviews.Author: HytheTony
Reviews.Content: My first stay at a Travelodge which I assumed was a cheap and cheerful chain of clean and comfortable modern hotels. Wrong! First impression of this hotel in one of the roughest areas of Kings Cross was that this drab, depressing building looked like one of the worst East German hotels prior to the fall of the Berlin Wall. I did not get to see Pentonville prison in which is nearby to this Travelodge, but it cannot look any worse! Rough reception area crammed with foreign students trying to check in with one harrassed receptionist also trying to deal with a client who wanted his money back because his room stunk and the basin etc was dirty. Arriving early prior to check in time I was charged Â£5 to rent a locker to store a small case, and if you want to get at it later to retrieve something, that will be another Â£5 please! Elevators and stairs were really filthy and corridors uncleaned. Fearing the worst, I was pleasantly surprised by our 3rd floor room, which was spacious and clean with a nice bathroom. However bed was very soft and uncomfortable, with a mattress that had obviously seen a lot of action and sank in the middle. Breakfast was adequate but shambolic with initial problem for us because the receptionist at check in had not presented us with the required voucher for the inclusive breakfast, requiring me joining another queue at reception. Breakfast room overcrowded and inadequate for number using it. I would have thought that Travelodge would have unloaded this ghastly place years ago - perhaps the Prison Services might be interested in purchasing it to help overcrowding at nearby Pentonville - as it can only damage their reputation

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: tyeardley
Reviews.Content: Basically this hotel is in a rough location and is pretty grim. Having said that it's pretty cheap as far as London hotels go, Â£76 per night for the triple room. All the pictures on here that have been taken by guests are exactly as our room was. We had a triple room for 3 lads for a boozy weekend in London, for this purpose it was fine. However I wouldn't stay for longer than 1 night and not with your partner. It's a really old run down building thats had a Travelodge logo stuck on everything.

Reviews.Title: “Not a healthy place.... camden council informed”
Reviews.Author: robhcooper123
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night September 15th, Location ok and that is about it!! Service ok staff helpfull till things go wrong then do not want to know. Room terribly shabby, sink tap corroded and would not turn from hot to cold. shower curtain mouldy. bed clean and ok. no coat hangers VERY VERY NOISY AND HOT. Now the bad part Fire Doors jammed open!!!! At breakfast the waiters had one dirty cloth and were wiping all the tables with this one dirty cloth.... I pointed out the flagrant breach of health law to her and she said ... they were new staff... i did ask if they had training and she just shrugged her shoulders and walked away. I think they get away with it as it is used by a young traveling community who do not live this country to complain. THis really makes the health situation worse as any infection will be spread far and wide. Do travel lodge wish to be assoociated with this practice!! Avoid if possible.

Reviews.Title: “Don't know what all the complaints are about.”
Reviews.Author: lockerbielass
Reviews.Content: Stated here on the 13th for one night to see a show. After reading all the bad reviews before we went we were very hesitant about staying here. But on our arrival the reception staff couldn't have been more pleasant. We were given the key to room 205, got the lift up to the second floor [which worked and didn't smell of urine]. The room itself was very clean and comfortable and the bathroom was spotless. Continental breakfast was very acceptable. All in all a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible, will never stay again.”
Reviews.Author: helen_sheard
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night in August with my teenage daughter. The triple room we were given was appalling, the heater was smashed up which must have contravened several health and safety regulations and the sink had a large crack all the way around it which made it unsafe, I would not have liked to be in this room with a young child in case it cracked off and fell on them, also there was a horrible burning smell in the room at one point. We witnessed the receptionist being rather rude to an Italian lady who was trying her best to be understood and when the manager arrived he was even worse! It made us embarrassed to be English. We ate in the restaurant and the food was average at best, also bar staff did not understand the terms fizzy water or ginger beer! I was so glad when we left.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, bad Hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: shemayand
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a handy location from kings cross, and thats about the only good thing i have to say about it. Only saw three staff members briefly so cant comment on the overall service, although they where helpful. I stopped here with my sister and five friends, me and my sister where on the top floor, my friends were split between the 1st floor and basement. all the rooms stunk, were tiny and way too hot. my freinds in the basement were kept awake till after three by the loud msic in the bar next door(not connected to the hotel), and then the trains at five in the moment. my friends on the first floor said the room was dirty and too hot, and the shower leaked everywhere. the prices were way to expensive for the service we got, obviously taking complete advantage of the prime location. And i shall be sharing my thoughts with travel lodge!!!

Reviews.Title: “Ignore the bad reviews and try this for yourself”
Reviews.Author: Eccles2010
Reviews.Content: I have just come back from a short stay here with my partner and read all the reviews beforehand and so was a little worried about what sort of state we would find this hotel to be in. On arriving here we were dealt with very quickly, even though a coach load of tourists had arrived at the same time as us. Finding our room, in the Millennium Suite on the 2nd floor was easy enough and the room itself was a pleasant surprise. It was roomy and clean although too warm for my liking but we soon got a hang of the air-conditioning. The hotel itself was near to some shops and we found a very nice place to have our breakfast. There was tea and coffee plus we got "2" rolls of toilet paper in the bathroom along with a small bar of soap and 2 towels. My advice to anyone thinking of going is to give it a try, after all you only really need it for a bed for the night.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for - people are moaning sometimes over the top”
Reviews.Author: hugeabbafan
Reviews.Content: Firstly, it is always clear when booking at any Travelodge, that when you check in BEFORE 3pm, you have to pay Â£10 - like it or hate it, it clearly says on booking form on the net. Its your choice to pay that or dont book in till after 3pm. I always try and book a Travelodge for Â£19 a night when these prices get released, although I do appreciate its not always possible. I have stayed at this particular hotel many times and have always found it comfortable and clean apart from maybe a mirror dirty or TV which needs a cloth going over it. Breakfast sometimes is an issue because unless you get there for 7am when it opens, there is always a wait for a table because it does not cater for the number of people sleeping there. I grant you Kings X is not an ideal spot but it is still situated in a good spot for the underground and main line station too. I would book this again if the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusted”
Reviews.Author: GraduateDesigner
Reviews.Content: I am going to start this 'bad review' on a positive note. I had two weeks work experience in London and as my place of work was in Farringdon this was one of the closest travelodges. I booked two weeks at Kings Cross with a weekends gap in between. The first week I stayed I could not fault the place. I was allocated a room on the sixth floor. It was spacious and clean, with an ample size bathroom and comfortable bed. Although overlooking the main road outside it was remarkably quiet. Overall a very pleasant stay. I returned the next week after a less than pleasant journey expecting the same high level of hospitality, how wrong I was! On arrival I was told I had to pay an early check in fee of Â£10 because I arrived earlier than 3pm, a little cheeky I thought but paid nevertheless. My room was on the second floor ( I say the second floor it was like wandering a maze but i eventually found the room. This time and as I opened the door I was greeted with a room that looked like it belonged in a completely different hotel. The room had a single bed (i booked a double) a desk with no chair (no suitable as I was using the desk in the hotel to do work in the evenings) I horrible smell of damp and general uncleanliness. Depsite being on my lunchbreak from my work experience i decided to tackle the problem earlier rather than later. I went back to reception where I queued for at least ten minutes before someone assisted me, I handed the man the key and simply said i thought there had been a mistake as i booked a double and i'd been given a single. He snatched the key from me, put something into his computer and insisted that 'all rooms where the same' I then told him about my previous stay and requested the same if not a similar room. He told me i must be making it up as all the rooms in this hotel are apparently the 'same'. I explained about the chair, his solution was the following 'take a chair from reception up to your room if you need a chair so badly'. I then asked rather more sternly to change rooms to which I was told there were none clean, unless I was willing to pay another Â£10 early check in charge! I refused and returned to the hotel after 3pm. My room was changed by a woman behind the desk. I was situated on the first floor. Granted in a double room (they got one thing right at last!) the room however, had no window, a tv that didnt work, a tiny bathroom, was noisy and generally smelt of an old peoples home. I am disgusted with the service i received over the second week of my stay. The staff were rude and unhelpful. This Travelodge is not worth nearly Â£90 a night. My recommendation is if you must stay here request a room on the 6th floor, as these seem to be the VIP rooms (that apparently don't exist according to hotel staff!)

Reviews.Title: “absolutely fine”
Reviews.Author: playgal8
Reviews.Content: travelled with a friend on a trip to london this hotel is absolutely fine nothing wrong with it at all .. i only needed a place to get my head down..i didnt have breakfast so can not comment. we checked in early the lady at reception did not know which rooms had been cleaned so she checked me into a room and said if this hadnt been cleaned come straight back down and she would change my room.. the room hadnt been cleaned but i went straight back down and told her she even upgraded the room which was great..i wouldnt have no problem with staying here again its in a great location for gettting about on the buses and tubes.. dnt listen to bad reviews if you just want the hotel for a base to get your head down i only paid Â£19 for the room which i thought was great value and i would be happy to stay there again as i didnt find it dirty or loud at alsl had a great nights sleep.. book if you can get it at a cheap price

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: LiMo2009
Reviews.Content: I only stayed one night at the hotel, but really enjoyed my stay. The hotel offers real good value for little money in a convenient location close to King's Cross St. Pancras. You can tell it's a budget hotel by the fellow travellers and the almost non-existent service (we arrived at 2:15pm, however the staff was absolutely uncooperative and wouldn't let us into the room earlier than the official check in at 3:00pm unless paying 10 GBP extra - if we had left the luggage for the resting 45 min, we would have had to pay an extra 5 GBP per suitcase, so we - and many other travellers - were left without a choice but to wait in the lobby until 3:00pm). Yet the room was quite nice, not too big and new but comfortable and clean. You really can't ask for much more with that budget price! Please note: do take the smoke detectos in the non-smoking rooms seriously, we were woken up by the fire alarm going off at 02:30am because someone had smoked in the room!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, but cheap...”
Reviews.Author: TrinityBergen
Reviews.Content: The location is great and it is cheap to stay there compared to other London hotels. There was something that looked like blood that was splattered around on the roof of the room. Lamps hanging sideways. I would recommend it if you need a cheap place to stay, but not if standard is important to you.

Reviews.Title: “simple”
Reviews.Author: bigmny
Reviews.Content: This is a simple hotel if you are staying for one night.The bath tub was dirty and the next day i was boarding eurostar.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs”
Reviews.Author: sparkysbackpack
Reviews.Content: Quite simply the worst hotel experience ever - tired, run down room, shower didn't work, room temp bordered on sub-tropical but the breakfast experience was something else. Went down at 8am - faced a queue back to lifts (approx. 50 people), took 30 minutes to clear, when finally getting to table they were no clean glasses, or mugs or cereal bowls or plates!!!.....staff (eastern european) couldn't care less - it was pure cattle market. Tip for budding entrepreneurs - open up a breakfast bar across the road and you will make a fortune!!!...when we returned to London 5-days later we stayed at the Premier Inn - Tower Bridge Road. What a contrast in every respect. Travelodge bosses need to get their a&^es down to this one and either shut it down or get it sorted. Its shameful.

Reviews.Title: “What a dump!!”
Reviews.Author: mkgkiwi
Reviews.Content: The Royal Scot Travelodge Kings Cross - what a complete dump. This hotel is the worst I and my colleague have ever experienced and the fact it has a 3 start rating is an insult to all other star rated hotels. Not only were we greeted by an awful smell when entering the rooms, but my bed was made using the last occupants dirty linen. The place made me feel physically ill. I was given another room which did have clean (I hope) linen but again, the room stunk, was filthy, noisy and uncomfortable. If we were staying any longer than the 2 nights, we would have checked out immediately and thinking about it now - we should have done just that. This is the first time we have stayed at a Travelodge, and it will certainly be the last. Travelodge should be ashamed of itself for offering such a disgusting place. I even hated the location, Kings Cross which is a absolute dump. I should have know better to have booked it in the first place. I have written to Travelodge to complain and it will be interesting to see what kind of response I get from them. The Royal Scot should be closed down immediately as I am also concerned at the layout of the hotel. It is like a rabbit warren, dark and dingy. I would hate to know what would happen in the event of a fire or other emergency. This place is a disgrace!

Reviews.Title: “Worst ever travel lodge”
Reviews.Author: LincolnshireDjg
Reviews.Content: Took well over a hour to que and check in, was offered to pay Â£5 to leave bag and come back when less busy! Room really dirty stains on chairs et. Bed felt as if stuffed with straw. No air con and windows would not open for customers safety, the extractor did not work in bathroom. The heater had been turned off for customers safety so could not turn on cold to get some air made me feel ill. No towels in room and could not get a lift so a walk down 3 floors to fetch. Mixer tap in bathroom broken and could not get cold water. Dirty rusty scew on plug. The area was really bad and not a good area to stay at all i would not have walked back at night.

Reviews.Title: “Jewelry stolen!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ioana072
Reviews.Content: Please do not stay there!! It is not about the oul furniture or the waiting time to have an terrible breakfast. A day before leaving the hotel, my jewelry dissaparead from my luggage and I notice that all my bags were checked. Dont leave anything in that room!!!

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting Just don't go there”
Reviews.Author: Sazzie1990
Reviews.Content: Absolutley awful. I stayed one night with my boyfriend with the intention of catching the Eurostar early next morning. Having arrived the area unerved me slightly especially the PVC store opposite. My experience in travelodges had led me to expect basic but clean, this was not clean. The hotel communal areas are painted in cheap red paint that is poorly applied and the lifts are tarnished. Our room was a state, the paint on the walls was dated and had patches of yellow paint and flaked off paint where previosu furniture had clearly been ripped out. The furniture that remained was very dated and included a clearly labelled refridgerator which was an empty cupboard with a hole in the back. We could have lived with this, but when we went to bed that night we found that there was only one spare pillow for a double bed despite there only being very flat pillows provided, further to this under the spare pillow was a pair of GREYING UNDERWEAR! It was disgusting, but there was no one on reception to report this too both that night and when we checked out the next morning. The room clearly wasn't cleaned or the pillows replaced, it made me ill!

Reviews.Title: “Not great hotel but good location”
Reviews.Author: KariJazz
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for cheap accomodation in a central London location this ticks the boxes. However, the hotel is quite run down and the staff don't seem to quite know what's going on. First we got booked into a room that had not been cleaned, and the room they moved us to had no towels. Once it all got sorted it was ok, but the noise from the nearby train track kept me from sleeping very well. I guess you get what you pay for.. I probably won't return to this one, but I wasn't completely horrified either.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and cheap - the only reasons to stay here”
Reviews.Author: Donegalabu
Reviews.Content: The hotel's location is perfect - near King's Cross station. This is its only redeeming quality. The hotel looks very run down, both from inside and outside. It badly needs some paint to brighten it up. It is cheaper than other hotels in the surrounding area, but you get exactly what you pay for. The air-con does not work in the rooms. The rooms are tiny. It has two lifts which take forever to go up and down. There are no phones or hairdryers in the rooms. You can 'borrow' a hairdryer for an hour at a time. There are computers to access the internet in the reception area. There are tea and coffee making facilities in the rooms. If you only want a base to sleep in in a good location and don't intend spending any time in the room, this hotel is perfect. Otherwise, I would avoid.

Reviews.Title: “Fine if you get a cheap deal”
Reviews.Author: Jeevesliverpool
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in January and couldnt fault it then for the price, and again for 22 pound for a family room it was an ideal base. To be honest it is quite scruffy in parts (lift reception area especially), but the rooms are adequate for an overnight stay. As for the noise so many comment on I have had no problem on my visits (midweek and weekend). Service at the front desk was good, and extra sheets and pillows were provided promptly when requested. If Id paid full price then I wouldnt be very happy, but this review is based on the price I paid for the room. I would recommend it if you can get a cheap deal. Again didnt eat here so cant comment on the food.

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: suecambs
Reviews.Content: Worst hotel I have ever stayed in. Rooms were dirty and unkempt, Badly in need of refurbishment, and very tiny, you cant move in the bathroom (not that you would want to be in there long its dirty. Dont bother booking breakfast its a free for all. They only have seating for 110 and the hotel sleeps over 800. There was nobacon tomatoes or eggs on the first morning as they kept running out and on the second we queued for 45 mins for a table and after all that it definately was not worth waiting for. My advice stay somewhere else its awful.

Reviews.Title: “Not great service noisy rooms and bad attitude of staff”
Reviews.Author: bellysbride
Reviews.Content: Got a room that was like a large store cupboard that sounded like workmen working next door, found out it was because it was next to the noisy lift, got a better room when I complained that seemed like it was another hotel a lot better, cleaner, newer and also quieter. We opted for continental breakfast and the attitude of the staff telling us we weren't allowed to have anything hot was horrendous. If we had wanted a hot breakfast we would have ordered one. Not the usual standard I've experience before from this chain. If using Travelodge in London, don't use this one.

Reviews.Title: “think twice about staying here”
Reviews.Author: EdinburghTimbergirl
Reviews.Content: where do i start? i had booked 2 rooms for 1 night 2 adults in one and 2 children in another(11+17) we arrived at 1pm to be told checkin wasnt untill 2.30pm,unless we wanted to pay Â£10 extra for each room,i refused and asked if i could leave our bags as we had just travelled from edinburgh,again they wanted more money ie Â£5 per item,there was no way i was giving them anymore money,the staff really dont give a toss about customer service,not nice at all.When we did check in at 2.30 our rooms were on different floors and of course we got a solid no when asked if we could have rooms together or at least on the same floor. the rooms were tiny and the window didnt open,no kettle,but mugs,coffee+sugar present,so had to go down to the uninviting reception,back up to room,no remote control for tv,so down i go again,no apologies nothing,also no lightbulb in my bedside lamp,we were given room 105 right above the front door buzzer (they lock the doors between 10pm+6am)so most of our night we heard buzzing from doorbell,thank god we had only 1 night here never again.we stayed in holiday inn the next night and it was the complete oppisite

Reviews.Title: “Dont stay here”
Reviews.Author: 101Pauline
Reviews.Content: I stayed for two nights 22/23. July. Window of room looked over car park which was full of young very noisy people until almost 4am. I cant believe the management allowed this to happen.. Also breakfast was a farce not enough seats, I ate standing up at a bar. Would not stay at a Travelodge again

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised!”
Reviews.Author: Exmoorllent
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my mum and sister, on our way to a family function. I'd booked on line and got the room for an excellent price. After reading some of the reviews on here I was expecting the worst, but couldn't have been more pleased. Check in staff were friendly and ensured we had plenty spare bedclothes. The room was clean, comfortable and despite being very central was not noisy. Overall I have no complaints and would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “I guess you get what you pay for at a...”
Reviews.Author: Ikyboo
Reviews.Content: I guess you get what you pay for at a traveloge, but I payed Â£135 for one night and I would have expected a little more! I have paid the same amount for a 4 star Hilton before! This was a business trip however and I literally needed the room for 6 hours overnight sleep. This hotel was literally the only one with a room free in the whole of London (something was going on that night) The desk service was poor with a large queue of people (even though it was 11:45pm) and made worse when 2 of the reception staff decided it was their break time and left, leaving one guy to check in. Strangly I find in most hotels they spend all their money on an amazing lobby oy to find tatty rooms, well in this hotels case the room were better than the lobby! The lift area up to the rooms looked like a very cheap hostel, but the rooms was actually ok! It was large but sparse with desperate need of pictures on the wall and some more furniture (which would cost them more so they would never do it) but the room was clean and tidy and served it's purpose. The mattress was pretty poor and I didn't rally get a great night sleep but I had to leave at 6am so not so bad! Overall if this is for one night stay then I would recommend it, for the price you can get much more but them I booked very last minute.

Reviews.Title: “It was fine!”
Reviews.Author: sasha32
Reviews.Content: We booked first, then read the reviews of this hotel when it was too late to change our minds. But in retrospect we were glad - for we spent a comfortable night in perfectly adequate surroundings. Our twin-bedded room on the third floor was clean, spacious, not unduly noisy (even with the window open). The staff were pleasant and we enjoyed a meal from the varied bar snack menu. We did notice that the corridors were warm and airless but this fault was by far outweighed by the convenience of the location.

Reviews.Title: “Very basic but just about functional”
Reviews.Author: ME13
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as we had an early morning Eurostar departure. We booked as a last resort as availability everywhere else was ridiculously expensive and all we needed was a bed for the night. When we read the reviews we hunted high and low for an alternative option, including considering joining the train further down the line but ended up taking the risk. Previous reviews did us a favour as we were expecting an utter horror story. What we got was basic accommodation for a price that was too high. Reception was understaffed - something I know is common for Travelodge. And to add to this, the receptionist was completely fed up with her job and made it quite clear. The lifts were tiny but operational and the room was small too. However it was clean and we had a bit of fun picking out the oddities. Massive air con unit in the room didn't work - but the window opened, so we survived. Mugs, spoons, milk, sugar and coffee all supplied, but no kettle. The bath needed some updating but was clean with a good number of towels for us. The beds are really soft and not really conducive to a good night's sleep. But in truth for a lower price the place would be just about bearable. I wouldn't like to stay too long, but an overnight was alright although I think we paid well over the odds for what we got. No doubt Travelodge will renovate it at some point, but right now it's a bit of a bed factory in a convenient location for those needing Kings Cross or St Pancras for early morning departures.

Reviews.Title: “Quite simply the worst!”
Reviews.Author: Elvis123
Reviews.Content: I have been in some poor hotels in my time but this beats them all! The customer service was poor, the room average at best and the breakfast made me ill. DO NOT STAY HERE!

Reviews.Title: “Aaaaaagh!”
Reviews.Author: Angelchops
Reviews.Content: All of the other reviews are correct. Just three words to describe this dump... OH..............MY...............GOD!!!! Do yourself a favour find somewhere else, this place is a dive.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs!”
Reviews.Author: BazzerWestSussex
Reviews.Content: Ripped sheets, room nothing like the website picture, very tired & needing redecorating badly. Food obviously reheated for evening meal, 2nd course arrived half way through eating the first & just dumped. Breakfast did not start until 8AM, no good for a reasonable start - ordered breakfast bag at Â£6.50 which contained 'food' with a 6 week use by date - flattened so-called croissant, longlife milk & cornflakes - the rest we threw away. What a rip-off. Compained to the head office - still waiting 2 weeks later for a reply. Are they really interested?

Reviews.Title: “Not a nice place”
Reviews.Author: Sparkypaul
Reviews.Content: After staying in a numer of travelodges I thought this would be an ideal way to spend a few leisure days in London. The room we was given was like an oven, The Air con in the room didnt work and there was no opening windows. now we know why we were given a tatty old fan as we booked in!
