Although we had booked into a double foom we were told" you can have a family room for more space" . well we certainly had that ! but what we didnt get was enough towels just one hand towel and one bath towel between 2 of us. but as it was late at night we managed. we had the most uncomfortable nights sleep ever. As they asked we placed the towels in the shower tray hoping for clean ones. No such lucok infact they didnt even clean our room that day. Down to reception and asked for a change of towels. not a problem. Asked what their room cleaning policy was and was told to remind them in the morning! not something we should do really is it? Final Straw. But then try and get back into the room No sorry cant do that ...... the key card dosn't work, or for the other guy i spoke to! Final, Final straw. demanded a change of room and was put in a much nicer room with opening windows on the top floor. No veiw but was better than the first room now the next 2 night might be better! As we searched our first room to make sure we hadn't left any thing a quick move of the settee revealed an empty water bottle. a plastic bag and used tissues. So the rooms are regularly cleaned then !!! I know there are some pretty dodgy places around Kings Cross but there is no reason for a reputable company like Trael odge to come down to their level. If this is the future standard of sevice from the compny then never again. I woldnt mind but this wasnt even one of the cheap deals this was Â£73/night for 3 nights. AVOID THIS HOTEL !

Reviews.Title: “Cheap but appalling”
Reviews.Author: Areyoubeingserved
Reviews.Content: This is the hotel that air conditioning forgot. Stuffy rooms, grimy bathrooms and as for a night's sleep? Forget it. I was booked in for conference nearby but at 60 quid a night, do yourself a favour and go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “First time my hotel room has been broken into. Avoid!!!”
Reviews.Author: ScottishFamilyGuy
Reviews.Content: Avoid this hotel at all costs. If you want to stay in a London Travelodge use the Euston one which is new, clean and in a much better (safer location). We had booked a triple room as there are no family rooms. The first room allocated was a single (at a stretch a double) with 3 beds squeezed in. We rejected this and were allocated a better room and the receptionist did this promptly and efficiently. The power has tripped in the room so another trip to reception to get maintenance who came and rectified it promptly. To echo other reviews the furniture is from the early eighties and falling apart, paintwork tired and generally the hotel has not been maintained for years. We left our room about 6.30 and were back around 9. In that time someone had accessed our room, left a coke can and messed around with a toy of my daughters. Luckily nothing missing. Reception manager didn't seem that concerned when I spoke to him about this and made no effort to apologise or want to get to the bottom of how our room was accessed illegally. Don't expect to sleep here, noisy even if at the back of the hotel and seems to be frequented by large groups of teenage european school trips making noise in the corridors and slamming doors till midnight. The icing on the cake was getting reception to roder us a taxi to st pancras as we had lots of luggage. The "pre-booked" taxi cost almost double a black cab. If I had paid more than the Â£29 for this room i would be even more unhappy than I am.

Reviews.Title: “WORST HOTEL I EVER STAYED IN WITH AGGRESSIVE STAFF”
Reviews.Author: eiretonto
Reviews.Content: Travelodge should be ashamed to have this excuse of a hotel under there name. It was me and my partners first trip away since the birth of our twin boys and also my girlfriends birthday weekend, There was homeless drunks around the hotel it looks horrible from the outside. the staff dont know what they are doing,are rude and unhelpful.they tried to put us in a twin room even though we had it in black and white we booked a double room it took us an hour and a half to sort it because the manager tried to tell us we booked a twin he was trying to fob us off only we wouldn't leave until we got what we paid for as for the hotel and rooms MY GOD the place was dirty the lifts smelt horrible and were dirty' paint was peeling off the walls chairs were stained, carpet was stained,when we opened the drawers in our room they fell apart. we only got 1 towel even though it was a double room and only 1 spare pillow. There was no hot water so had to have cold showers.It was very noisey around the hotel. The heat in the rooms was unhuman with NO AIR CON. when we went down for breakfast the waiter was threating a customer he was right in his face in a aggressive manner no way for a member of staff to act he should of being sacked there and then but the hotel done nothing and he was still there the next morning. i would never ever stay here again not even if they begged and gave to me for free.

Reviews.Title: “Not professional, chaos at breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Advitam
Reviews.Content: Arriving late after a very long conference on the other side of London, this night was going to be anything but welcoming. It started with check in, with three people behind the desk, only one was doing check ins, and the queue got longer. I seemed to be there on the hottest day of the year, and the hotel does not have airconditioning. Anyway, after waiting for about 5-10mins, (not making much progress) I asked one of the other two staff if they could help check in people. After rolling his eyes at me, he then made some effort, and checked me (after 3 others) in, the whole procedure was rather cumbersome. The feel of the hotel is very worn out, dated, not well maintained at all, one does fear this looking from the outside at this building, and it gets firmly confirmed when you get into the lift, to go to you room. I am surprised these are actually still working, because they seem to have not been maintained since they were installed during the 60s. Then the room, it was ok, however, certainly not very clean, it just felt very worn out, in a shabby sort of way. Windows are old, so noise from traffic does come through, overall one does get to sleep eventually, only with the nice prospect of full English breakfast the next morning. Even when you come down early, breakfast is a complete and utter chaos, a free for all, very dis-organised, not at all what you expect. Firstly, you need to take the paper room card holder with you (doesn't always get told to you at check in) otherwise (like me) you have to go back to your room and get it, rather irritatingly. You get handed cuttlery, with a look that says, "good luck trying to get anything fresh this morning, now move out of the way I need to push/squeeze as many in as possible." very nice treatment indeed. Now I am not very demanding in terms of breakfast, but a cup of coffee, toast, an egg, will do me, this was not possible, most of the breakfast seem to be permanently in empty dishes, and I had to ask 5 times for a cup of coffee. . . and eventually went to use an awful machine that spewed out something that has to represent coffee. Overall, very disappointing indeed, I've stayed at Travelodge before, however, this one is a no-go-area, my company will not book here anymore, and will try and avoid Travelodge anywhere in London from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Don't even consider staying here”
Reviews.Author: highwayman40
Reviews.Content: All comments posted by other reviewers are true. I have stayed in many hotels Worldwide but this is the worst! I left after 1 night, although I was booked in for 3 and demanded and received a full refund for all 3 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Go elsewhere, really, go elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: V70Pete
Reviews.Content: Absolutely diabolical. Staff are not helpful, bordering on belligerent. Rooms grubby & hotel very noisy and very hot, just like the water which was either hot or hotter - no cold water - even after letting tap run for several minutes. Even found hairs in my pizza! Just avoid, avoid, avoid.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs”
Reviews.Author: notmad_nomad
Reviews.Content: Was booked into this hotel by a travel consolidator - Wimbledon week so prices were high (Â£120 for a single room for the night). I'm not usually moved to post reviews but my experience was so bad that I thought I should share it. On arrival I had to queue for 25 minutes with heavy bags because the reception was grossly understaffed. Eventually I was checked in but it took a further ten minutes to get to my room because two of the three lifts were out of order. When I opened the room, there was another family inside!! Clearly disconcerting from a privacy and safety perspective. So, another trek down to reception and I eventually got a room from a disinterested, unapologetic member of reception staff. Well, more of an oven than a room - it was a hot day and the cooling unit in the room was out of order. Tried to borrow a fan but unsurprisingly they had none. The final straw was when I asked for an iron, they could not provide this - asked me to return in 'a few hours' (after midnight), which I duly did - but still no iron and no suggestions as to how I could prepare my clothes for the morning. I was left, lying awake in the sweltering heat, listening to whatever my hard-of-hearing neighbour had on the television until about 3 in the morning. A complete dump. Stay in one of the budget hotels around King's Cross or Paddington instead.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely awful”
Reviews.Author: gingerm55
Reviews.Content: Like an earlier reviewer, I checked in and checked straight out again. There is no excuse for a company like Travelodge running a hotel that looks like a shabby hostel and expecting customers to pay Â£100+. There was one working lift for 6 floors and everything looked poorly maintained. My main reason for checking out immediately was because I didn't feel safe in the building - window wouldn't close properly and, despite card access to the lifts and rooms, there didn't seem to be any close monitoring of people gaining access to the building.

Reviews.Title: “Worst travelodge we have stayed in”
Reviews.Author: holidaygirlBeverley
Reviews.Content: The outside of the hotel is littered with cigarette stubs making the drab exterior look even worse than it is. The reception is shabby but the receptionist was very polite and helpful.We were given a room on the 2nd floor which overlooked the car park which wasn"t a problem. The room was stifling and there was no A/C so not very comfortable in the heat wave we have just had. The bed linen and towels were clean but the sink was cracked and the toilet was stained. There were stains on the wall and the paintwork was all chipped and marked. We came back on the 1st night and ordered drinks in the bar. The bar maid could hardly be bothered to serve us and didnt say please or thank you. There were empty bottles and glasses left on the tables. We used the stairs most of the time as the lifts were not working properly. We stayed for 3 nights and paid Â£280 so expected a bit more than we got. Very disappointing for a travelodge as we have stayed in them before and always been highly satisfied. Would not stay in this one again.

Reviews.Title: “Seen Better Days”
Reviews.Author: SisterStella
Reviews.Content: I was thankful that I had read the reviews on this website. This Travelodge was booked by my Organisation and top rate paid. I have stayed at better Travelodges although the Info page does have a disclaimer as it is an 'Aquisition' Hotel. Run-down would be more appropriate. Reception was busy. Check-in fine. I was on the 6th Floor - the lifts are rank - no attempt to hide years of abuse. The Room was basic. Thankfully the Air Con worked (although I had invested in a little desk fan for Â£4.99 from Staples based on other reviews!). The window did not open at all. No Hairdryer (another of my creature comforts) - after reading the reviews slung one of those in the suitcase too (Good job there's not baggage allowance on trains), The Furniture was from better days (The carcass of what would have been a mini-bar was a cupboard with the TV on top) and there was a very thick layer of dust around the skirting - yuk. The bathroom was clean but the sink cracked and the water took ages to drain away. The bath - was OK as a shower - would not have considered a bath in it. Went to the Cafe Bar downstairs which benefitted from air con - full blast. The meal deal was good value for money - 2 bottles Carlsberg & a Pizza for Â£7.50. Check out fine and Receptionist helpful with directions to the Station - provided a map.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare Hotel - hostel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: shaihone
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the Royal Scott Kings Cross hotel on the 20 June I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. From the exterior it looks drab and run down and the interior is no better. Never more than one assistant on the desk to help with problems of which there are many. The lifts going upto the room are very shabby paint peeling off dirty and graffitied. The room which we were given was filthy the walls outside were cleaner than the walls inside the room. The curtains were hung off the curtain rails, they were too short by about three inches and had many holes in. The bathroom door had been kicked in and was difficult to use. Very disappointing. The second room we were given was a little better. The walls were a bit cleaner and the bathroom door was intact. The curtains however were exactly the same too short, hanging off the rail, holes in. The window would not open or shut as it was broken. Only one towel and three occupants. The breakfast which is served at 7am is pitiful, we arrived at 7.20 and the yoghurts, fruit and eggs had run out. We asked a member of staff for refils, they topped up the eggs, but the yoghurts and fruit had run out 20 mins into service? Why? Very, very poor excuse of a breakfast!!!! Does not even come close the other travelodges which I have stayed in. This hotel needs to be closed, refirbished or renamed as a hostel, prices can then be appropriate for the type of accommodation. If it had stated it was a hostel which it clearly is I would never have booked. Shame on you Travelodge!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Would be better roughing it!!!”
Reviews.Author: Linny1610
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3 nights and didn't get 1 nights sleep. Arrived back 1st night to find 2 COCKROACHES in our room!!man at reception wasn't surprised,apparently he catches them regularly.had to repack all our things and move rooms at 2.30am!2nd night after a long day the hotel looked like a doss house,foreign kids lying about all over the place,running around the corridors,slamming doors,gangs outside our window trying to kill each other!overall another poor night.3rd night we were hoping for at least a couple of hours sleep but woke at 4am swimming in our own sweat as the room was like a sauna,reception told me "we don't have air conditioning" so another unpleasant night. A few more problems were lifts don't work,got trapped in one at our floor and after a few kicks it finally opened,shower was cold,tap water was warm,toilet didn't flush properly,bed was like a marshmallow,curtains hanging on by a thread,window was cracked,lights didn't work and were hanging off the wall,air conditioning unit taking up half the room and it didn't even work,door key worked when it wanted to,I could go on,but if u want to know the rest just stay there. Overall the worst place I have ever set foot in,won't b back. My advise is sleep on a bench in regents park,cleaner and more comfortable!

Reviews.Title: “What a dump!”
Reviews.Author: tfw2010
Reviews.Content: This has to be the worst hotel of the Travelodge chain I've stayed in. Manky carpets, dirty lift (only one working) scruffy walls inside and outside the room and genrally totally rundown. The manager excused the Â£96 charge by inferring it is cheap and as it is about to get a makeover delayed by the economic situation - the best makeover would be to call in the demolition men I told him. I paid in advance for breakfast as I was catching the Eurostar. On a Sunday breakfast is not available until 08.00 - which was my train time! I did get a refund of the breakfast charge. You can excuse tired and faded surroundings in a hotel but not DIRT!

Reviews.Title: “Good for a one night stay”
Reviews.Author: Dirk_18
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night when getting the Eurostar to Paris early in the morning and for this purpose it was a very good hotel. A 5 minute walk from Kings Cross and St Pancras station which was very convenient. Like any travelodge really, fairly basic but nice enough.

Reviews.Title: “What A Dump”
Reviews.Author: crabbitandcrabbiter
Reviews.Content: On arrival first room allocated, still occupied!! 2nd tiny, noisy,kettle missing, 3rd bathroom clean, shower curtain, GRUBBY. One bath towel, one hand towel for both of us.. Bedside cabinet nailed to wall, drawer space had piece of wood nailed over. Air con. not working, opened window for fresh air led to us being wakened at 12.45 when empty bottles from the bar below were emptied into a metal bin.Food OK if you like cold chips and peas. Hot drink, cold drinks and snack machine not in working order. Lift out of order. Inside lift we used was like being in a Tracy Emmin sculpture, assorted beverage spills decorating the walls, don't even want to think what some of them were. Â£181.30 for two miserable nights.Never again. Staff seems discouraged and no wonder. The bear who stars in Travellodge ads. Is under threat from unhappy guests with automatic weapons!!!! Wouldnt recommend this Hotel to an enemy never mind a friend!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't know what all the fuss is about!”
Reviews.Author: benny25
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked this hotel for a 4 day stay in London to do the usual touristy things and when we looked at the previous feedback we nearly cancelled and booked elsewhere! We were presently surprised at the reception staff who were friendly and told us that if the 40 or so teenagers in the reception at the time booked in, made any noise they would deal accordingly! Not to worry they were on the 5th floor we were in room 259 on the 2nd floor which was adequate but with single beds, (we asked for a double), the room had dubious stains on the walls but the bed linen etc were clean! We were in London to sight see so we only slept at the hotel which itself was quiet but the road-noise was incredible, but we were in London and it's busy, what do you expect! Overall it wasn't the Ritz but we only paid Â£150 for the 3 nights, it was less than 10 minutes from the station and 30-40 minutes stroll into soho etc, perfect!

Reviews.Title: “OK for a night - but stay well clear in warm weather”
Reviews.Author: swansea_wales_87
Reviews.Content: No doubt that Travelodge's are used, by the majority, for an overnight stay. And our visit to the Royal Scot was for that sole purpose en route for a short break in Paris. The hotel was chosen due to its fantastic location close to St Pancras International (King's Cross Train/Tube Station is also the same distance) and also for its price, as at Â£59 was the cheapest in the area for a Saturday night. I'd like to go on record to say that everything was what you'd expect from a Travelodge - it looked clean and welcoming on arrival, the staff were friendly, first impression of the room was good and the food in the restaurant was nice and not too expensive. The ONLY problem, however, was a big one, in our (my fiancee and I) opinion anyway. It had been a very hot day in London and when the day's are hot, the night's are, too. The only form of air conditioning in the room was a 70's looking contraption attached to the wall which didn't even kick in when you first turned it on, and when it started to work only a spittle of air was coming out of it - it made no difference at all. And to make matters worse the window could only open about 10 centimetres meaning that it was like an oven in the room all night - it was unbearable and my fiancee even had to have a cold shower at 1am just to cool down. Looking out of our window at that time there seemed to be an awful lot of open curtains as, just like in our room, that was the only way that the small amount of air could enter between the curtains. As I said this was the only problem, but it didn't make our stay enjoyable. So if you are considering staying at the Royal Scot, especially when it's warm, please enquire about the 'air conditioning' situation.

Reviews.Title: “OK FOR OVERNIGHT STAY”
Reviews.Author: sheba72
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fairly central to Kings Cross, so handy in that respect, and it was clean and comfortable but not somewhere I would want to stay for a holiday. The shower curtain in the bathroon trailed in the bath and was far too long. The room was also quite noisy due to outside traffic, but in central London it's to be expected. Breakfast was ok and although the queues seemed off putting they moved fairly swiftly. As said in the title ok if staying overnight.

Reviews.Title: “Vile, filthy dirty run down hotel”
Reviews.Author: ustwo2008
Reviews.Content: I have to say that I was extremely disappointed with the standards at this hotel during our recent stay. Two of the three lifts were out of order for the duration of our stay and the one lift that was in use was in very poor condition, there were panels missing inside the lift, some of the paint was scratched off and on one occasion there was saliva on the floor that made me feel really quite ill. On the occasions that the lift was too busy we used the stairs, the walls on the stairs were disgusting, they were dirty and in some places there was plaster falling off the walls. Once leaving the lift, walking down the corridor to our room the walls were in a bad state, they were also very dirty. Our room was just as bad, in fact I would go so far as to describe it as filthy. The wall heater had black smears and finger marks all over it The walls were dirty and had marks and stains all over them, there were also holes in the wall in places. The curtains were hanging off the rails There was a large crack in the frame of the television The mirror on the wall in the bedroom area was dirty and had something, goodness only knows what dripping down it. The bathroom door on the inside had varnish missing and looked old and worn. The sink tap was very dirty and looked like it had not been cleaned for some time, the same goes for the other fittings in the bathroom. The shower curtain rail was rusty. Around the tiled walls of the bath the grouting was covered in black mould/mildew, not just small amounts but big black patches. The toilet was absolutely vile, it was badly stained inside. There was a brown stain on the white duvet cover. There were only two pillows supplied. There was no "Do Not Disturb" sign in the room to use. So we were woken in the morning by the maid wanting to service the room. There was what looked like an old wall heater on the wall that had been disconnected; the vents on the heater were quite visibly full of thick dust. When the room was cleaned the towels were not re folded and were just left hanging on the back of a chair where we had left them that morning. On the whole the hotel felt disgustingly dirty and was in serious need of some cleaning and maintenance. I have never seen anything quite so bad in any other hotel that I have stayed in. The standards of cleanliness were atrocious. We booked using the â€œSaver Rateâ€� despite that I still would have expected some kind of standards.

Reviews.Title: “So many bad reviews and I have no idea why!”
Reviews.Author: WeyyyTicTacs
Reviews.Content: Well, as the title suggests, the reviews do not adequately reflect the hotel at all! I went to the Royal Scot Travelodge with my girlfriend so we could go and see Rage Against The Machine at Finsbury Park so we only needed to stay there for one night. The service was very good. We walked into the reception and got our room key at 1:30 and the staff member who served us was VERY polite, asked for details such as name and confirmed the room type. She also asked us how many keys we'd need. After checking in, we used the lift to get up to the room and walked along the corridor to the room. The bed was made, had clean white sheets as well as pillows, tea and coffee facilities, an extra pillow, towels, soap, drinking cups, a colour TV with digital free-view channels and a couple of sockets for phone chargers. We made ourselves comfortable for a few hours and then left the room to go to the festival. We go back later on that night at about 11pm. The doors for reception were open, the bar was still serving drinks and people were checking in. We collected a few teabags, sugars and milks from reception to take back to the room because there's only enough to make 2 teas/coffees with the facilities provided. We went back to the room to sleep. We left the windows open because the rooms were rather warm because of the heat outside but still, there was no noise to be heard and we got a pleasant nights sleep on the bed which was extremely comfortable. Better than my bed at home! The next morning, we woke up, showered and wend downstairs for breakfast which we hadn't pre-booked as we didn't think we'd be up for it. The restaurant offered an all you can eat breakfast. It included full English breakfast, cereal, toast with spreads, croissants, hot drinks, yoghurts and orange juice. The could be more that I forgot. The area was clean and tidy and staff were excellent. After, we headed back to our room to have a nap until 11:45am and then we checked out by putting our cards in the slot on reception. We then left. The main reason we chose this hotel over others is because it's a budget hotel, we only needed to stay one night and that the tube station and overground station are just a 10 minute walk away. The best part was the bed and that there was very little/no noise at night. The worst is that the tea and coffee facilities ran out quickly.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT, I repeat, DO NOT...”
Reviews.Author: Thats_10
Reviews.Content: Comments: 1. There's no air in rooms (unless you bring some air from home). windows can't be opened (maybe because of safety) . the windows are actually blocked. There's aircondition in the room but it doesnt activated. It was told by management that "it is not activated because of MANAGEMENT POLICY REASONS". From 3 elevators in the hotel, only one was actually active ( a rather small one). we stayed in that hotel 4 nights and it seems nobody even intends to fix these 2 broken elevators.so dont buy stories about, "we r fixing now the elevators ASAP", it's B.S. each night several buses full with tourists are crowded into that narrow poor elevator and of course, the phenomenon repeats itself also in the mornings. breakfast are fine but I advice you to give up the sunday breakfast unless you want to stand in line with other 250 poor guests waiting endlessly (we gave up). There's no clear signs to the stairs and when you go down you may find yourself in a closed yard under the building. in case of fire, People will be killed over there! There's lack of towels, and no phone in rooms. You need to be a genious to activate the taps in the bathroom. It took me about 3 days to find all the options of that heroic invention (cold/warm/strength of water). The stuff is divided. some it is apathetic but some are nice. Last word, DO NOT...

Reviews.Title: “It's not much but it's close to Kings Cross and Euston”
Reviews.Author: shiftpuzzle
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night before catching the Eurostar train from St Pancras, and we stayed another night before getting a train from Euston station to Liverpool, so we really just came here to sleep before going off to Paris and Liverpool. We didn't spend much time here. I can tell you that it's within walking distance of Kings Cross/St Pancras and Euston, the hot water worked and the sheets were clean, and there was a kettle in our room with tea and coffee, so we didn't have any problems with this place.

Reviews.Title: “broken down hotel”
Reviews.Author: AussieW0rldExpl0rers
Reviews.Content: stayed 1 night at this hotel. wasnt too impressed... shouldve stayed in a nicer hostel then put extra money into a hotel. the walls were paper thin, the water pipes were extremely loud!! the elevators broke down and after walking all day of london, getting up 6 flights of stairs wasnt the best way to end the day. The lady at reception was in the back room chatting away with her workmates while we waited at reception, had to get the mechanic man to get someone for us to check in. stayed in a triple room - the room was small but wasnt expecting anything fabulous. location was pretty good though. overall not worth the money... wouldnt stay here again. and if u do take ear muffs!!

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: tomric122
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at several Travelodges throughout the UK as a business travelller, I had come to expect a reasonable and consistent standard of accomodation at an affordable price. How wrong can one be. This Travelodge falls well below the standard of other hotels in the chain. Tired, worn, scruffy are just some of the words that I would use to describe it. Its location near the train stations is its greatest asset but all in all a place to be avoided. During the whole of our three day stay, two of the three lifts were out of order - a problem that seems to go back several months judging by other reviews ..... which we wish we had read before booking !!! A place to avoid.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre”
Reviews.Author: kellymoy
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very run down inside and out - reception and bar ok but rooms tell a different tale. Bad need of a paint and new furnishings - although was clean enough. Staff would need serious customer care training!! On arrival were giving our key and that was it. I asked were are the rooms he just said that way - no help at all. Next morning was hectic at breakfast, people queing for 45 minutes, and staff VERY ignorant. Save yourself the money and eat elsewhere, breakfast bit rubbish. It is close enough to the station and we got cheap deal so sort of weren't expecting much anyways.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs”
Reviews.Author: HappyCorpse
Reviews.Content: An absolute dive, i normally recommend Travelodge however this hotel is the pits. The building is falling apart, the rooms are not what you are told you will get, join the queue asking for pillows and towels and pray that you can't hear a noisy neighbor through the paper thin walls. If you're going to London go to the Southwark or Docklands travelodge, they are great, avoid this one at all costs!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty tired and cheap”
Reviews.Author: Anton N
Reviews.Content: Hotel is a 10 minute walk from Kings Cross (oddly, there is another Travelodge closer to Kings Cross) and the big brown brick building looms round the corner as you approach it. On entering the reception was chaotic, people everywhere and a few members of staff floating around. By the time I was served the receptionist was bored/tired/ready for a break and greeted me with all the warmth of a wet blanket. On getting my room key the trip to the room did nothing to change my initial impressions of the hotel, the lifts are separated from main reception by a coded door, this door is worn, flaking and looks like a strong shove could knock it over. The lifts were a disgrace, probably quite pleasant when new however had not seen a lick of polish for years. Out of the three lifts one was permanently broken, one broke on the first night leaving one operational, for a hotel of this size that was terrible. The room was clean and tidy but none of the cupboards closed properly, the taps in the bathroom were hot or super hot (no cold!) the shower curtain looked like it held its own eco system and the windows were more reminiscent of a prison than a hotel. Night time was noisy through doors banking and guests shouting, the next day things did not improve. Not a jewel in the Travelodge crown, there are better hotels out there you'd be better of finding one of them.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for a 1 night stay!”
Reviews.Author: GrazzaD
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fine for my 1 night stay to grab the Eurostar the following morning to Belgium (15 min walk from this hotel). On arrival the big, imposing dark coloured building didn't look at all inviting, but the reception was good if very busy- the lone receptionist was clearly rushed off his feet trying to deal with groups of foreign people. The room was by far the best part of the hotel. The sheets were spotless, the bed comfortable, the shower and bathroom very good and clean and the room itself in very nice condition. A TV, tea, coffee milk and kettle were all available and led to a very comfy stay. In the cafÃ© I enjoyed some tomato soup and a roll, which was a fairly small portion but nonetheless very nice in the quiet restaraunt area. There were two problems with the hotel. The groups of foreign students, as mentioned before, were running and shouting along the corridoors, and knocking on each other's doors until well after 11pm. I'm not sure why this hotel attracts so many, but there really should be rules in place to prevent the noise late at night. I did however manage to get a fine sleep. Secondly the only way to get up into the rooms is via 3 fairly old lifts which can become crowded, there are no available stairs to get to the upper floors. This can be a real problem due to the size of the hotel and especially if you're in a hurry - don't be surprised to be in the queue for a lift. 1 lift was also out of order on my visit. Overall, I'm very happy with the stay I had, fine for a 1 night stopover.

Reviews.Title: “We got what we paid for”
Reviews.Author: simonsandrawelton
Reviews.Content: There have been a lot of poor reviews about this hotel, but I paid Â£37 for the night. Reception was quick and efficient, the rooms were very clean and tidy as was the bathroom with plenty of clean towels. It was an excellent base to do all the touristy bits and Kings Cross rail and tube were 5 mins away. As I say I paid Â£37 for ther night, The room wasnt stylish and ultra modern but definately not as bad as some have made out in their reviews. OK not the Ritz or the Savoy, but I didnt pay premium prices either. Will definately stay here again if I want to use Heathrow or have another jolly around London.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough for short stays”
Reviews.Author: SOWK
Reviews.Content: I've only stayed for one night. It's a short walk from St. Pancras/King's Cross. Though the curtains weren't hang properly, the room and (and very important) bathroom were clean. We had 4 towels for just one night. The beds weren't as awful as I thought they would be, but at night there was a lot of noise at the parking. The hotel does need some renovation; plaster, paint.

Reviews.Title: “Does the job just fine.”
Reviews.Author: Tubbytony40
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three days during the Easter break and found it to be quite good. It's really close to the Pentonville Road tube entrance and has a number of eateries close to hand. The dÃ©cor was fine, if a little tired. The room was clean and large enough to accommodate two adults and a six year old. The staff were courteous and seemed to deal quite efficiently with a group of rowdy school children. My only criticism would be the behaviour of the afore mentioned teenagers who were still making a substantial amount of noise at 2am but this was on one night only and I would say that there poor behaviour is the fault of there teachers rather than the hotel staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stop over”
Reviews.Author: Bosinver
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my friend and our two small grandchildren on 5th April as we were travelling on the Eurostar to Disney the next day. We booked last minute due to the threatened rail strike and were just glad to be able to get accommodation. After booking and reading the reviews ( mainly negative ) I was quite worried about the hotel. However on our arrival we were very pleasantly surprised. We had booked 2 double rooms - both were very clean, warm, and the beds were very comfortable. One room had a bath, the other had a shower so the children were able to have a bath before bed. There was hot water and tea and coffee making facilities. We booked breakfast for the next morning and this was very good with lots of choice and children eat free. The best thing of all was the closeness of St.Pancras station as we were able to walk there. Don't listen to the negative reviews as I would recommend this hotel and would not hesitate to book again.

Reviews.Title: “it's a busy Travelodge in central London: You pays your money and you makes your choice”
Reviews.Author: DrNostromo
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel at short notice for an overnight stay. Needed somewhere central and cheap and based on the reviews here I probably wouldn't have booked this hotel but they were one of the only ones that could accommodate us during the Easter school break and were by far the cheapest. Glad now that I didn't listen to the reviews. OK the place needs a lick of paint and a little bit of care and attention but Travelodge make this clear on their website. Let's be honest here, it's a large Travelodge in central London that caters for coach trips. Yes you are going to get a certain amount of noise but I have stayed in London hotels with a lot more noise that are a lot smaller. You can get rooms here sometimes for Â£19 a night, which is just fantastic value for central London. We found the rooms and hotel warm, dry and clean and perfectly fit for purpose. left too early to try the breakfast so can't comment on that. OK the staff don't know a lot but as is often the case in hotels in central London English is not their first language and they don't have a lot of local knowledge but overall they did a lot better job, (probably on the minimum wage), than I am sure I would have done if I had been dropped in as a hotel receptionist in Manila. Not a place for a romantic break or if you want to get away from it all (but neither is central London.) but all in all fit for purpose and good value for money, so as I said you pays your money and you makes your choice.

Reviews.Title: “Do not bother the service is awful”
Reviews.Author: marty1981
Reviews.Content: Hotel is best to be avoided on all counts Stayed on the 7th of January and upon arrival was told that my booking was for the 6th so could not stay (receptionist very rude in announcing this to everyone) and considering this was for my partners birthday trip to London was almost in a state of panic. But logged on to site and showed them my actual reservation which was for the 7th the receptionist became very quiet after this. Hotel needs complete remodernisation and felt like we got stuck in a room they use for overbooking it was that bad. would avoid at all cost. Also complained after about the debacle upon arrival and this got nowhere with the hotel so like i said AVOID.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid - it is a health hazard”
Reviews.Author: rox_uk
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my partner for one night before we were getting the Eurostar. The first room we were given had an overpowering smell of DAMP when we went in, despite the window having been open all day, with wall paper peeling from the walls. The guy on reception changed our room immediately. Although the new room did not smell of damp, the shower rail in the bathroom was coming off the wall - absolutely no use to you of you actually had to use it - and the window couldn't open because the handle was broken off of it. A very poor hotel unfortunately in a great location. I've stayed in some excellent Travelodge hotels but this is a total disgrace. Just because it's cheap shouldn't mean that it is disgusting to stay in. Avoid.

Reviews.Title: “Find somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: smanamana_10
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights on a self funded business trip hence need for Budget Accom. Indeed it was cheap, but that's the only thing that can be said for it. It was more like a Youth Hostel overrun by foreign youths who were loud and noisy into the early hours, either in the corridors or outside in courtyard. Rooms are also very tired, Lift capacity also inadequate, esp when foreign students ignore the stand in line principle. If you do stay here insist on being accommodated on a floorr that doesn't have youngsters on it and ideally try for courtyard rather than road ( very noisy also) outlook

Reviews.Title: “Complete dump”
Reviews.Author: LuckyMermaid
Reviews.Content: The bathroom smelt, the curtains and wallpaper were both torn (and the latter was also spattered with what I hope was cola) and the sheets were slightly damp, like they'd been made up days before. The shower curtain was grubby and overlong, there were no nets in a room that was overlooked and the heating was defective. I am used to relying on a basic level of cleanliness in the cheap chains, like Premier Inn and Ibis, and this was simply not good enough. Maybe it suits the noisy foreign school trips that seemed to make up most of the guests, but it made me ashamed of British hotels.

Reviews.Title: “A great disappointment..”
Reviews.Author: aussielady_10
Reviews.Content: The staff were curt and unhelpful,the food was 2nd rate (heard afterwoods that it was frozen and heated to serve!) ,the room was basic but at such a cheap price I expected that...We just did not feel welcome from our check-in until we left. It was also very cold in our room. We had just arrived in England full of the excitement of overseas travel..we certainly came down to earth with a bump when we booked in at The royal scot !!!

Reviews.Title: “Gets the job done”
Reviews.Author: umpiredice
Reviews.Content: I stayed for four nights while attending a couple of Arsenal matches. The location is fantastic, only a ten minute walk from Kings Cross / St. Pancras. Staff were very helpful and accommodating. The full English breakfast was fine - not gourmet by any means, but plenty of choices and a decent selection of hot items. As other reviewers have pointed out, the rooms are pretty small and utilitarian, and quite in need of a makeover. The curtain in my room was missing a couple of hooks, but it was no big deal. Water pressure in the shower is excellent but there's a 38 degree Celsius governor on the tap, so if you want a really hot shower, you're out of luck. My bed was comfortable and I slept well every night. There are six computers available in the lobby for guests' use, at the rate of one pound for twenty minutes. Be aware that they freeze up occasionally. However, staff at the front desk are quick to call the service number and get the computer reset, or get you a new session for free on a different machine. It's a very basic hotel - little more than four walls and a roof, and a couple of minor amenities. But I wasn't planning on spending any time in the hotel, I was there to see the football and a bit of London, and for my purposes, it was a good place to stay. There's a decent little Italian restaurant half a block north on Kings Cross Road from the hotel, and a very nice pub called the Carpenters Arms about a block and a half south on the other side of the road. This was my second time staying here, and I'll probably stay here again on future trips - if I'm on my own (I wouldn't bring my wife and kids, they like a bit more luxury). Sure, it's full of tour groups all the time and it's a bit run down, but the convenience of a good breakfast and a great location more than make up for it. Plus, under $300 Canadian for four nights in London, in a place where I felt safe, is a real bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Has to be marked as poor”
Reviews.Author: Stormyelf
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff at the check in desk but thats about it. When we got to our room we found it hadn't been cleaned, my friend had a big curly hair in her bed and I had food in mine! opening the wardrobe we discovered someones suitcases and shopping bags, it was only then we realised the hotelier had checked us into someone elses room. Clearly incompetent. Tea/Coffee facilities were available but no spoon to stir it with. Our room was warm enough but the other 4 girls said theirs were very cold and they didn't sleep. And now for the nitty gritty! The windows were filthy, rooms poorly decorated there were 3 different colours on the walls which looked like they had just used up whatever they could find, the hotel itself was just a maize and finding the reception via the stairs were very frustrating (The lift was always too full and took ages). There were sweet wrappers on the stairs, which were still there when we left the next day, large chunks of plaster missing off the walls on the stairs and mould on the window frames. My only advice would be if you are a student used to hostel bed downs for a night then this will be tolerable for you, us bunch of girls are not snobby or posh but for Â£82 per room it could have been better, particularly as the ibis just up the road in Euston is only Â£89-Â£99 and marks at a 4* in comparison.

Reviews.Title: “Travelodge - dump this carbuncle from your portfolio a.s.a.p.”
Reviews.Author: Playitfair
Reviews.Content: If you get this room cheap - which in most cases isnt the case - I paid comparative price to the other London Travelodges which are mostly good, then I suppose you might expect basic budget accommodation. However, this doesnt account for the 'shabby chic' look of light fittings hanging off your wall - that cant be safe. Grubby carpets; grubby walls; beds that any prisoner would turn their nose up at and because the worn out secondary glazing couldnt be closed a night of 'sleep' that could be equalled to a night spent on a traffic island. I presume from the couple of positive reviews on this hotel that a small number of rooms have been upgraded - lucky you if you got one of these. In the majority they are disgusting. Travelodge say it is an acquisition property, but its not a newly acquisitioned property, so they should be dealing with this issue now. Close it down, completely gut it and upgrade it to match the other London Travelodges and lets start again. If you can afford ' a few dollars more' stay away from here - you wont regret it!

Reviews.Title: “book with caution. hostel not hotel”
Reviews.Author: EastMidlandsMillie12
Reviews.Content: I have just come back from a half term break with my son. We usually stay at the travel lodge in Southwalk close to the river but this trip we got a good deal on the train so looked for hotels near St pancras. I noticed on the web site that it did say accusition hotel, however Ididnt realise that it meant very poor quality. The minute I walked in i had that stomach dropping feeling. The computer system couldnt keep up with the bookings. Not enough Staff on reception. Staircase is cold and has big lumps of plaster missing on the walls. Carpets are worn. Room had curtains that were not hung properly. Stains on the shabby worn dark wood fittings. Old TV that rolled slightly. Mould in the bathroom. No house keping service on one of the days went down to ask for my dirty cups etc to be removed..no one came! Cue for breakfast. Poor quality food. Toaster that doesnt toast Expensive Bar..I could go on. The area was not nice but I knew that. Close to what we wanted to do that trip. what I didnt expect was shabby horrible accomodation. I only stayed and didnt make a fuss for the sake of my son who was really looking forward to the trip..so I went with the flow as he was looking a bit down hearted !! Im reading some of the reviews from the past few weeks and thinking I wish I had looked at this site before. It was cheap at about 35 pounds per night but i would pay more and go else where another time. On the plus side and contradicatory to some other reviews it was with great trepidation I had to move the beds and bottom sheets in a frantic search for a lost mobile phone... they were clean ! ..luck more than judgemnet !. Travel lodge sort this place out it has put me off !! yes the duvets were very thin, oh and windows were filty yuk! Probably ok ish if you cam get a Â£9 room and you are very relaxed about where you stay staff especially at breakfast time looked close to breaking point.

Reviews.Title: “If Travelodge were showcasing its hotels...”
Reviews.Author: culchied
Reviews.Content: ...you can be sure this one wouldn't feature in its publicity brochure. I've stayed in this particular Travelodge on numerous occasions in the last year alone and over the last number of years. As you can tell, if I'm prepared to stay in it more than once, then it's obviously bearable. Sadly, some of the other reviews on here do paint an accurate picture of what it's really like. This particular hotel is an acquisition hotel; that is a hotel bought over by Travelodge and now operating as a Travelodge. Consequently, you don't really get that much Travelodge branding and the rooms aren't really in keeping with the Travelodge room style. Sadly, this particular hotel does tarnish the Travelodge reputation somewhat. Most of the rooms are kitted out in the design of the previous hotel's incarnation. Solid wood furniture, baths in the bathroom (uncommon in most Travelodges) and, rather unfortunately, no air conditioning. Having stayed here during the summer months and the hottest of temperatures outside, the heat in the hotel can be unbearable and it's worth remembering this if you decide to book to stay during the summer months. As other reviews have pointed out, the hotel can be noisy. It appears to be popular with group excursions so you tend to get a lot of groups mingling around. Depending on the location of your room, you may find that you get lumbered with a bed next to a door that fronts onto a busy corridor. Another downfall of this hotel is the lack of chairs in the rooms. The modern Travelodge room layout always encompasses a chair as anyone who's stayed in the Kings Cross, City Road or Euston Travelodges can testify. If you want to do some work at a desk in the evening, apply your make up sat in front of a mirror or just relax in a chair, you could be disappointed. The staff on reception will, however, allow you to take a chair from the bar for your room but you can look silly taking it all the way upstairs or via the lift. The hotel does have its plus points. I've rarely paid more than Â£30 a night to stay here and, to be honest, I'd begrudge paying anything more than this. It has a convenient location about 10 minutes from Kings Cross St Pancras station and on a relatively quiet road. Unlike other Travelodges, this one has lockers for left luggage and you can store your luggage here for something like Â£5 (slightly cheaper than the facility at the nearby station). If you're after a convenient and cheap hotel that has no frills but is largely clean then I'd say plump for this particular one. If you're a light sleeper, just ensure you're comfortable with your allocated room before you settle into it. Finally, if you do see another Travelodge cheaper elsewhere, plump for it! There certainly are better ones out there!

Reviews.Title: “Not good for families with small children or older couples wanting a good nights sleep.”
Reviews.Author: kalaNotts
Reviews.Content: Just got back, shattered! The Hotel is within walking distance of Kings Cross Station and is one of the cheaper Hotels around. However, the rooms were tatty, and we had a curtain missing, which wasn't good seen as we were on the main road side. Bit of mould around the bath and someones used cotton bud and fluff in the heater, but clean towels in the full bathroom. Loads of groups of young people booked in and the noise was hiddeous. Slamming doors, running up and down the corridors shouting all night. Really no respect for other guests. Would have made sense to put them all on one floor away from families? If you are young and with a group of mates or a couple who won't sleep then it's cheap and cheerful, but if you have small children or an older couple then avoid at all costs. Wish we'd stuck with Premier Inn, but we live and learn!

Reviews.Title: “Eah....It just about barely works”
Reviews.Author: BoulderBaehres
Reviews.Content: Well.... this hotel is kind of a dump. But, conveniently located and reasonably priced (for London). Check-in and check-out were quick, easy, and efficient. Fairly secure - you need your key to access the lifts to the rooms. Hallways are worn and paint is peeling. Every room is an ensuite, but the twin beds in our room were very narrow and hard with hard pillows. No decoration - just utilitaian white. The shower had great water power, but never got warmer than tepid. Didn't have to check out until noon, which was nice. Breakfast was minimal - toast, jam, coffee, and juice. Yes, it looked like hundreds of people had had breakfast before us and left their mess. But the staff was trying to keep up - clearing tables and vacuming. Overall - felt more like a hostel than a 2-3 star hotel. But it served the purpose adequately.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad a trip advisor reviews say”
Reviews.Author: jac_killie
Reviews.Content: I was quite weary of going to this travellodge after reading all the bad reviews on here. When I arrived I was pleasantly surprised. We were on the 6th floor in room 687. When we first went in the staff were very helpful. We asked a couple of questions about the area and about taxi's etc and they gave us all the information that we needed. After we had been to the room we also had to ask for an extra towel and pillow which they were very obliging in getting for us. The room itself was a wee bit on the small side but it was clean enough. It was a touch old fashioned but it is a budget hotel so you cant complain. The bed was really comfy and I slept like a log every night. The room was cleaned every day and the tea / coffee making facilities were stocked up every morning. I never had any breakfast or other food in the hotel but the menu had a lot on it to choose from. I would definately stay here again if I was going to visit London.

Reviews.Title: “There was no other choice ...”
Reviews.Author: SandyButton76
Reviews.Content: ... lucky I've booked a double room - so I had a much more comfortable room than maybe as single room?! My "favourite" thing in my room was - no power! I had a shower and wanted to dry my hair and there was no chance to switch anything on in my room. And because you don't have a phone, I ended up running from 4th floor to the reception. 15 minutes later a technican arrived and finally I had power, but less time for my theatre trip. I had a nice evening at the Almeida Theatre, bought some Baccardi breezer and went off the other day very early in the morning. Breakfast was included. I had a school class at my floor and they were very loud and the lift made some noises everytime it arrived ... so I got not the best sleep.

Reviews.Title: “not as bad as painted !”
Reviews.Author: DawnLeicester
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel on four different occasions, each time I have found the staff pleasant, rooms clean and the location to St Pancras station is perfect, yes it's a bit tired but what do you expect for a budget hotel, bearing in mind we only sleep in the room and spend the rest of the time out it fits the bill Â£19 a night !!!! I would be happy to stay here again, I have stayed in 4/5 * hotels and at the end of the day you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute hole!”
Reviews.Author: fandabbydosy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked a 2 night stay in this hotel to celebrate my 21st birthday in London. Unfortunately, I made the mistake of NOT reading the reviews for this hotel before going. As it was a Travelodge hotel I assumed standards would be the same across board and as I have had all positive experiences previously elsewhere I assumed this would be fine too... WRONG. Check in was fast and friendly. We were given a room on the 2nd floor. Upon opening the door the smell was musky. The first thing I noticed was the dated UGLY furniture. It was dirty and smelly. I pulled back the bed sheets to find they had marks all over. The bathroom was tiny and had mould in the shower. The floor was grotty and generally not cleaned. Might I also add that we booked a double room. This room had a double bed in it but it was NOT a double room. It even had the SINGLE headboard still attached to the wall. My husband went to reception and swiftly got our room changed. We were moved to the 6th floor. This time it was a double room but the room was still filthy. The cleaners obviously weren't doing their job. The wallpaper was peeling and the window was mouldy. I had also come out with bite marks on my arms and I'd only sat in the bed for a few minutes! We were not happy to stay in this hotel so we asked to be moved to another hotel. They said this would not be possible however, they did offer us a full refund without us having to ask for one first. This was great as I was expecting to have to kick up a fuss. Hotel in MAJOR need of upgrading. Gutting out and cleaning BIG TIME. Just don't go here, not worth it. Travelodge should be ashamed to have this 'aquired' property on it's books. We spent a while looking for another hotel but found one for similar price near Paddington station. It was a palace compared to this!

Reviews.Title: “dire-and thats being generous”
Reviews.Author: LincsBetsy
Reviews.Content: shabby, tired, no hot water, no curtains and lights that worked when they felt like it! a disgrace to the travelodge logo. only there for two nights-came home more tired than i went. convenient for station but that is all you can say about it.

Reviews.Title: “Dismal - I spent 5 mins here before I had to book another hotel”
Reviews.Author: mikeinpreston
Reviews.Content: Travelodge should be ashamed to have this hotel on the books. OK so they warn you that this is a acquisition property and that the rooms may not match the picture they show on the website. But at least you expect it to be clean! Pay Â£10 more to stay at the Travelodge in Euston - its well worth the extra!

Reviews.Title: “..definitely bad”
Reviews.Author: didimercuri
Reviews.Content: even though the position is quite good, the quality of the hotel is very low. the staff is really inhospitable, surly and rude. every room for 3 people has got only 2 towels, so you have to ask for more. it's generally cold in the great part of the rooms and if you tell them, they don't really matter and the only thing they do is giving you more blankets. the hygiene is not good and also the food is barely edible. they surely won't see me again.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay at this hotel the food is discusting”
Reviews.Author: geoffsmith
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights unfortunately. Although it was cheap that does not mean you have to eat pig swill which is what the breakfast was like. The Bacon was all bunched together cooked ont he outside paler on the inside, It looked like it had been repeatedly warmed up. The squash was watered down the coffee was very very weak. The beans were cold. On the second morning I could not face the breakfast although i paid what I though was a lot for it. I just had croissants and marmalade and even they seemed to be stale. I had a plate of beans which were stone cold. Compared to other Travellodge hotels I stayed in, this was the worst. I would never ever stay here again. It spoilt my visit. The room was dirty carpet hadnt been vacuumed, there was signed of previous occupiers as there were cornflakes all over the tv table and on the chair. On the bedside cabinet there was a large sticky mess which I had to clean up. I felt uncomfortable at this hotel I just wish the management company read these reviews. The hotel reception where the internet comuters were was freezing cold no heating on at all. The area was a bit rough but then thats Kings Cross it didnt bother me .

Reviews.Title: “Dirty rooms and no hot water poor hotel dont bother!!”
Reviews.Author: skiprat_10
Reviews.Content: I found this travelodge of very poor quality since my last visit in 2006, yes it is budget accomodation but I at least expect hot water in the rooms when the temperature outside is -6C! No hot water the room was grubby and the disposable plastic cups had been washed out we didnt even get fresh disposable cups. The reception was frezzing cold as the staf continued to leave the doorrs open in the cold snap. The bar was cold and never open. Dont bother with this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Not the best but did the job”
Reviews.Author: bgrUk
Reviews.Content: This travelodge is about 5+ minutes walk from the tube which was a bit cold in the snow. The walk was fine in a group but I wouldn't want to stay there and walk back on my own at night. The hotel was about what you would expect from travelodge. Its not one of the newer ones that are around but was clean and comfortable for the time we spent there which was really only to sleep. My only real gripe is that they seem to have dodgy plumbing which whines and hums late into the night and as soon as everyone starts to wake up in the morning. On the second day I lay there trying to decide if it was a muffled fire alarm before concluding it was water going into someone's shower that sounded like an odd siren!

Reviews.Title: “Cracking Value.”
Reviews.Author: Jeevesliverpool
Reviews.Content: Having read other reviews I was a bit wary, but my stay was faultless and at just 19 pound brilliant value. Hotel is only 5 min walk from Kings cross station and all on main roads, so safety concerns pretty unfounded. Check in was easy and room clean and adequate at the front of hotel overlooking street. Slept fine and didnt notice any noise through the night that others have commented on. All in all if you book this hotel on a cheap deal you are getting a good deal. Didnt eat there so cant comment on food.

Reviews.Title: “Not perfect, but good enough!”
Reviews.Author: neo1966
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in the Royal Scot for three nights as part of a romantic get away for me and my girlfriend. Location was great, close by KIngs Cross tube and rail links (5 to 10 minutes walk, taxi cost Â£4 from the station). Reception well staffed but check in a bit slow. Lobby seems a bit run down, and room wardrobe back was loose. The room, however was a good size and clean (accept a bit of mold in the bathroom). Bathroom had a nice marble basin. Bed was very comfortable. Hotel has a restuarant on site but we did not try the food as we were out every day. Did have a few beers, the barlady waited to finish her texting on her phone before serving us! Housekeeping were very good at respecting our do not disturb sign, and provided us with extra tea when I asked one of them in the corridor. No wireless internet, but there were terminals in the lobby. My girlfriend tried them and said they worked, but were slow (Â£1 for 20 minutes charge). Overall, a good budget hotel for those looking for a place to crash (for us, the events we had during the stay were more important than the hotel), but maybe not so good for business travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Yuck, shabby, tired - expensive !”
Reviews.Author: sazbox
Reviews.Content: This hotel needs a complete rebfurb. Its old, tired, dirty. The decor in the room left a lot to be desired. The lamps was falling off the wall, the paint was peeling. It looked as if the skirting board had been hit with a Hoover and had a bit chunk out of it. The bathroom was tiny but actually quite clean. The bed had the thinnest duvet on it. The staff was completely unhelpful. I had no phone in the room so had to go back to reception to ask for an iron/ironing board and was informed they had non available but might have some back in 1/2 hour - I asked if I could put my name down for one and was told no it was on a first come first served basis. Â£65 for a double room is a disgusting price for a shabby hotel like this - and no breakfast either - wish I had stayed somewhere else - definitely would not go back

Reviews.Title: “No hassle hotel to rest”
Reviews.Author: GrumpydadCoventry
Reviews.Content: Got to the hotel at 12.00pm, early check-in cost an extra Â£10 but well worth it as it freed the day up for sight seeing. Close to kings cross railway which allowed us to travel where we wanted(Â£5.60 all day pass on zones 1&2). Had a great day shopping and sightseeing and finished up in the resturant for dinner, starving but food seemed ok. Room was pretty good and amazed at how quiet the night went, expected all kinds of noise but this never happened. Breakfast was a bargain at only Â£7.50 per adult but kids up to 15 ate free and food was good. Could have stayed another night as we had a great time but work commitments dictate, will use hotel again next year and hope we have a stay on par with this one,

Reviews.Title: “not bad for time of year”
Reviews.Author: clarets3
Reviews.Content: We had 3 nights over thw weekend of 4th -7th December, it was really hard to find any hotel and we travel to London a lot, so we did pay more for this than we usually do but at the end of the day it was 7 minutes walk from Kings Cross tube and a travelodge is a travelodge rooms basic but very clean. Plenty of tea and coffee available on request..very busy but staff were pleasant and helpful. Only drawback was that the lifts went out of order on the Saturday and remained that way for 24 hours but you cant predict that I suppose

Reviews.Title: “RUDE STAFF, REPULSIVE ROOM. NO CUSTOMER SERVICE. AVOID AT ALL COSTS. WORSE THAN A HOSTEL”
Reviews.Author: LozHammersbaws
Reviews.Content: This hotel has the rudest person in a customer service based job that I have ever had the misfortune to encounter. She lied, she accused me of lying, she was obnoxious and completely incapable of working in a hotel reception. No people skills and quite clearly no ability to deal with a genuine complaint. In our brief time at the hotel I hoverheard 4 seperate people making complaints about the facilities. We had booked 3 double rooms for a family break, as we were travelling seperately the others in the party arrived before my partner and I and had booked in. When we arrived we were told by the 'receptionist' that they did not have any double rooms left and that we would be in a tripple, she said that if we came down before 12pm the follwing day we could change our room to a double, we reluctantly accepted this, and made our way to the tripple room. The room was not what we would have expected from a travelodge (see photos). The bathroom was dirty and had dirty towels that had not been removed, there was a hole in the bathrooms door, the grout around the bath and sink was grubby, there was dry rot in the skirting and a disgusting brown build up of something unidentified around the join between the toilet and tiles, we had no soap, the plastic disposable cups had clearly been used by the guests before us (toothpaste stains etc) The dressing table/desk had no chair, there were what looked like brown liquid stains all over the walls from top to bottom (god knows what happened in that room?!?!) there were what looked like either vomit or hot chocolate stains down the side of the tv unit and finaly there was mould around the window. DISGUSTING. AVOID AT ALL COSTS. THE PHOTOS POSTED BY OTHER REVIEWERS ARE NOT REPRESENTATIVE OF ALL THE ROOMS IN THE HOTEL. ONLY SOME OF THE FLOORS HAVE RENOVATED ROOMS. As suggested the night before we went to reception to ask for our room to be changed, The receptionsist (a different one) said that this was fine and told us to pack our bags in preparation for the move. We were told to come back in the afternoon and our double room would be ready. When we returned the original rude receptionist was back on duty- to cut a very long story short - our double room was not available, she denied that the person we spoke to in the morning even existed, then when countered about it she said the woman didn't work there!!!! She denied that she had told us when we checked in that we could swap rooms, and basically accused me of lying and making it all up. The hotel was overbooked so our option was to stay in the room we had or to find another hotel. It appeared to be ok for the hotel to give someone else the double room we had booked and paid for before arrival but she refised point blank to give us a double room that someone else had not yet booked into even although it meant splitting up a party of 6 . In the end two of us had to move to another hotel. She arranged for us to be picked up by taxi and moved to another travelodge. As it turned out the taxi was unmarked and the driver dropped us off 10mins away from the travelodge. We had no idea where we were going and had to hail a black cab to take us there. When we got to the second hotel they had no record of us being moved! We had to wait an hour before the deputy manager was able to give us a room. He had to sort out the mess. I am not fussy, I expect a room of the standard that is being paid for, we paid Â£59 per night (room only), cheap by London standards. I was not expecting a palace but I was expecting to get a double room, get a clean room and have staff treat me with a bit of respect and dignity as a paying customer.

Reviews.Title: “2 nights without any sleep”
Reviews.Author: MusicMan54
Reviews.Content: The single beds in this place are no wider than 2 and a 1/2 foot, the mattress is made out of, what felt like, 3 blankets layered on top of each other. The staff are pathetic, they didnt have a clue about anything. The noise from outside traffic was unbearable too. They charge Â£1.00 for 20 minutes of internet. Rip off. The bathroom was built for the Hobbits, come to think about it, so was the bloody bed. Avoid. Avoid. Avoid. Avoid. Avoid. Avoid.

Reviews.Title: “Fine with us”
Reviews.Author: Tan84
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Royal Scot between 13 - 15 November and thought it was ok. Only paid Â£100 for 2 nights accommodation and return train from Aberdeen so was not expecting anything spectacular. The hotel is only a 5 minute walk from Kings Cross station/tube so was ideal. Our room was rather small but was ok for the 2 nights we stayed as we were too busy during the day to be in the hotel. Could have been given more towels but we just took some from the cart in the morning. Hotel has internet access but no printers i'm afraid. Didnt eat in the restaurant as wanted to try out the restaurants in the city but there seemed to be a good choice (whether it was nice was another question). Dont worry about being cold in your room, the windows dont open so we were very cosy!!! Would go back again for cheapness.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as I expected, Clean and warm.”
Reviews.Author: Bumblelion
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel when visiting the city for two nights ((9th-11th November 2009). I was pretty concerned from the reports that I had read about the hotel as I would be travelling alone. But as I wasnt planning on spending too much time in the hotel I thought I would give it a go. I was given room 4 which was actually a disabled room on the ground floor. It was situated right behind the lifts and overlooked the main road. Surprisingly there was no noise from the lift or the road, it was the idiots that were shouting by the lifts that woke me up on several occasions (4am was one delightful wake up call). The room was a little grubby in parts and could do with some updating but no worse that any other travelodge or city hotel that I stayed in. One point I should mention is that I found the room to be incrediably hot and the heating gauge that was in the room was too complicated to work. Towels and linen were very clean and I have no complaints about the staff, who although direct were polite and helpful whenever encountered. The location of the hotel is also good, around 5 minutes walk from Kings Cross station. The area immediately around the hotel may cause you concern as there are some `interest` shops, take away, cafe, etc around. My friend who lived in the area whilst as Uni assured me that the area was safe enough by London's standards. All in all, I thought that hotel had previously recieved some bad feedback that may not be completely warrented. I would be happy enough to stay here again. Like others have said, you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but clean”
Reviews.Author: MitchKL
Reviews.Content: It was a last minute decision to book 2 nights stay in Travelodge Kings Cross..we preferred the other one that's nearer to the train station but it was full so we settled for this one located slightly further down the street. It's a budget hotel, so nothing much was expected. I don't particularly like the lifts, it's so small and old! Room is fine, clean, with tea/coffee tea amenties, towels and soap. One thing was I was impressed was on our 2nd day back in the afternoon, our room was all clean and made up. I don't really expect that from a budget lodge. It takes a good 10-15mins walk to the train station and I won't advise travelers to take the train if you plan to go out till late at night and have to walk back to the hotel. Take the cab :) which we did after a great night out in town, much safer especially for girls as it's quite a quiet area to walk back from the train station. The view from our room was pathetic, we see the back of the buildings with rubbish piled up high. And it was really noisy due to some work going on that woke us up by 7-8am. Although I'd say if you're on a budget but wants a decent place to sleep and take shower in, this will be it. No frills, but good enough since you'll be out most of the time anyway. Staffs aren't that friendly though, rarely see any of them smiling, they're robotic. No complains, but no huge compliments for this hotel either.

Reviews.Title: “No so bad as axpected”
Reviews.Author: JPJDenmark
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel 15/10-18/10 2009. Reception was OK. The room was large, clean, bathroom OK. Streetnoise was loud, but that you must expect in a big city. No noise from other guests. Not the worst place to stay - but the breakfast was a mess. At some times guest was standing in a long queue just to enter the restaurant. Then another queue for coffee, for toast, for juice. But with a bit of patience you could get something to eat. if you donÂ´t want to spend much time or money on the hotel, this place is OK.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but clean”
Reviews.Author: bb1Liverpool
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Travel Lodge Royal Scots on the 9th October for 2 nights with my husband, brother and sister-in-law.... Hotel is not the best looking Hotel and looks rather dingy..a bit grubby in the lobby and not very well lit. Check in was quick and after being directed to our rooms we went for the lift ( no stairs) 2 lifts ( 3rd one out of order)that need to be up dated our room was on the 2nd floor but after getting out of the lift and following directions we ended up in what only can be described as the basement.... however even though on street level there was no noise. The bedroom was small, but the bed and bedding were spotless the bathroom was in need of up dating even a bit of grout in the tiles would of made a difference on the whole not a bad place to stay, would stay again..... its not 3* as described for value its o.k ...easy to get to the tube and taxi's are just as cheap to travel by , the tube to the west end would cost 4 of us Â£16 it only cost us Â£8 in a taxi....

Reviews.Title: “Basic but OK”
Reviews.Author: rallybug
Reviews.Content: Styed for one night with a friend who arrived at King's Cross station. Close to the station, so easy enough for getting the tube into town, room was OK if basic but clean. Didn't have breakfast there - can highly recommend the Guzel cafe on Gray'ss Inn Road towards King's Cross station though.

Reviews.Title: “OK Budget Hotel - Forget The Breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: TheDrippingTap
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel via the Asda Travel web site as it was cheaper than Travelodge's own site & included a 'Full English Breakfast' which Travelodge charge Â£7.50 extra for. The hotel reception area has more of hostel feel about it than hotel. It is a good 10 minute walk from King Cross Tube & the surrounding area is rather run down. The public areas are well worn & quite scruffy. Filled with doom & convinced I'd made a mistake I was pleasantly surprised with my room. It was clean, comfortable & well presented. Everything worked (TV, Kettle etc...). The bathroom was clean & had a good shower & plenty of towels were provided. The double bed was comfortable, the linen clean & there were extra pillows available. I was very pleased with myself - all for Â£57.50 (via Asda Travel) including 'Full English Breakfast'. What really let this place down was however the breakfast. There was no coffee in the self serve machines. The buffet style breakfast had no egg or sausage left & the platter of bacon could only be described as a congealed mass of grey fatty meat - no wonder it remained untouched! It is a real shame that Travelodge lets themselves down in this way - a lick of paint & tidy up in the public areas & the so called 'full' breakfast sorted & this would be a great hotel. There is a nice looking Italian restaurant very close as well as Mekong Chinese take away who do dinner boxes for under Â£4 which is great for solo travelers...

Reviews.Title: “Revolting”
Reviews.Author: Elvisthegrey
Reviews.Content: Title says it all, do not stay here! Dirty, smelly and staff couldn't care less.

Reviews.Title: “Wont be back - poor hotel!”
Reviews.Author: d0n81
Reviews.Content: Went with a group of friends, shared a room with my husband. The rooms are not cleaned, bathroom was dirty and not cleaned, was given dirty bath towels covered in blood - yeuck!!!! Bedroom window did not open, so had no fresh air and room was very smelly, also mattresses on beds were the worst ive ever slept on. Breakfast was Â£7.50 EACH and was cold buffett style stuff thats been sitting out for agaes. Toilets at reception were also horrific and covered in sh!t. Only good thing about this hotel was the location, but id rather pay more for a cleaner hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough for me.”
Reviews.Author: Ms-Traveller91
Reviews.Content: I was in London with my class from Norway. We were all together 28 people. The location of this hotel suited us well, considering that we were always going somewhere. Having Kings Cross/ St. Pancras so near was also convenient while coming with Eurostar from Paris. The hotel was also close to small supermarkets and pubs. Near Kings Cross we were able to find Starbucks and KFC. The staff at the hotel were a bit mixed. You had the receptionist who wanted to help you, but didn't know much, so you'd end up finding it out on your own. And the breakfast ladies were a bit "sharp edged." You didn't want to make them angry, then there would be no breakfast for you. We had ordered a continental breakfast. So we were not expecting too much. There was bread and a toaster, jam, coffee, tea. And some cereal if I can remember correctly. The rooms were OK. I could only find two negative things about it. In my friends room the window was open when they came, and they were not able to move it one millimeter. It was stuck, so their room was pretty cold. The second thing was that we could hear this screaming noise every time we opened the water tap.
